description:
One of the best Burger Joint I have ever experienced 
Would highly recommend this diner 
The Owner Bill has been very helpful in making sure That I got the excellent services from his staff
Thanks for helping me again Bill

Ric M.
author: Ric M.

description:
What an experience!   I have walked by Orphan Andy's for years, but never ate there.  Today I decided to give it a try.

What an experience!  My coffee arrived with a long hair in it...not sure who's.  Had to ask for another cup.

The waiter was the most annoying man imaginable.   You know the type...bitter, acerbic old queen who thinks that he's witty, when he's just being annoying.   One could overlook his manners if he was a good server, but he isn't.   He delivered my food, but never returned to ask how if everything was okay, never refilled my coffee (had to ask twice), and I asked for my bill four times before I finally got it.  

The food was okay...but I will never return.
author: Mark W.

description:
My friends and I came here last night for dinner after a day in the city. There is limited seating but they give big servings of their dishes. I got the mushroom burger with potato salad which were delicious. I was able to try some of my friends meals as well. The onion rings were a bit oily, the chocolate chip pancake was very chocolatey but not too sweet, & the chili cheese fries had too much beans. 

I also got some food to go for my significant other. The fresh pork chops were a bit tough and we have not tried the spicy chicken wings yet. 

It was a decent meal for the price point. I would come back to this place if I am in the area again but I wouldn't make a trip down there just for the food.
author: Grace Y.

description: Orphan Andy's is the end of the road for a lot of nights, and what it lacks in terms of taste, it makes up for in terms of being open and serving things with a lot of cheese. My tuna melt wasn't anything special but it is exactly what i needed at 3 in the morning. There can be quite the wait though.
author: Misha T.

description:
A 24-hour diner in the Castro district. Truly, everyone must eat here (at least) once. The ambiance is excellent! I loved all of the stained glass, light fixtures and ceiling decor. This is a quaint diner with limited seating, so expect to wait for a table or bar top if you get there around busy hours. 2 of the 3 staff we encountered were lovely. The third must have been having a bad day or tired because she was very grumpy. We witnessed her behavior while we were waiting in line -when she asked us to move a few times - but otherwise didn't see her again after we had been seated.
We sat at the bar stools closest to the kitchen and ordered almost immediately after sitting down. Our server was nice, helpful and quick to get our drinks and waters. He even made the malted chocolate shake we ordered himself.

What we ordered:
Fish and chips - they were decent but were overall a poor value compared to the combo options with steak and shrimp. My boyfriend wished he had gotten a combo instead.
Mozzarella sticks - great! Order these!!
Patty melt - really good. Unlike many diner patty melt's, the hamburger portion was huge and it really tasted homemade. I would replace the cheese with American next time, but otherwise it was tasty.
Chili - it came with raw onions and cheese on top which was a nice touch. The chili itself was good but needed a few drops of hot sauce to bring it good flavor.
Fries - good and crunchy.
Malted chocolate shake - amazing! Highly recommend.

A lot of menu items looked and sounded great, and we will return to try them! So great to know that Orphan Andy's is always open after a long flight, a night out, or just because.
author: Bri T.

description:
Solid late night eats. I've only been here after midnight. My friend Kamil's favorite after-drinking place. I think it's pretty solid -- get in a late-night breakfast so you can sleep-in. 

Food wise I'd give it a 3.5. Nothing extraordinary but a lot of solid dishes. The space is smaller, I think it seats about 20-30 people right in the heart of Castro. So it's lively.
author: Young Y.

description:
Orphan Andy's is an experience. A colorful one. 

They say it's an SF institution and I'm glad I got to experience it while living in SF. I actually came here on whim. My bf finished up his tattoo next door at Castro Tattoo and we were hungry so we ate here for convenience. The smells were intoxicating next door as he was getting inked. 

I ordered the burger and he had a chicken strips salad. Most of the options were greasy and all were affordable. That was super pleasant to see! 

The portions here are huge! And greasy! It was the classic diner experience with a bit more Castro flair on the walls. If you look up there are colorful kites. 

The burger and coleslaw was a tad bit greasy for my liking. I could hardly  stomach the dish. My bf's chicken strips salad also looked like a major gut bomb.
author: Connie M.

description:
Dj served my family and I a plate (mushroom burger with fries) with a "2 inch Piece of Wood" cooked in with the French fries. I took a bite into it thinking it was a fry! I could have chocked or got a splinter in my throat. Dj had the meal re-made with out apologizing about the situation. Dj brought the meal back and brought the bill for us right after. Very rude, I haven't even started eating. Being in the service industry this is for one very bad customer service. He charged us for the burger and said he could not take it off the bill because they had to re-make it. The "Piece of Wood" should not have even been in my meal in the first place. 

We politely asked to Dj speak with a manager and Dj stated 

"I am the manager" 

Then Dj followed with 

"Actually, there is no management on duty. The owner who is the manager upstairs asleep and I cant wake him up". 

My family and I who are SF Natives come here often after a long day but after this evenings dinner and experience, Orphan Annie's will no longer have us for business.
author: Jacelyn B.

description:
Really good homemade diner food. I got the Sausage and Eggs with Biscuits and Gravy. It was amazing. 

A little pricier for diner food but super nostalgic.
author: Howie M.

description:
We have been to this restaurant twice now. Both times the food has been decent, exactly what you would expect from a diner-ish place.  The portions are huge which most would consider a great deal for the price. However, they do not have too many healthy options. 

We have tried the Big 2 (bacon, sausage, pancakes) and it was good. The pancakes are quite large and you can get chicken sausage and egg whites as a substitute which is a plus.  We have also tried the sloppy joe omelet (I know, but I just had to) which was decent but I do not see myself ordering it again.  It was a big sweet and was just sloppy joe meat topped with scrambled eggs. I preferred just eating the meat on the toast without the eggs (guess I should have just gotten a sloppy joe).

They are open 24/7 which is a plus if you happen to be hungry at odd hours.  We have only come for breakfast and the service here both times was very slow. It is a small place so I am assuming the kitchen must be just as small. The servers are always nice, just might not want to go here if you are in a hurry.  We have sat at the bar and at a table and the food takes equally as long to get to you.

We will definitely be back when we are in the mood for big breakfasts and possibly again to try the burgers that everyone posts on yelp.
author: Danielle B.

description: Came here with a group of five.   We all got our food in a timely manner and all of us agreed the food was excellent!   I had an omlete at it was loaded with spinach leaves and more bacon than you could wish for.   Very nice waiter as well.
author: John P.

description:
Only a few things about America make sense to me.
1) You can turn right on red
2) Hot sauce
3) 24HR FUCKING DINERS
It was Pride weekend. It was also 2am. I'd just spent 90min in a club watching 4 dudes dance to Cher in tiny blue booty shorts, and I was getting drunk-hungry. 

Given the circumstances, what's the best thing that could exist right now? Cue trumpets. It's Orphan Andy's 24hour Diner. And what was I going to order? A grilled cheese of course, with a side of mediocre pickles. Fuck yes.

This meal looks basic because it was. A grilled cheese with pickles isn't exactly going to win a Michelin star anytime soon, but sometimes life isn't about bougie food stars. It's about cheese. And mediocre pickles. Going in my belly, while I'm drunk. The french fries didn't hurt either.

It seems some other Yelpers aren't entirely satisfied with Orphan Andy's quality of eats, but I was perfectly satisfied with the food they placed in front of me as well as their menu selection and slightly-sassy wait staff. If this place means I can eat at 3am without my drunk-ass having to use a stove, then they get a fuck-yes from me.
author: Madeline S.

description:
I really really love this place! It is open 24 hours and serves really fantastic breakfast! 

I ordered the buttermilk pancakes and was not at all disappointed! They were big and fluffy and served with copious amounts of butter and syrup. I also tasted the french toast and that was delicious as well. I definitely need to go back because I saw that Orphan Andy's has great chicken fried steak! Yup, if you are in the Castro and craving either breakfast or some good ol' southern comfort food, definitely hit this place up! 

The waitstaff is super friendly and nice and sassy! The restaurant itself is in a nice area of the Castro and even though they were super busy since it was during the street festival, we were seated quickly and approached to get our orders in a very timely manner. 

I will definitely be back! But a word of caution, I've been in the Castro after bar hours wanting to eat there and they had a super long wait! So just be prepared if you want to eat there and it is right after the bars close because this is a well known spot and it gets crowded.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
This popular greasy spoon is an institution in SF's Castro district. Although it is not for me, it may suit you just fine.

At $13.75 the Grilled Chicken Breast on a Sourdough French Roll did not meet my expectations in any way whatsoever. Generally speaking when I order a grilled chicken breast sandwich it is one of the healthier choices on a menu, not here.

Accompanied by a mountain of their signature potato salad, I found the sandwich almost inedible.  With just the sight of it I could imagine my arteries clogging. The chicken breast was very, very greasy and tasted somewhat gamey. The French Roll appeared as though someone drenched it with grease or butter.  Its desirability plummeted even further when I discovered the soggy roll was heavily coated with mayonnaise as well.  So much for what I assumed was the healthy option through grilled chicken. 

Maybe there are still better choices yet to be discovered here. That said, I can say with certainty, it will not be me making them.
author: Caesar A.

description:
Just do NOT order any of their burgers.  They are sizeable at 8 oz. but you could easily tell they were just a frozen slab thrown on the fryer.  A real burger would be formed by hand from a batch of ground beef mixed with onions, spices, etc.

That said, all of their side dishes (soups, potato salad, etc.) are fantastic.

I had order remorse; should have ordered a basic sloppy joe.  Breakfast served all day if you're in the mood for that.  Those items are also great.
author: David T.

description:
I came to the restaurant at 10 am on Sunday and when I arrived there was no line to get in and there were open seats at the bar and tables. I took a seat at a table and the server asked me how many were in my party and I said just me. I was told that I had to sit a the bar due to tables are reserved for more then one parson. This is not posted anywhere in their establishment and since when is it ok to discriminate against a customer simply because I was alone. 
I am a business owner and would never insinuate such a thing. 
I will not be returning and I will let me associates and friends know how I was treated.
author: Lawrence M.

description:
I love me this cozy 24 hour diner! The best items in their menu are their pancakes. Omg their pancakes are out of this world! They're huge, fluffy with a generous dollop of butter. 

Their waitstaff are always warm and charming. The people watching is excellent. Never a dull meal.
author: Caroline N.

description:
This place was the perfect little diner - brought 4 kids and did just fine sitting at the counter and eating some really quick and delicious food.

Had the club sandwich. So good and the kids enjoyed a short stack of pancakes, a grilled cheese with bacon and my fiancée had a nearly perfect tuna melt.

Great location in the Castro, super friendly and loved finding this place.
author: Bob K.

description: This place deserves higher than 3.5 stars. A San Francisco icon, always reliable, always open.  Much better than other dinners, and the staff is mucuh more polite than let's say Tommy,'s joint.  Had the chicken steak which was awesome and quick.
author: josh d.

description: Great late night after the bar place to eat it's always bright alive and open 24/7. So if you need to get your grub on when everything is closed stop by it's always busy.
author: RICHARD J.

description: Feels like a Castro institution that takes you back to the 1970s. Tried the burger - which was great. Got the impression the whole menu would not disappoint.
author: Greg V.

description:
I wanted to like this place, because the portions were good and the food was decent enough. However, I had three big issues with it when I went last weekend.

First, I was really frustrated with the pricing of an omelette I ordered. I ordered an egg-white omelette ($9.50) with some chicken. Turns out I was charged $10.75 for some chicken in my omelet. That was more expansive than the omelette itself! How is that possible and why did I not get a warning about this? "Hey, by the way, that side you're adding to your omelette will literally double the price." Nope didn't get that. Even Chipotle warns you when you get guac, and that's only $2.50! I was told it's because it's considered an entire chicken breast on the side (which it wasn't even that much chicken.) But even so, who charged that much for a piece of chicken?

Second, we were seated at the bar initially and wanted to switch over to a regular table seat once it become available. We were told we couldn't do so because they were "technically" separate restaurants, which of course doesn't make sense. What he really meant was - if you switch to tables, I won't get my tip. That was frustrating as well. 

Third, we waited a long time for food!

Frustrating experience overall.
author: Francisco G.

description:
This is an amazing hole in the wall diner in the Castro.  When I say amazing, I mean amazing. Did I say amazing?  OMG AMAZING!!  Lol this place is so good, I came back the next day. This is a must try in my book. 

On my first visit I had the country fried steak with a side of biscuits and gravy.  The steak was perfect with just the right amount of crunch on the batter.   Day two I went hard and ordered the stuffed french toast. Double .  This was french toast stuffed with cream cheese and spiced apples. No syrup required. 

Side note, we waiter we had really was extremely personable and made our breakfast feel like a meal with a old friend. 

Just keep eating!
author: Adam A.

description: Had to drive here at 1130pm from San Jose for steak and eggs. Dennys never hits the spot. Service is always great and the atmosphere is magical. Get here early, because it can get busy pass 1am.
author: James V.

description:
A quaint and cute little diner in the Castro area of San Francisco. Fried chicken and pancakes, French fries, burgers, & salads are what we sampled. Nice staff and my drink was never empty. I love this part of Americana.

See you next Tuesday !

Happy Eating :)
author: Ric H.

description:
This place is very adorable! Was my favourite place to eat during my time in San Fran. 

Seeing as they're open 24 hours their menu holds a vastness of dishes for whatever time of the day you need to eat. Including lots of sweet options and even a "healthier meals" section as well!!

We mainly ate here at breakfast time before kicking on with the day. Their three egg omelettes are amazing!! They're huge and delicious. The fillings are also quite generous and tasting fresh. On another note you have a choice of an included side of either hot cakes (AKA pancakes) or toast with fries. Had hot cakes each time and the amount of food put in-front of you, you will have a surprise reaction!! The hot cakes are like a whole another meal in themselves.... which you also receive fountain maple syrup. 

We've also had the fresh toast for something sweeter later in the night. And was just as delicious!! Once again was generous and cooked amazingly. Very soft and sweet and well satisfying. 

Truly love this place. The staff are very friendly and sometimes quite entertaining. There is also a jukebox in the corner to request your favourite songs. The only downfall about the place is it's a very small space with limited booths, so if it's busy you may have to wait in a queue to be seated, unless there's space at the bar. Aside from that a fantastic laid-back and comfortable diner experience right here!!
author: Marcus K.

description:
I've been I  the Bay area for 6 years now and I didn't eat at Orphan Andy's until a couple months ago and I have to say the people really make it an awesome experience! The first time I came there were so many different customers from all over the world as well as some locals.

I decided to eat at the bar because it was pretty packed and the gentlemen working the bar was so awesome. He had such a jovial attitude and the best personality. If there was a face that he didn't know in the diner he would make some time to get to know them and really make it stick. They even started playing some Christmas music in the middle of breakfast service and it just added some extra quirk.

Now the food. It's diner food so there's that. Classic American with big servings! It's not fine dining, but it's good for it's bracket. Last time I had the steak and eggs with a side of biscuits and gravy. The steak was cooked just like I wanted, the biscuits were buttery and the gravy was really wonderful. This time I got the stuffed French toast and a side of sausages. The toast was great and it wasn't giving me cavities like the ones at IHOP.

If you're in the Castro for whatever reason stop by and take a seat for some great company and good feels. They're open 24/7 so it's worth a drop no matter what the time.
author: Philip M.

description:
to be honest with you, I really like this place.
me and my girlfriend were here during our walk to the Castro.
I ordered fried chicken (comes with chicken vegetables soup, fries or mashed potato, and blanched green beans.
the chicken soup has no chicken, green beans were just okay.
but the fries and fried chicken were tasty and really good.
I really like them so much!
my girlfriend enjoyed her Turkey Melt as well, she's happy and full :)
author: Rudy H.

description:
Orphan Andy's is your 24-hour-drunk-stop you venture to in SF Castro area. Coming in here around 4 a.m., Orphan Andy's is a very cute diner spot filled with lots of and lots of late-night people. 

We had some minestrone soup, fries, potatoes and guacamole. I really enjoyed the atmosphere in Orphan Andy's a lot more than the food, but it was nice to find a clean lil spot within the area where we could chill and munch on some food before heading home.

Orphan Andy's has some amazing ceilings, very eclectic and full of hanging icicles and butterflies. The icicles change lighting preference and it's a cool concept in such a tiny space. They were also decked out with Valentine's Day decor and I just love that sappy stuff.

The menu was very carnivore-heavy, which is why me and my friend didn't get much. They have a full breakfast menu and some hot sandwiches that look good, if you're up for it. 

Definitely come here if you need a place to get some food in your yum before ending your night. Most late-night food joints in SF close at 3 a.m. so if you miss those, you have a place to come that will serve you up some nice, hot food.
author: Carly Q.

description:
I wish I could give a place over 5 stars. 

I love Orphan Andy's. LOVE. 

If you want somewhere fancy, this is not the place for you. If you want great food any time of the day or night, this definitely is the place for you. The whole staff is lovely and we've always fully enjoyed our experiences here. You never know who's going to be in here - we've seen some people in incredible full drag as well as families and couples. Everyone is welcome, which is great in a general location where some can feel a bit isolated or unwelcome - that's never the case here. 

Get the chocolate chip pancakes. Trust me. And look out for the dolphin art - it's truly one of a kind. ;)
author: Hannah P.

description:
After a night of drinking, I needed a second dinner. (Or maybe this was my third dinner? I can't quite remember.) My group of three stopped by on Thursday, March 30th around 1:15am. We were seated at a booth.

*Big 2: 2 eggs, 2 strips of bacon, 2 link sausages, coffee ($12.10), 2 pieces french toast (+$2)
*Jalapeno burger: lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle, and mayonnaise, 7 oz black Angus beef patty ($10.75), Dinner salad (+$2.85), add Pepper jack (+$2), Bacon 2 pc (+$1.95)
*French dip on sourdough french roll: potato salad ($11.55)
*French fries ($3.95)
*Onion rings ($5.20)
*Coffee: peerless fresh ground, decaf ($2.70)

I got the burger. It definitely hit the spot as I needed something greasy and cheesy. The burger patty was a touch dry though. Nothing some ketchup couldn't fix. Being the veggie lover I am, I asked for a salad as my side instead of the usual french fries. In the ended it didn't matter as we ordered a side of fries and onion rings anyways. The fries we okay. A little thicker than I prefer. The onion rings were crispy, but I found the batter to be too much. The onion basically came out when I bit into the onion ring. Everyone else seemed to enjoy the dishes they ordered.

Good option for late night eats as it's open 24 hours.
author: Elena N.

description: Been here twice before 2 separate performances at the Castro for the SF Sketch Fest. Great both times. The place is a little small so getting a table can be an issue. We sat the counter both times. Would be great to get a table, one by the window maybe, next time.
author: Leung T.

description:
This is by far my favorite place to eat in San Francisco- it's 24/7. (Although I only go here at night)

Orphan Andy's holds a special place in my heart. It's cozy, well decorated, and serves fantastic food. If you're concerned about the pricing, I suggest that you split your meal with someone because the portions are HUGE. This place is convenient, quick, and has yet to disappoint. 

They recently added a jukebox to give off a fun vibe. 

While I wouldn't exactly go out of my way to get breakfast here, it still smacks at 4 am.
author: Kailey H.

description: Great friendly service and even better food. And it's 24 hours! I will definitely be returning next time I'm in SF (:
author: Quinn B.

description:
24 hours. Came on a Sunday morning so it was busy. Didn't wait too long to sit at the counter. The staff is very pleasant and they can be chatty if you prefer.

I ordered the spinach omelette along and selected the hotcakes as the side. The hotcakes were very good, soft and a bit fluffy. The omelette was a little overdone, but had a good amount of spinach in it. 

The only issue I had was the on/off service...yea it was busy....the food took awhile to come out....and also my food was sitting there for a couple of minutes waiting to be delivered.
author: Spencer H.

description: Open 24 hours and it's delicious! I'm watching the server giving ice water and leftovers to homeless coming in and it's making me all teary-eyed.  Inorderd the pork chops, they don't salt and pepper them on purpose. Juicy and nice fat trim was a treat. Just added salt and pepper and dipped in maple syrup and I was pleasantly very impressed. Hughes portions. My SO ordered the Big 2 - two pancakes, 2 bacon strip actually 3, 2 sausage, 2 eggs, and coffee. Price is great for the quality of meat.
author: Shiho F.

description: The service from Robbie was outstanding and apparently he just started working there. I was disappointed with the fish sandwich. Was pretty crispy, came 2 pieces, not one whole. It was pretty difficult to eat..just fell apart on me. I loved the atmosphere as it is an old-fashioned dinner. They are currently decorated for the holiday season, it was super cute!
author: Val M.

description: The potatoes were horrid when I bit into them my entire appetite was over . The service was good of course . Not so much the food . Try a new cook maybe . Wasn't worth my money .
author: Breanne M.

description:
It is what it is. A hole in the wall greasy spoon. This place has been here forever serving up diner favorites. 

They offer a full breakfast and lunch menu. The food is consistent. 

I imagine this joint would be hopping after midnight.
author: Clint E.

description:
If you are going here solely for the food, then don't set your expectations too high. It is a simple place in that regard. Orphan Andy's shines in the atmosphere/community department. The gentlemen working the counter are great. The prices are fairly reasonable and it is close to the subway. 

You cannot have a more San Francisco dining experience than Orphan Andy's.
author: Bai B.

description: This is a great late night hot spot after a night out in the Castro district. The chicken and waffles were excellent and could really feed 2 people if you wanted to share a plate. We also had an omelette for our table that we split as well. It really hits the spot and the butterflies on the ceiling are adorable.
author: Nicole D.

description: Had a party of 7 and the service was amazing.  Food portions were ginormus and delicious.  Definitely coming agaon. Highly recommend
author: muftia k.

description:
I have never been treated so badly in my life. Maybe it was because I was the only black person in this establishment, as my friend sitting at the same table was treated perfectly fine while I got attitude and rudeness from the moment I sat down. The service was horrible and the waiter was so busy being rude to me that he messed up how our checks were meant to be split. 

The food we ordered was fine but the rude waiter left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Dee M.

description: This is an indispensable San Francisco experience. At some point in your life, you should definitely wind up at Orphan Andy's, and take in one of the last bastion's of un-gentrified, un-filtered, crazy San Francisco. Get packed into a tiny room with all manner of eccentrics, kooks, and drug fiends. The food is authentic greasy spoon, and the breakfast is delicious, thanks to unspeakable volumes of butter. Don't come here looking for an artisanal burger or seeking a pristine lettuce experience. The staff is tired, from having their compassion tested on a daily basis, but they're all genuine sweethearts. The only thing preventing 5 stars is that it's worn and a little dirty, as all busy 24/7 diners tend to be.
author: Gregory F.

description: This is a really cool restaurant and it's open 24 hours! They have great breakfast, I love the hot cakes, and the bacon so good you can smell it frying from blocks away. They also have very BIG and tasty burgers that are reasonable priced (heck it's cheap for SF). The staff is always super friendly and just an overall great place to enjoy a meal
author: Joe C.

description:
Really liked this spot, stopped here with the family for a quick lunch. Very reminiscent of a New York diner, with a little bit more sass. Nice owner who was present and very attentive, and really great service from the rest of the staff. We were there for about an hour and saw them constantly busy tidying, prepping and taking care of customers. Clearly a small and efficient business with people who work there to give great service.

Seats about 40 people, maybe. Mostly in booths plus an additional 10 seats at the counter. Menu is pretty broad and diner-tastic, and food came out really quickly. We had a couple versions of grilled cheese, a turkey club, and the tuna melt. All really great classic fare. Highly recommend the tuna melt...no funny business in the tuna salad (ugh: relish is the worst)... just good old-fashioned tuna, mayonnaise and celery.

Great Yelp find and we will definitely be back.
author: Shannon E.

description:
24/7 open, Orphans Andy never fails. Ideal for having late dinner. In my case I'm used to having dinner at 10pm which is a nightmare in San Francisco if you plan on eating out. 

They have some awesome options, I can recommend the Philly steak!
author: Martin C.

description: why do you disrespect your customers? Your staff has slowest service with the attitude of self entitlement and grandour
author: Rob K.

description:
One of the best damn French dips you'll find in the city, and very affordable. Quaint in an old SF/ gay way, they make you feel at home and even entertained by the occasional dramas. Service is efficient and responsive, and be forewarned that (if you are a dude of any persuasion) you'll probably be flirted with by another dude. 

Anybody trying to cook diner food in this city should come here and learn how to make it.
author: T J.

description: Set in the Castro District of San Francisco, this quaint busy eateries is one of SF's finest. They serve a wide variety of American fare 24 hours a day. It's a busy restaurant with a small seating area, so be prepared to wait a little. Prices are reasonable and the service top notch.
author: Noel I.

description:
I love this place because it's 24 hours 7 days a week it's been here since I was a kid so we're talkin 53 years ago
LoL it's in the Castro it gets very popular especially at night,  we ordered the double cheese Black Angus burger with fries it's a big portion for $13.05 it was so much I took it home and ate it the next day for lunch. 
Now they do have turkey burgers and they have a huge turkey salad that you can at least have it for two meals or share it with someone it was really big.
The waiters are very nice very quick with the food Citi credit cards debit cards cash what if you come during the night on the weekends the drinking hour you will deal with few drunks. 
So be advised they're just loud they're not bothering anyone it's just annoying,But it's a small place and it gets very busy and everything is hot and fresh. Thanks for Reading ~Lizzie~ :)
author: Lizzie G.

description: Best pancakes, great service, lovely diner vibe. Doesn't get more San Francisco than this.
author: Mitchell L.

description: Let me just say this if u dont like it job quit....light skinned gay guy has got to be the shitty people he literally was making sure he was keeping his lil boyfriend in the corner happy instead of his customers.....the ones that are paying to keep a roof over his head....i will not be coming too this place again
author: A W.

description: By no means is this high quality food, but still, for greasy diner food that's open really late (does it even close?) it's pretty great. I love that there is a spot where I can guarantee I can have greasy fries at 2 am. And the decor is adorable. It's a pretty perfect late night drunk spot. This place is a gem and neighborhood institution.
author: Erin W.

description: I have been coming to Orphan Andy's for years . I usually get the Garden Omelette with extra mushrooms and cheddar cheese .  I get home fries and wheat toast .  It is almost too much food . It is FABULOUS !  You can't get this quality and large portions of food for around $15 anywhere in the Castro ( or anywhere ) .  Of course like any restaurants, I have had a couple ' not so good ' experiences but I have been coming to Orphan Andy's for 20 years .  The best food in the Castro !
author: Scottie I.

description:
Every week day morning, I walk by Orphan Andy's around 5-515 in the morning. From time-to-time i walk-in and have breakfast before I go to work. Today, I walked in at 5 am and was told they were closed and don't open until 6 am. There was a customer inside and the place looked like a dump. I'm saddened by this because I live in the neighborhood. I've attached pics that state the hours are different from what the employee stated. 

1-Star because I didn't complain about the service I received the last time I had breakfast. I've always liked coming here. Big business coffee shop got my business this morning, sad I had this experience.
author: Perry P.

description:
Forgot to take a before picture but chicken fried steak w/egg and pancakes . 
Pretty bomb food, little hole in the wall. Staff is so friendly and the food came out with reasonable time. Definitely recommend, everyone's good looks so good
author: Kathie A.

description: Ordering to go and they want to rush us out and not let us explain our order.  AWFUL customer service and acts like they don't want our money. If that's the case we'll go somewhere else. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE WITH YOUR MONEY!!!!! The staff pictured were so rude, had an attitude about everything!
author: Jillian J.

description:
When I was younger I visited San Francisco several times to visit relatives but it wasn't until just recently that I was here strictly as a tourist. With that freedom there were several areas I wanted to see for the first time. Among them was the Castro District.

My friend and I took the Muni streetcar from downtown to the end of Mission. By the time we got there it was already late morning and we were both hungry. We saw Orphan Andy's as soon as we got off the Muni but we wanted to walk the main section of Castro Street before deciding on a place to eat. Frankly I was surprised how few there are.

So we headed back to where we started. Orphan Andy's serves breakfast all day and by now it was after traditional breakfast time.

Their menu is pretty stock, not much in the way of specialties and nothing at all that couldn't be found in any breakfast diner in America.

I opted for French Toast stuffed with cream cheese and apple compote, dusted with powdered sugar.  Since I'm a meat-eater I ordered a side of sausage links.  While there's not a lot to say about the French Toast other than it was good, it was hard for me not to notice the size and thickness of the sausages.  I imagine they must be a very popular menu item. I actually imagined a lot of things about them, not overlooking in any way that there were four of them, all equally huge, meaty and juicy. And tasty ... especially tasty.

I was convinced I couldn't handle them all but we were in no hurry and after relaxing for a while I managed to stuff them all in.

We were serviced well, friendly and with a smile and I had all I could drink.

The cost was just slightly on the high side but I don't mind paying if I'm satisfied.  I'm ready to come again.
author: Todd H.

description: The location is great and the fact that it's always open makes it mine and my friends go to place. Especially in the Castro.
author: Allyson M.

description:
The ratings don't work right for this place. Have I experience better? Certainly. But at 2am for a quick bite did it do the trick? Yes. Medicore milkshake (it tasted like they added sweetener or they're using some nasty ice cream or a mix), flat out bad french dip sandwich (the meat looked like it was printed out on paper), and ok onion rings. 

Good service, quick, reasonable prices.
author: Ryan B.

description:
You are better off controlling your hunger until morning. Not advise for late night dining.

Cleanliness is not one of its hallmarks.

I never thought a hamburger could taste so gamWu.

Not going back , staff was friendly but there needs to be more effort , it's not the 1970s anymore.
author: William B.

description: Good when ur drunk but we arrived around 9pm it's 45 mins wait for the food when it's not really busy, I don't think so, and when we ask about our food they said another 15 mins I have to walk out
author: Wendell P.

description:
The nostalgia in this place is amazing and wish there were more still around. The service for breakfast and lunch is extremely pleasant.The quality the cook puts into his food which you could taste the love.
   A must stop for breakfast and a quick bite late at night since it's a 24 hour joint.
author: Jon O.

description: This is a great little dive in the Castro neighborhood! I can remember ending up here many times to eat in the middle of the night when I was young and still in need of a café at three in the morning. Now that I am older, I still love to go, but at a more reasonable time of day. Good old-fashioned American fare and a strong cup of coffee...anytime you go, you will find great personalities and good food to keep you going!
author: Ryan W.

description: I'm not really sure how to rate this place. It is exactly as advertised. Good food, big portions, and open all night. We had to contend with a homeless woman standing over us as we ate but she wasn't scary. The vibe was fun and it was an overall good experience.
author: Kim M.

description: Use to be favorite place to eat in the Castro and after 10 years I come back for breakfast.  It has not changed in manner still looks the same.  The only issue one very friendly and helpful waiter and one snob waiter who just walking past me after set down. Look forward to having breakfast  here have many fond memories  of friends and many hours of chatting,  chatting and great meals. If you are in the area check it out and get the older waiter great personality.
author: Dennis C.

description: Exactly what you would expect from a diner. :) warm cozy feelings, hearty food, and 24/7!
author: Suyoon P.

description: Nice local diner in the heart of Castro.  Good for a decent basic meal and the service is friendly.  Décor was a lot of fun.
author: R D.

description:
Best banana chocolate pancakes ever! 
The service is Great a bit wild at 2am on a Saturday night but that comes with the territory everything was great! I can't wait to go back again I'm savoring those pancakes still  they legit melt in your mouth. We also ordered the cheeseburger and fries it was great as well! Everything came out fast for a crazy night and chaos at the door it was a great late night eats find in SF
author: Sarahi M.

description: Because reasons. I mean, can you put a price on being at the right place at the RIGHT time with a great chicken fried steak? No. But you can thank whatever faith you believe in, yourself (if you're a narcissist), or Orphan Andy's.
author: Kelly J.

description:
I ordered a country chicken fried steak with sunny side up and a french toast.
It was great food and great price !.  Staff were friendly and efficient.
author: Yoshio S.

description:
I used to go here a lot for an early breakfast and returned after going to my gym.
As usual, I ordered biscuits & gravy with a side of home fries.
The biscuits were light and fluffy and the gravy had a lot of meat. I made a mistake with the home fries because the plate was so large.  But the fries were very good.
I should have ordered hash browns.  Oh well, next time!
author: Philip C.

description: I went here late on night after going to the club.  They had good service, a very large menu, and delicious biscuits and gravy. I seriously crave them ALL the time. Will definitely be going back here soon.
author: Amanda S.

description: The Castro at its worst. Staff doesn't do anything to maintain a seating list when it gets busy, letting whomever crowd and jump the line. When asked what was up they just roll their eyes and walk away. Get a grip, it's an all-night diner, not Kensington Palace, jerks.
author: Aaron L.

description:
Yah, Well itsa CASTRO fixture. Reliable, Predictable and now Always open. Yup its a diner. Yup servers can be cranky, but most of the time very nice, Yup it is not the French Laundry. Yup, I love it! 

@ 17th Street & Castro its an institution. Like the Sausage Factory up the street.

Long live Orphan Andy's (I have always wondered if there was a real orphan Andy)...
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Open 24/7!!! The place is kind of small with a few tables and bar seating. The menu has a variety of food ranging from breakfast (eggs, bacon, sausage etc) to burgers and dessert. I came here at 4am to eat a chicken steak burger and fries. The food here is okay, service was good, and it's definitely better than going to Mc Donald's late at night. Average price for a plate was $10 and up.

Overall, great variety of food and open 24/7!
author: Corinna T.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. The food is good whether you're drunk or sober. They have the best French Toast, Pancakes, Bacon, Burgers, Onion Rings, etc. I recommend Orphan Andy's to anyone that likes good food. The service is great, sometimes the waiters mess up your order but that's ok because they'll let you have the extra food. The wait can sometimes be long since it is a smaller restaurant but definitely worth it.
author: Patricia G.

description: Abosolutely the worst experiemce I've ever had a restaurant. Decor is absolutely stunning and fabulous, especially at night. Came in and greeted with a reply to sit wherever like it was a chore for our server. Ok, maybe they just like doing things quick, no biggie. Ordering drinks was fine. Treated as absolute trash when ordering food, though. My fiancé was asking about the options available to him, but the server seemed like he just wanted to go back to looking at his grindr rather than serve customers. To top it off, he repeated "Super Salad" in the most condescending white way possible (my fiancé is from China which I suspect played a mojo role in his condescension) when my fiancé didn't hear him quite right. First restaurant that I've left no tip in, and the fact that our wedding is tomorrow makes this experience much more sour. Come here if you wanna be humiliated and demeaned for being too slow or curious; otherwise, stay the hell away.
author: Hunter E.

description:
This is the best place to have breakfast while visiting the city. The decorations are super cute and seasonally changed, the food is delicious, and the cafe is cute and cozy. We both chose the breakfast bagel, and they did not disappoint. The egg was flavorful, bacon cooked perfectly, and there was the right amount of cheese.
Our server was particularly accommodating, offering many tips on how to explore the city like a local resident. He was really friendly and clean, too!
If I'm ever in this area again, you can bet this will be my go to spot.
author: Ariel M.

description: This place is so charming. I love a cozy, old-fashioned diner. You can tell the people who work there mean well. I had a hard time deciding what to get because there is so much to choose from. I got the cod filet sandwich with potato salad on the side. I liked the meal. I'd come back here because it's a unique experience. Service was good as the waitress was nice.
author: Denise C.

description: We had great food here. Luckily it was right down the street from our hotel, a quick walk. Staff was friendly and eager to please. We had fresh fruit, eggs, sourdough, home fries. Coffee cups were always full. We will definitely return to Orphan Andys!
author: K R.

description: It's the cutest spot ever!!! I fell in love with their mash potatoes!! and their sides are big portions, they attended us super amazing!!
author: Lina A.

description:
I really like the iced water here. 

We ordered two bowls of chicken soup as it was recommended as the best of two soups they had. 

Hmmm. You know when you get to the bottom of the bowl and there are just some tiny shredded strips of leftover chicken? Well that's what we got. 

After confirming with the server the normal amount of chicken that goes in the soup, he mentions that it was from the bottom. Why would you serve that. Why would t you mix a new batch with the old part. 

After we were done with our soup, he did offer to bring some chicken from the back. Hahah. What?!?!

So like I said, I really liked the ice water. -smh

I really considered one star but the vegetables were decent in the lukewarm broth. 

Yeah. I really liked the ice water.
author: RobD F.

description:
Best pancakes I ever had. The Pancakes are why I come here and it should be for you too. 
I get the sunny side up eggs with some bacon and an order of Pancakes with a jar of their syrup and I am good! 

I tried the other dishes like burgers and such...eh...so so, but the pancakes... oh lord.

Very entertaining place to eat...once there was a completely naked skinny fella sitting eating at the next table to our table...HILARIOUS. You can't make this up.
author: Viet T.

description: As a regular I was highly disappointed with the service that I received. My regular server was HIGH & after we placed our order I was told it's a fucking order to get it right bitch. Will I be back yes, however these items need to be addressed and followed up with management.
author: Joe H.

description: Came in a while ago and I just have to say this place is so great and quirky. I love it. I brought my mom and boyfriend in and we sat down at he table next to the window and even though there was only one server, he was always attentive and really hospitable.. THE FOOD IS DELICIOUS AND COMES IN LARGE PORTIONS. And I mean that. We didn't even finish all of our food because there was so much. Also, they have a jukebox machine there too so I decided to play some good ole modern day Taylor Swift and the server came over and literally sat down next to me and we had a whole convo on her music lol. It was great. So I'll be back.
author: Luke E.

description: Open 24h and great chicken fried steak. Don't come her for a gourmet meal--just enjoy the atmosphere and your late night craving.
author: adam b.

description: I can't believe I'm just now discovering Orphan's Andy's. They're located super close to bars, shops, and muni in the Castro. Perfect nightcap with friends. Clean with a super nice staff. 10/10 would come again :)
author: Christie K.

description: Extremely small venue, the line was out the door.  The food and service was just okay.  Coffee was gross. I don't recommend
author: Shenna J.

description:
I came here on a Friday afternoon. I came into the restaurant, sat down, and was immediately greeted. Menus are already at all tables, which is convenient. My server was pleasant and helpful. The restaurant has about ten tables and a bunch of bar stools, and is cozy if a tiny bit cramped.

I ordered the banana hot cakes and a hot chocolate. Now here's where things get fun. My food literally came out five minutes after I ordered it. Fantastic turnaround time. Not only that, but the pancakes were some of the most delicious I've had; they were fluffy and light and blended perfectly with the bananas. The hot chocolate was, well, chocolatey, which is all you can ask for, really.

The next time I visit SF, I'll definitely return.
author: Jake A.

description:
Orphan Andy's is always reliable. The food is what you would expect from a 24 hour diner, but with its location at Castro and Market this spot has a cast of characters and the staff is always friendly and makes everything just right.

I visit San Fran several times a year and always make it a point to have an early morning breakfast here.
author: Jay L.

description: Food was adequate. Service wasn't great. The guy running the place was kind of snotty and we had to ask for the check twice. I know it's just a diner, but good customer service can go a long way.
author: Toni M.

description: I ordered an extremely well done burger and got a medium well done. Because the service was already horrible I didn't feel like interrupting the server from his lunch break to order a new "burger." If you like the taste of beef, then this is probably a 5 star on the food aspect. I, however, don't like the taste of beef and like to eat a hamburger as a hamburger and not as a salad. I had to eat this burger with a fork and knife. Then to make things worse. A soda, burger and fries was $20!!! Not worth it at all.
author: Candelario S.

description: Not much space in there you will be elbow to elbow if your at the bar. The food decent I'd say just barley a step above Denny's nothing special. But the feel of it is very homey.
author: Justin M.

description: This is my favorite spot in the area. People are friendly, respectful and the food is great. Always go there whenever I am in town.
author: E W D.

description: I would say the good things about this spot are: the hours of operation and the customers. The growing edges: the quality of the food is very low, the customer service is slow and the place is filthy. There's jam on the menus, tables aren't well cleaned... you get what i'm saying. The prices aren't cheap either! We were hoping for snack-like food in the middle of the night and there were only sides to choose from. They even charge like $1.65 for a side of jalepenos! Oh, but they do serve peerless coffee so that's good! They just don't have options for sweeteners or milk so be ok with white processed sugar and the milk sitting on your table (already sitting there before you even arrived). All this to say: I will probably be back mostly because of the location and hours.
author: Kaley B.

description: This place was nice.. My coworkers went here after work like around 1:30am and we came from santa clara but it was so worth-it. When i took a look at the menu it had so much stuff in it.. that i didn't know what to get. so i just chose what my eyes caught first. Ham and Eggs.. and let me tell you it was so fulfilling worth the drive and i was full.
author: Charmaine P.

description:
What is the point of being rude to your customers? Our waiter asked me what I wanted to drink. I said water, and that we were also ready to order. He grimaced, and told me that was too many syllables, and that I was mumbling. Then he walked off to take another table's order. Then he stood behind the counter for a few minutes. Then we left.

Oh, the chicken soup is pretty good. I might go back and order it sometime when that waiter isn't there.
author: Kevin W.

description: So nasty and rude service from Nancy. I've been in the food industry for years and I have never had such a disrespectful waitress in my life. Don't come here not worth the food nor the disrespectful service.
author: Ashley B.

description: The service is always fun with just a tinge of sass and the food hits the spo! It's fast and just what you need at the appropriate hour. When you order for pickup, the phone doesn't always work. But it's understandable as someone who works nights and understanding what the staff has to deal with that crowd who stumbles in from the local watering holes.
author: Stephen K.

description: Was here many years ago and have many fond memories of the staff that worked there in the 80's up to when I move to NC in 2010. Found the place had not change all the same as usual the food really good and plentiful but the service was very bad. After I arrive the young waiter kept going by me totally ignoring me so he could go and chat with his friends or tricks he was trying to pick up. Finally the older gentleman came and ask if the other waiter had waited on me and I said no he been ignoring me, this waiter did take my order and he was very pleasant, to be honest for the 45 minutes I was the the only one working was the older gentleman the young guy was way to busy trying to pick up tricks. I did not know you could pick up a hustler pretending to be a waiter at the restaurant with or without ordering a meal. This is the first time I saw such disrespect to customers that I saw today by the younger waiter he needs to be terminated and they hire another down to earth waiter like the older gentleman.
author: Dennis C.

description: Everything about this place is RIGHT.  Location, food, hours, casualness, staff, etc.  it is the diner you want whenever you want it!
author: Bea E.

description:
It is really unfortunate this is the only place open 24 hours in the Castro. I ordered a burger with two requests (no onions; no sauce). I got a burger with onions and mayonnaise. The server just looked at me and "sorry". He did not offer any solutions.

The servers aren't friendly, and food is your basic (poorly done) diner food.
author: Fabian M.

description: The perfect dinner breakfast. The pancakes are the single most incredible pancakes I have ever eaten - zero exaggeration. The atmosphere in the diner is truly magical and the staff there made me feel like I was chilling at a family dinner. So welcoming and so kind and so nice! Definitely a place to stop!
author: Joolia M.

description: Solid diner food, quaint ambiance, nice service. I ordered the omelette and it was wonderfully stuffed with mushrooms and made with real eggs. The ice cream was a blast from the past, double scoop with caramel; I felt like a kid again! I can believe this place has yummy melts and such, too. The home fries were tasty and I'm really picky about my potatoes. Chill spot to go chat and catch up with a friend over a nostalgic menu. I dig it.
author: Zara S.

description:
Food was okay,

Service was quick, and that was about it.

Before I even began eating my meal the waiter brought the bill, found it a bit unusual since it was 2AM and full at all.

After bringing the bill he didn't bother to refill the drinks or even check on the table for that matter. 

Like most places in SF, this place is a bit overpriced. $8 for a shake is just ridiculous. 

The only reason this place gets 3 stars is because their Blue Cheese burger was really good. Other than that it's a basic diner with decent food and service. Nothing special.
author: Iudi G.

description:
Oh this place is good good good! 

Late night eats in the Castro and this gem is there to save the day lol 

The cheeseburger was awesome. Real hamburger patties, not frozen. Huge portions!!! 

Staff are on point and attentive.
author: Heather T.

description:
Both times I've been to San Francisco I've eaten here and I don't know, maybe because we're both Andy, but I love this place.

First off- it's pretty damn small so if it you time it wrong, like peak breakfast time or when it's closing time at the bar, you're going to have to wait.

I've always been sober when I've eaten here and I can only imagine how much better it tastes when you're drunk. I mean, it tastes great sober so it has to be epic when you're drunk.

They sell t-shirts. I had to get one, It says Andy, duh.

The breakfast food is killer as expected. The home fries especially. Huge hunks of potatoes.

Let's not forget the service which is great. A bunch of very nice guys work there. They know how to run this place. They know how to get you in and out without rushing you or making you feel unwanted.

Next time I'm in town, I'll surely be back. I have to support my namesake.
author: Andy V.

description:
I ordered fish and chips takeout from Orphan Andy's during my lunch break. I was pretty disappointed. First of all, the fish was overcooked. The batter was too crispy and dark. Second of all and most importantly - I didn't even have the proper condiments for my order. Fish and chips should ALWAYS be served with Tarter sauce, lemon and MALT vinegar packages. 

All I got was tarter sauce. No lemon and no vinegar. They gave me mustard? wtf? I was also surprised that for the price it didn't come with a side of coleslaw. 

I gave it 3 stars because the staff working there was really nice, but I am just annoyed that I spent $14.50 on a dish that I couldn't even enjoy properly. Wasn't worth it to walk all the way back when my lunch break is only an hour. Probably wont come back here.
author: Rebecca F.

description: A step into the past. Very hearty breakfasts for a pittance. Nothing surprising, but solid. A can't miss
author: Jim S.

description:
After going out with my friends, we decided to go here just because it was one of the few restaurants that was open 24 hours. We waited about 20 minutes in line and about another 15 minutes for our food. The service was very slow so I don't recommend coming here after 2-3am.

The food I got was breakfast bagel. It was alright. Nothing special except it was over priced.

Would I come back here again? Hmm.. I don't know...
author: Aj C.

description:
My friends and I stopped in here for dinner after a show at the Castro. I was starving and ordered the chef salad which was delicious and HUGE! Get it with grilled chicken - the chicken was cooked perfectly and falling apart. Yum!!! Ended up taking half of the salad home.

Another thing is really liked was that while we were in there, a couple of people came in who looked like they were...down on their luck, and they were served food and the woman working the counter asked this woman how her day had been and treated her like a real human being. That was really nice to see. This place is a real class act.
author: Lori L.

description: My partner and I love this place. It is  an institution in Castro. I've been coming here since 1978. You can always rely on Andy's to serve you a big juicy burger. I think they're best at 2am. Breakfast is everything you've come to expect from a classic American diner. If you're in the City for the night, Orphan Andy's should be on your "must visit" list.
author: Charles S.

description:
I just don't think that you can go wrong here. Yes, Michael will give you attitude but its part of the campy fun.
Where else can you get a classic American breakfast with Pancakes, sausages, beverage toast or potatoes for less than thirteen dollars?
We try to go every Sunday and I always look forward to it. There is absolutely NO fussiness on the menu as nearly every other restaurant in SF. I frankly don't care if the jam is "Sonoma sourced." I do care that I don't have to pay $4 for a cute jar of hand crafted marmalade. Similarly, you are not going to get Quebec maple syrup. You'll have Aunt Jemima, thank you.
The food is delicious and very filling. You get big portions. 
The place is small and there is always a line on weekends. A classic Diner, this place must be in all the guidebooks (for good reason) as during the tourist season lots of Europeans are there.
Open 24 hours. Though I don't go at night, I'm sure its hopping when the bars close.
author: Andreas M.

description: Fave, forever forever. These folks are so pro and an absolute blessing as a service industry worker who gets off work late and doesn't want crap food. I've been going to this place for 11years now and it's always been my favorite 24hour spot, no one holds a candle to the coziness. Wear my T-shirt to work, rock my mug at home, always recommend.  Long live and long love orphan Andy's, real sf
author: Demitria R.

description: Decided to hop in for some breakfast one random day and ordered their turkey club with potato salad. It was a very nice sandwich and the portion was just right. Nice quaint place right outside Castro Muni station. Will come again!
author: Roger F.

description:
Great food, only in town for a couple days, but will definitely go again if I get the chance. Had breakfast at 7:30 one morning and 4:30 the next. It was packed at 4:30! 
Ordered the same thing both days: Denver omelette, sourdough toast, coffee and fresh OJ. All wonderful!
author: Diana G.

description:
I hate writing bad reviews, considering there are millions of children dying in the world from hunger, and the fact that I was able to eat, makes me feel blessed. 

Ordered this vile mushroom ham onion omelet which came after a long time and it was so cold. 

The fact that it costs $11 or so, I just feel it should have at least been hot. Michael's eggs were inedible.

I used to come to this place and it used to be great. I don't know what has happened over the years, but they need to up their game.
author: Nicholas H.

description: I walked in and placed an order. 20 min later I inquired on my food only to be rudely told, would you like to just cancel your order? I asked had my order been submitted. Again I was asked, would you just like to cancel it? I left and will never eat here ever again!
author: Bradley V.

description: Good local spot in the Castro district. Took my gf to this area since she loves the LGBT culture and we found this place and figured why not for a quick brunch. I had the big 2 which was eggs bacon sausage and pancakes the gf had a chocolate milkshake and some potato salad. The service and pricing was good, the portions were good size and the shake was one of the best I've ever had. Only complaint were the pancakes didn't taste as enjoyable here but overall good eat.
author: Nicolas J.

description: Really good food & service.. We ordered a lot of food at 5am & they came pretty fast.. The hot wings were the best I've had in forever! The spinach feta omelette was slightly bland but still cooked well. Nothing a little salt, pepper & hot sauce couldn't fix.. Everything else was seasoned well & tasted great! We'll definitely revisit when we're on this side of town.. Fabulous 24 hour spot!
author: Anjeneau W.

description: Fast! Reasonably priced New York-style diner in the Castro district. Open late. Friendly service and big portions. Top notch.
author: Dave F.

description: When is  almost 2am and you need a place  to find a snack after working a long case at UCSF, this is the place to go! They had the best grilled cheese and apple pie ala mode! And eclectic variety of patrons that visit were all so nice to hang out with, like you already knew them.
author: Kim H.

description: I've never had a good experience here. The Castro's long-standing greasy spoon offers decent enough service, however the weak point is the food. The food ranges between mediocre/bland to awful. The upside is that if you're out at the bars and clubs in Castro, this place is open 24 hours. Just don't expect anything tasty or enjoyable during any of those 24 hours. Be forewarned, using the unglamorous bathroom requires you to walk through the kitchen...and wash your hands in the kitchen's prep sink. Blerg!!
author: Caleb H.

description: Tiny little diner style restaurant. Open 24 hours. Friendly staff, the food came out quickly since it was mid afternoon. Food was decent. Will come back for a malt!
author: Justin P.

description: I love that they are open 24 hrs. Best place to grab a grilled cheese at 3 in the morning. Friendly staff.
author: Bill E.

description: The steak, eggs, and potatoes were all quite bland - perhaps they figure best to let people season and add sauces to their own tastes - and the steak was about one-third chunks of fat. The service was attentive and friendly, though, and the coffee was surprisingly decent for a bottomless cup at a diner (used to very weak coffee at other like-establishments).
author: I Like T.

description: Great atmosphere, place very clean, old and nostalgic decor.   I ate here at 8pm which was outside of rush hour. Double cheeseburger and onion rings were the best I have had in quite come time. Table next to me had breakfast- biscuits and gravy that looked wonderful. Highly recommend this diner
author: Scott S.

description: The concept of "next person in line" doesn't exist in this restaurant. 14 people have managed to butt in line under the premise of "i'm invited to table X" or "im staff" or "I'm just going to the restroom"... Don't expect to get a table if you're visiting. Only locals can get in here...
author: Mike S.

description: Really enjoyed the vibes hear the food was delicious pancakes were the bomb I had ordered banana pancakes and my coworkers had ordered a veggie burger and regular hamburger it was awesome! Tim/Timothy he was super super awesome I honestly felt so comfortable eating there especially with his energy he recommended pancakes and they taste amazing I really enjoyed the service completely 100000 star :)
author: Lei S.

description: If you're paying a visit to Castro, this is the type of place you would enjoy with friends. With the vibe of an old school restaurant, it's great for brunch. These guys are quick to serve, too! My friend and I each ordered a Big 2 (about $12). It came with two bacon, two sausages, eggs, two pancakes (swap this out for french toast for an extra cost), and the choice of tea or coffee. The pancakes and the french toast are both great choices. It just depends on what you're feeling and if you're willing to give up a couple of extra bucks for it. Believe me, it truly was a big meal, a tasty one too!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Awful service, mediocre food, great hours. Typical diner food, but the waiter was the worst I've had -- slow and rude. Basically, ignored our table.
author: Joe G.

description: Visited Orphan Andys today and a server/manager named Joe was rude to us. Going to avoid going there for awhile. Vote with your pocketbook.
author: Daniel D.

description: Had a great lunch here today along with great service from Marcus.  Guacamole Burger with pepper jack hit the spot.  Will be back to try breakfast.
author: Frances B.

description: The service here is OK, depending on who you get. One of the servers can be a bit snippy and rude to customers, which is a big turn-off to me. They don't do a very good job at keeping your coffee filled, either. I've only been here a couple times. The cheddar cheese omelette I had was overcooked, but it had a good amount of cheese in it. The home fries (potatoes and onions, I believe?) were extremely greasy and upset my stomach. But the amount of food you get for the price is pretty good.
author: Charlie L.

description:
tuesday 2-20-18 5:57pm
orphan andys is incorpirated.  can you believe that?  no.  it is.  take a look at your reciept.

new in town or a regular to the famous castro we all know orphan andys was a good place for a basic meal years ago.  

the price is too high for crappy food but its apparently still  is the place to go for "sober up food" or lonely depresed singles.  this time they have a new employee who is the definition of a millennium.  lazy and entittled.

today the food remains very basic and ay least today the boy standing behind the counter was a lazy bitch.  the other real lady was doing  all the work.  he ate and sat down...nothing more.  no kidding.

i ordered and watched him eat behind the counter believing i would get my soda before he finushed his meal but i was wrong.  he took food to one table the whole time i was there while the lady busted her butt working.  its a shame the lady said nothing to him while i was there.  he needed to hear it.  i asked the lady for my soda while he stuffed his face and she knew i wanted my soda before i finished my sentence and got it-again while he stuffed his face.  

a cod fish sandwich,  cheese sticks and a soda $26.20 no tip of course.  both the cod and the cheese sticks were over cooked and i left most of the food on the plates unable to eat it because it was over cooked.   sadly i realized the cook was observing the  seating area and she knew.  she had yo know.   the guy next to me left most of his food and politely refused a doggie back as did i.  i would not feed my dog the food served there.

sadly you expevt the food ay prphan andy's to be bad and over priced but when  the service is terrible you just dont go back.

it was the place to go because its open 24 hours..  no other reason draws in customers.  

seeing that the lazy boy went out of his way to not work certainly will keel them away.
author: John D.

description: Great option when it comes to late night dining. Had a Philly cheesesteak, mozzarella sticks, and French toast. Small, cozy, and friendly atmosphere. Very quick service... Will come back!
author: Ray S.

description: The malted milkshakes are delicious! The french fries are good. The breakfasts are decent. The burgers are horrible. Unless you want a patty, that tastes frozen, that is raw on the inside order your burger ar least medium well
author: Manny F.

description: My family and I have been coming here for years. Late night, early morning, OA's has been great for a long time. No more. Came here tonight and the food was inedible. Fries that weren't  fried, patties burnt to a crisp, horrific dressing. So sad.all those 2 am burgers and early eggs are done.  And...it took ages to get inedible crap. The guy behind the counter says: Yeah, the "cook" doesn't know what the hell he's doing.  Yet he didn't offer any recompense for swill he admitted was inedible. What's that tell you? The guy taking your order tells you the guy cooking your order is a boob. Ill confirm that the "cook" is a disaster. Sad day. But this place is done till that cook is toast.
author: Bryan S.

description:
Been here several times especially for late night dining.  Food is decent; I usually get the Ruben although a little on the greasy side. Staff WAS nice so I always came back and always brought friends that have never been to this diner. 

On this particular night in question a little white boy named "The Chad" forgot he's in the SERVICE industry or fell and bumped his head because he was extremely rude. Like rude rude. I was really taken by his immediate aggression towards me like as if he was too busy to actually do his job. He rudely told me that I needed to get out of the way because I was in it...Um excuse me!? A simple excuse me I'm coming through doesn't take much effort.. well apparently for "The Chad" it did. That of course set me off with a matching attitude but I decided to leave and never come back. 

There are several restaurants, with better service, better atmosphere and easy on the wallet/purse in the immediate vicinity so I suggest management start an intense customer service training and take their employees back to the basics since "The Chad" is already basic anyway and remind them customer service is crucial to their paychecks, girl bye!
author: Bobby B.

description: Came here after bar hopping for some much needed food and water. The restaurant was super busy and The waitress was so friendly, she made room for us to come sit at the bar. I had the cheese burger and fries It was delicious. Great food, will definitely go again.
author: Adrian C.

description:
Yeah, I loved this place.  It's a great little diner.

My buddy and I ducked in because we wanted a bit of warm comfort food.  He ordered the chili dog and I had the club sandwich.  I'll say this about both plates.  They were huge.  I'm not a small guy and I have a healthy appetite but was intimidated by my triple-decker club.  You can't get your mouth over the whole sandwich.

Seating - Quick but sat at the counter
Service - Busy but friendly enough
Delivery Time (kitchen to table) - Pretty quick.  Roughly about 5-7 minutes
Quality - Pretty good diner food.  Not 5-star but good
Quantity - Massive.  Club sandwich could have been 2 meals
Cost - Moderate for portion size

Note: I marked Andy's as "Divey" but in the most positive of ways.  I love these types of diners.  Also, this place would get 5 starts but it is a bit cramped and parking is atrocious.  Not their fault, I know.
author: Anthony X.

description: This place is hands down the best freakin diner food you can get west of the Sierras. The banana pancakes, or any pancakes for that matter are fluffy, buttery, pieces of heaven on a plate. Literally, we can't get enough. Definitely worth checking it out. 5 stars. Say hi to Joe for us, he makes the experience even more enjoyable.
author: Emily Y.

description:
This place is filled with SF charm in this diner themed restaurant from the decorations (currently holiday themed) to the waiters to the lively ambiance.

Food was great. I got the 4 piece fried chicken for $14. It came with a salad which was the same size as a regular entree and mashed potatoes and gravy. They poured the gravy right in the center of the mashed potatoes. My only complaint is that my favorite part of the chicken (the drumstick) was tiny but they did give me 4 pieces so the portion was the right amount.

Super conveniently across the street from the Castro muni station and this place is open 24/7!
author: Mimi T.

description: Prices are too high.  Besides that it's a fun place to hangout. Don't expect high end food but do expect a rowdy place with lots of happy people. I just get fries and ranch dressing hehe
author: Nick S.

description:
I was pleasantly loaded, and taken by surprise that bars closed at 2am.  Well there was Orphan Andy's open 24 hours so I stumbled in and sat at the bar and stuffed my face and had a fun conversation with a supposedly straight man sitting next to me, who told me a series of hilarious dirty jokes that I absolutely cannot remember.

I'd almost drop a star because it wasn't my favorite best Monte Cristo sandwich.  It was the kind made with french toast instead of the kind where the whole sandwich is battered and deep fried.

But it was 2 am and I was drunk so they get 5 stars!

I wished the next day that I had tried some of their house-made pie.
author: Andrew T.

description:
I love Orphan Andy's. The food is good diner fare, the prices are reasonable, and the sassy gay guy who waits tables is great.

Enjoy it while you can before gentrification swallows up yet another historic diner.
author: Jade M.

description: Great great, amazing customer service here. They are so attentive and friendly. Never had rude service here. Plus, it's open 24 hours! Can I get an amen to breakfast after a night out at the bars in castro? Yasssssss. The food is pretty good, standard diner food.
author: Jimmehh D.

description:
Top food, fresh and gorgeous portions, nice employees, recommend for everybody visiting the city searching for an authentic "welcome to the night of san Francisco". 
Long waiting line however stills a very good experience.
author: Adriano B.

description: This place is so disrespectful. The waiters were racist and sat white guys before me and my group. It was so belittling and sad. This has lowered my self-esteem and saddened me. I asked for the waiters name and he said "Joe"(sounds like this isn't the first time they have this problem).
author: Samuel C.

description: The service was SO wonderful! Joe was our server, super friendly and sweet! Made us laugh. The place is small but homey and the food is just as wonderful. Joe suggested the French dip and I was not disapointed, can't wait to cone back here on our next visit to Castro!
author: Rochelle N.

description:
Went bar hopping and sought out delicious food before heading back home. My roommate pushed for Orphan Andy's and, considering the time and location, I figured this place would be our best option since we didn't have a car and weren't planning on walking too far. 

I bought a Tuna Melt and Stuffed French Toast (cinnamon spiced apples and cream cheese). Both dishes were around $9 and both were juicy although there was too much tuna in the sandwich per bite and a block of straight up cream cheese in the French Toast. I loved the bread of the French Toast dish though. I ate half of both dishes and saved the rest as leftovers which were great. 

I think the food overall is average but good option for late night in the Castro.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Orphan Andy's does't pretend to be anything its not. What it does well, is good, cheap food. The ultimate convience between 2am and 11am when everything else is closed. A mountainous double cheeseburger and friends for a low price, yes! Good, cheap dinner food at 3 am is exactly what I want, and they deliver. And their mozzarella sticks are good too!

They are one of the few places open 24 hours (sans a few hours on Tuesday for maintenance). Truly a historical Castro gem.
author: Bryan M.

description: A good place to know about for late nite.  It's open 24 hours.  Food was pretty good. I mean,  it's a diner.  The service was exceptional! I would go back just to visit Joe, our waiter.  He was great! (And I am not an easy judge of service as I have been a waitress in my life) Fun place for a quick bite in the Castro.
author: Robyn R.

description:
Great food, great service. Perfect wet scrambled eggs with American, delicious onion rings, yummy ranch sauce. Wasn't terribly impressed with the chocolate banana pancakes but my friends loved them.

It was 1:30 AM and we were sobering up from a night on the town, which I think in and of itself is a chance for terrible service or disappointment to happen, but we were delighted!
author: Miriam W.

description:
Overall it's a nice place to go to. The workers are nice and the vibe is really sweet. 

Pro's
-open 24 hours
-right on Castro and Market so it's a great place to go to after you go out
-old school diner feel and food

Con's
-very small
-sometimes crazy people from outside come in
author: Devika B.

description:
The food here is pretty good for a diner I've enjoyed many a quiet meal here. In the past, the staff have been friendly and accommodating to any substitutions to orders (and the menu clearly states substitutions means adding $1 to an order).

Based on this experience, I was looking forward to my preferred meal, indicating it to the person taking my order. 

The service has gone RIDICULOUSLY DOWNHILL. Why? Because apparently substituting a *tomato* in place of some *fruit garnish* is a crime against humanity. 

I explained to the server I've done this a few times (it was even suggested to me by a server the first time!!!). The server insisted that this was impossible and asked me to name names. LOL, as if I'd know. 

I looked at her, confused, wondering what on earth could be worth arguing over a tomato, for goodness sake. 

OH, AND WHAT NEXT? WHY THE TERRIBLE REVIEW?

This, um, INCREDIBLE person called me a LIAR over a TOMATO!!! Yep, you read that right! "It's your word against mine" to be specific. Beyond offended, I got up and immediately left, my desire to eat or bring my business had dissolved. 

Why on earth would I want to give money to a restaurant that treats its customers like this? Ridiculous and offensive. LOL, and just so STUPID. STUPID, jaw-dropping, MIND BLOWING loss of business. OVER A TOMATO.

Unles you enjoy absurd, power tripping servers who're ready to die over a $1 or a tomato, vs. say, losing a neighborhood customer ready to purchase an $18 dollar meal, be wary of eating here.  

Don't be surprised if you're told ketchup doesn't come with french fries because some insane lady decides you're lying about all those times you ate something which she just can't believe ever happened.

SHE CALLED ME A LIAR OVER A TOMATO. You can't make this stuff up. I'll never visit this establishment again... unless there's ***anyone ELSE*** serving that isn't a tomato Nazi!!! Then again, I'd bet 1000 fruit garnishes that this Tomato Nazi is the owner and is eagerly yelling at her staff as I write this so as to make clear: NO TOMATOS EVAR. Wow. Just. Wow.
author: Sarah L.

description: Decent sized portions!  Been there twice so far. We've had the tuna melt, omlet, Cobb salad, pastrami burger (special at the time) and all have been quite solid. Will be back again!
author: P H.
