description: Great choice late night! We liked everything we got. Just wish the Ruben was traditional corned beef or at least the turkey used could have been peppered and grilled to give it more power to stand up better to the other flavors. Service was attentive and friendly. Small place so don't be a loud drunk fool when you go.
author: Greg P.

description:
Good, solid diner food.
Was walking around SF, and wanted to wander somewhere different for a bite to eat, so off to the Castro we went.
Bopped around the corner, and here we were
I hear this place is great for a late night munch. If I am ever in the area at that time, this is exactly where I would want to be
If you want a good cheeseburger and fries, don't pass this place up.
AND MILKSHAKES
Made with Dryers ice cream
I loved sitting at the front window. The place is so cute inside. A great SF diner
author: Kat R.

description: AWESOME first experience!! Ordered the Mexican omelette with a side of French toast! Awesome super quick and super tasty! 10/10 service/cleanliness/quality!! Can't wait to come back!
author: Jason A.

description: They sat down others before us when we were there first. Talk about customer service. We didn't even get utensils and others who came afterwards got it. Packed my bags and left without sipping the cup of water.
author: Eric Y.

description: Just experienced this place for the first time & I loved it! I ordered the turkey burger w/the chicken vegetable soup. The soup was perfectly seasoned (not too salty) w/tender potatoes. The turkey burger was the best one I've had in a very long time. I plan on going to this place again & again & again :)
author: Tyler S.

description: Got the chili omelette. It was exactly what I was craving and tasted great. Service was good and prices are really good considering you're still in San Fran. Would totally come back.
author: Josue R.

description: Orphan Andy's! Been here multiple times over the past decade. My go to spot for late night/after hours eats in the city! One of the only places left in the city for that time you need some food after a heavy night of drinking! What's not to love? It's got your typical diner fare with a bit of weirdness mixed in. Every weekend is always a new adventure here with all the randoms you meet in line and the food always hits the spot here. We got three bacon cheeseburgers and a big 2 breakfast this time. The bacon cheeseburgers were cooked just like how they're supposed to be cooked and each bite was super good. However, the fries weren't as crispy as how I like them. The big 2 breakfast comes with 2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage, and your choice of 2 pancakes or French toast. Always a winner in my book. Definitely recommend coming here for your late-night guilty pleasures!
author: EccentricAura A.

description:
I found out what happened to the Soup Nazi after he left Seinfeld. He moved to San Francisco and got demoted to waiter. He hated our very existence! We simply weren't worthy of Orphan Andy's.

That said, the food is pretty good for a diner.

They did a great job on the fries and the tuna melt, and the dessert we had (Hawaiian cake ) was awesome.

The soup nazi warmed up by the end of the meal and was actually almost pleasant. Still, with so many other places within a stone's hurl of our water's shade, I'd rather eat elsewhere.
author: Kelly B.

description:
Cozy little spot to sober up after a evening of raging.
-Service is good.
-Food was great, but I was pretty buzzed, so a piece of cardboard might have tasted like French Laundry to me.
author: Joon Y.

description: I love it here. The staff is always very nice and all the food I've ever tried is great (even at 2am). I always get the fried chicken and hot cakes...delicious. It's very small so if the area is busy be prepared to wait. Always a great place to enjoy some good food if you're around. Can't wait to come back.
author: Andrew M.

description: I really enjoyed the service. They're great. The place is in a perfect location and the staff were allá of them nice and funny people. I love these guys.
author: Aaron M.

description: Orphan Andy's was so amazing. The chicken fried steak was moist with a crunchy crust and the country gravy was savory with bits of sausage in it. The hotcakes were melt in your mouth buttery. I would definitely go here again and recommend it to anyone who is into diner style food. Their service and portions surpassed my expectations and have set the bar for other restaurants.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
I don't know about all the negative reviews regarding the service. Today I had breakfast there this morning & was warmly greeted by Elijah, "Hi Sweetie, have a seat." 

He was a pleasure, made some small talk with me & the gentleman sitting next to me at the counter. Then we all started chatting. The owner/manager Mike was there and was also very pleasant. 

A homeless man came in asking for water, Mike gave him water & was really nice to the guy. 

My spinach feta omelette was chock full of fresh spinach and feta crumbles. Everything was delicious. 

After paying the bill I said goodbye to both Elijah & Mike, with an equally friendly "Goodbye Love." I'll be back for sure.
author: B K.

description: So at first I really liked this place ! It wasn't until the waiter threw a penny at a customer with a disability that I decided I would never be back and I would tell my family and friends to never go here . This guy with a disability was waiting for his food for almost an hour and the guy didn't say anything to the waiter rude or anything he had just mentioned that it took long to get his food so the waiter gave him his change back and then threw a penny at the guy and laughed and then kicked out the disabled man and he just sat there laughing . That was the first thing I didn't like at all . Then this same waiter was grabbing the other Waiters ass in front of customers . Multiple times then handing out people's food . At one point we say him grab the front of this lady and we had enough so we decided to leave . Overall this place I would never visit again unless this waiter didn't work there anymore .
author: Bethany S.

description: Server was rude. They didn't do a good job accommodating 8 people for breakfast.  Just overall bad experience. Eggs were bland, French toast was mushy. I do not recommend this place.
author: Cindy W.

description: A great diner with really sweet servers. The food is consistently good, good portions and it's open 24\7 a San Francisco staple for getting ur grub on.
author: nancy w.

description:
l just tried to eat Spinach & Feta omelette which wasn't omelette at all. SO OILY ! Pancakes were good with that SUPER sweet syrup. Overall, it wasn't good experience and won't come here again. 

Advice ; Go and discover another restaurants in city. Food is filled with A LOT OF OIL !
author: Arthur W.

description:
Worst service I've had in years.
I can appreciate slow service when things are busy but the owner was rude. He practically tossed the plates on the table. The food was nothing special. I won't return and suggest you don't give this business your money.
author: Allan S.

description:
Kudos for a late night diner in the city! It's a small quaint space; my friend and I lucked out and got a table without having to wait.
I wanted a snack after watching a play at the Orpheum. Fish and chips and a chocolate shake hit the spot. 
Nothing spectacular - it's your typical greasy spoon. The cod fillets were crisped nicely but the fat fries were a little soft and mushy. The chocolate shake was super thick but had too high a head of whipped cream (in future, I'd ask them to hold it).
author: Tina W.

description: I love this place. If you're looking for the friendly castro spirit and a classic American breakfast you'll feel right at home here. It's not as fancy or bougie as Kitchen Story or Starbelly so don't come in here to impress the foodies-- come in to  experience the Castro. I also don't recommend people coming here who are uppity-- they're not going to serve you maple free sugar free syrup or reserve a table for you.
author: Polina S.

description: Disgustingly no health since I got food poisoning because of their lack basic  health
author: Trent W.

description: I was recommended to come here by locals at a bar nearby. I immediately encountered prissy stuck up servers at the counter. Overweight middle aged servers with poor attitudes it was very disappointing. I had high hopes because I had a great time at the bar moby dick where I met locals that said go to orphan andys and I was excited but unfortunately very disappointed in the snobby attitude by the prissy servers. I am living in San Diego and it's my very first time in San Francisco and I had a great experience until I stepped foot into orphan andys I didn't like the food it was basic mediocre and I could make tastier food at home . I do NOT recommend this BASIC establishment it's worth skipping!!!!
author: Troy M.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat at in the bay area, I took my oldest daughter who is expecting my first grandchild there for her first time after going to see a movie and once again Orphan Andy's had me pleasantly pleased. We had a real hard time deciding what to eat once we got there because everything looks so phenomenal on their menu, especially my daughter ( pregnancy will get you on that one lol) who had such a hard time and myself as well so Wait for it... It took us over twenty minutes+ to finally order and our waiter was so patient, amazing and a total sweetheart about it, plus he even gave us some ideas on what to try but in the end we had the Cheeseburgers. Mine was the Guacamole burger which is to die for, the burgers were perfect & jucy and very well seasoned, the fries were perfect not to soft and not too overcooked they were just right.  The staff is amazing& attentive and the atmosphere is cool calm &  copacetic. If you haven't been there yet what on earth are you waiting on?????  believe me you won't be disappointed.
author: Wendy A.

description: OMG. I just ate breakfast here and what a sad experience it was. Worst service I have had anywhere I have ever eaten and I am almost 60 years young. Never once did server check on my husband or I the entire meal. There were only three tables of customers in the place so it was not because he was busy. I left less than 10% tip and felt that was too much for the non service received There were two waiters for the three tables of customers. I will NEVER go here again. When I lived in San Francisco I used to eat here often. After this experience, I will never be back again. The Cove on Castro is around the corner and 100 times better food and 1,000% better service.   Good bye forever Orphan Andy.
author: Steven C.

description:
Orphan Andy's is one of those old stalwarts of Castro dining. For pure diner food, and lots of it 24 hours a day, Orphan Andy's isn't going nowhere. 

It's a charming space little space. A throwback diner that doesn't look like it's changed much at all since the day they opened. The staff are an interesting mix of characters but all incredibly sweet. Torn between fish & chips and chicken fried steak one weekend lunch, our server recommended the latter. "You don't really find chicken fried steak in the city and we are kind of known for that." 

When it arrived, wow. It was A LOT OF FOOD on one plate. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/orphan-andys-san-francisco?select=8nwj4-eJa2AdjrsfxtT7_Q#VRC-93JNcqLjtuVEOiCWxA) Besides the crispy fried steak with a mound of gravy, it comes with your side of toast, seemingly endless serving of breakfast potatoes, and your choice of eggs. I couldn't finish it but bravely powered through. Nothing extraordinary but there is still something homey and comforting about eating a breaded and deep fried piece of meat with lots of gravy.   

Truth is, you're probably not coming here for the food unless you have an insatiable craving for diner food. The charm of Orphan Andy's is the place and its people. All day long (although probably best late night), the nice folks here will take care of you.
author: Jon L.

description:
The simple fact of the matter is 80% of people are not going to enjoy the experience of eating here.  There is one older guy who works on the weekends who is flat out the sassiest betch I have ever encountered in real life.  He is the movie Mean Girls, but a person.  I once saw him deliberately make a table wait for their check for 15 minutes because they had the audacity to ask for it.  It's small and cramped, and the lines can go out the door.  The food comes out slow and everything except the chicken-fried steak is mostly terrible.

But I just can't stop coming here.  I am Whitney Houston and this terrible restaurant is my Bobby Brown.  Maybe it's the ridiculous gay art on the walls.  Maybe it's the other waiters who smile apologetically when Regina George is off on a tear.  Maybe it's the perfect 50s atmosphere and the accompanying nostalgia.  I love this place and he's never going to hit me again - he promised.

Though seriously, stick with the chicken-fried steak
author: Kevin C.

description: I love Orphan Andy's.  It's my to-go for real late night dinning.  Our server Shane is always very nice to us and gets us what we need.  Definitely the better alternative to Mel's, Denny's or iHop in the late hours.  Killer internet jukebox and it's always amusing what characters come in to eat.  Warning, space is limited and you might end up in a line for a while
author: Richie W.

description:
This is the sweetest, most genuine little diner in SF. Is this the best food in SF? No. Because it's a diner. But if you're craving breakfast food at a weird hour or just want to go eat a burger somewhere where everyone will call you "darling" and "dear", then this is the spot.

Oh and the banana/chocolate chip pancakes RULE.
author: Morgane M.

description:
Went there around 7pm. 
There were about four other people in the restaurant, who already had their food when we arrived. 
I wasn't hungry and ordered a side dish and juice. It literally took the waiter over 15 minutes to pour a glass from a pitcher behind the counter. He was impolite. The food wasn't good. I've taken people here before who loved it. But not this time. The water was so unpleasant, I didn't want to eat the food. I won't be back again. If you hate your job that much, find another. 
I've lived in SF longer than that waiter has been alive. I've lived here 40 years, and the Castro was the main reason I fell in love with SF. This won't be a place I take anyone to, again.
author: Lisa J.

description:
ABSOLUTELY THE WORST EXPERIENCE !!!

2/19/2014 i just got back from dinner at Orphan  ,  i  was there twice before  for breakfast  it  was  fine .  This  time?  was  worst time ever,

and i just want to be clean,  the  food was good.    fine +   ,   good food,   i  enjoy the meal,   so i am not lie to you guys,   the  server ?  that  was  wow ,  how  stupid the  owner need to be, to see all those bad reviews about the service, and  still hire the person?  make me  wonder why?    
ATTITUDE !!  so not pleasant to  talk with .
we are seating down,  and  come over  ,  and  look at  us, and say,  " well i guess i will take a  chair till you guys decide what to eat"  i looked at my friend, i say,  you order for me,  i  don't want to loose my self with the  stupid   guy.   

the all meal  he was  unpleasant ,   he  bring the  food  to your  face  not to the  table, like  hold that mr.    wtf?  first time in my life, i stem out and i wroth on the  tip   0 and you earn it !!!     don't step there if you  don't want to  destroy your meal
author: Joey A.

description:
I come here about once a week and truly love this place.... Many many good memories here.

My weekly waiter, Jacob is amazing! Love the customer service there, atmosphere, and great yummy diner food.

Oh, and they are open 24 hours. So you can come anytime.
author: Jerry M.

description:
Dude. The worst customer service. My other half and I waited inside the door for 15 minute for a seat to open - and no acknowledgment from any staff (even though we made eye contact). A table gets up, bus boy cleans it, and we sit down - no acknowledgement from staff. We waited another 5 minutes before I got up and grabbed 2 menus to read. Then another 7 minutes before we decided to get up and leave, considering we waited over 25 minutes - and never once got acknowledge. Not even a hi! Not even like a head nod! 

The thing that is really shitty is that I've visited Orphan Andys about a half dozen times over the last year- and each time the service is worse and worse. It's really disappointing that a Castro establishment that prides it's self on that whole "established in the 70's - local spot" has really lost what it means to be local. 

Btw - took my hungry stomach (and my money) over to Harveys and was greeted as soon as I made eye contact with a waiter.
author: Matticus C.

description: some bitchy queen didn't like my order one night and has banned me ever since.   I have tried to go back (alone and with friends) and have been turned away like an immigrant Trump hates.   This discrimination has to stop.
author: Doug W.

description:
A wonderful place to watch the passing human parade just outside.  The menu is huge and everything and anything on it can be prepared with skill and dispatch.

The staff is very friendly so there is great service in addition to the good food. The Castro/Market Street location is fantastic, so there is lots to do before or after you eat.
author: Lee P.

description: A must- go-to restaurant in $F!! The decorations on the ceiling are amazing, the staff is amazing, AND the food is delicious!! I got biscuits and gravy with chicken sausage, yummy and affordable. Would recommend to anyone to check this place out.
author: Katelyn K.

description: Service is terrible. It seems the server only had a certain type of guest he would entertain or be friendly too. I guess I wasn't his type. Rude and short, like my presence bothered him and I shouldn't be dining there. He left my stacked dirty dishes at the bar for 15 minutes before he even dropped the check. Didn't ask me how anything was or if I needed anything. I believe it was an older man named Michael since I overheard the server speaking to him.
author: Liz S.

description: I love a good diner.  I like sitting at the bar and eating overly buttered toast.  So this one does well. The place is tiny and they get busy so you'll have to chill and wait.  The guy behind the counter was super friendly too and took time to chat with folk as they came in.  What was interesting was there's a ton of folk from out of town here.  I'm not sure how they find this place but it seemed like half the crowd on a Sunday morning was from out of the country.  Me? I had two eggs over easy with toast and home fries.  The fries I didn't like so much but the eggs and toast were nicely done...who doesn't like a runny egg yolk and crunchy toast ya?
author: David S.

description:
So much old school yum in a little space served by a friendly face.

That about sums this place up perfectly. Good diner food at a fair price served by someone nice. This is hangover destination numero uno for me. I haven't had the entire menu. Pictures don't matter. If you're worried about such things, you don't understand what a diner is. 

Come. Have a seat. Eat. Smile.
author: Justin S.

description: The place is awesome!great late night eats! Milkshakes are always on point! Servings are huge!
author: Rodney D.

description:
This is the first restaurant I visited when I moved here, and it's always been great!  I still dine here occasionally.  The menu is simple, the plates are large and the atmosphere is fun and it's riddled with Castro history.

When you want a quick bite, fresh and hot, this is the diner to go to!  They are small and do fill up quick during mealtimes, but the service and the food are terrific!   Mangia!
author: Paul H.

description:
I'm here now. Two guys are working as host/waiters...they seem more
Into themselves and each-other than to focus on customer service. One of them is harassing the cook more than anything. I would give this no stars if possible to review. I have visited here b4 and had excellent service, good, and speed. Today is a nightmare. These servers are a nightmare! The cook is slow, instead of assisting (if they could), they are singing songs and bantering about the cook. This is ridiculous.
author: Jonathan M.

description: The service really sucks here but I live across the street and I work late. It works for fast late night food.
author: Seth D.

description: Where I come from - NYC - there's more to select from in the way of venues NOT PREDOMINANTLY SERVING ALCOHOL open past 8pm. This means I look out for such fables in the city of SF: behold, Orphan Andy's. The service is relaxed, the coffee is sad but effective, and the fries are average. But if you're lucky to get one of the corner window booths up front, it's worth a visit. After all, it's better than other places.
author: Kristina B.

description: I love this place! The staff was super friendly and amazingly quick. And the food was delicious, especially the hotcakes! I definitely would love to come back. The decoration is kitschy and fun. I highly recommend it.
author: Laura D.

description: This food is basically tasteless. Which is a tragedy since the food is priced as if this place is worth your time but it's not. Service is extremely slow so it's obvious that the manager/owner doesn't know what they're doing.
author: Jeremiah A.

description: Where do I start. How about seasoning the food. The menu described the food one way, but it did not turn out that way. Everything was bland and overpriced.
author: Adam L.

description:
The Castro Street area of San Francisco has two 24-hour restaurants. One of them, Orphan Andy's, has been there for several decades and is a beloved fixture of the neighborhood.

The food at Orphan Andy's might be described as good "comfort food" - not fancy, but well-prepared and of good quality. Most of my meals there have been lunches and breakfasts, so I'm can't comment on their dinner offerings. Portions tend to be rather large, so I often have to take a "doggy bag" home for later consumption.

Orphan Andy's is often quite busy, but the noise level is not obnoxiously high even when the place is full. Prices at this restaurant have risen quite a bit during the past several years, thanks to the influx of high-paid techies into the city, but are not at all outrageous.

My favorite dishes? Meatloaf. Biscuits & Gravy. Tuna Melt Sandwich.
author: Clayton L.

description:
Walked in here last night with the wife and sat at the counter. The food was great! We started with mozzarella sticks that came out very fast and then the fish and chips and a breakfast plate. The portions are huge! All the food came out quick and was really good. 

I am writing this review because we were extremely satisfied with our server! Eric! Eric was great! He was very on point with everything, very attentive to all the customers though the restaurant was full and did his job with a very happy attitude. Very cool! Be back soon!
author: Letme B.

description: OK if your intoxicated or have been drinking and don't mind the long wait. Unfortunately, that was not the case for us that night. It was about a 45 minute wait and the food was terrible and greasy. The servers are busy, but they are friendly. There are other places to eat late in the Castro.
author: Khris S.

description: The hotcake is awesome!! Don't miss this if you are a pancake junkie! Both of their polish sausages and link sausages are delicious and the service is nice and friendly too!
author: Millie T.

description: Hella good food must get breakfast be in for a reality tv show live in the booth next to you love it and did i mention its open in those wee hours of the night when ur in desperate need of a home cooked meal p.s. Get ready to wait a awhile :)
author: Amanda P.

description: My wife & I came here to eat recently on our trip to San Francisco. The food was really good quality & the atmosphere was very relaxed with a jukebox in the corner playing music the entire time. I ordered the chocolate chip & banana pancakes & they were amazing ! My wife got a Philly cheesesteak & loved it as well. I definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to visit the  Castro area , while also enjoying an old time throwback diner.
author: Chris M.

description: Classic old school (it's been here for-e-ver) super tiny greasy spoon. That said, you can expect to wait at just about any hour, for a table in the tiny shotgun row of tables, or at the counter. Service is friendly, but a bit slow. When I was there, it was one prep, one cook, and two servers. . . Food was typical diner food. Nothing exceptional, but clean, and good. It's what I was expecting from Andy's.
author: Greg S.

description: I really love this place.  The main draw is and always has been that the counter staff will talk to you like you're a friend. When you spend your days working at home, and need human contact, that's such a wonderful thing.
author: Robert S.

description: They got great breakfast deals here and the portions are huge!  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  Kind of a small dining area and the restrooms is a little challenge to get to as you have to use the stairs and go past the kitchen, but you're here for the food and that's what they do awesomely great!  The pancakes are huge and delicious.!!!  The MUNI F line stations is right outside Orphan Andy's.
author: Rhonald N.

description:
I have a thing for places that give off that old school diner feel to it. This place is definitely one of those places, it's a 24 hour diner. Old jukebox players and classic look cramped into a small space. This place probably can't fit that many people, but that's ok it's still awesome to me. 

I came here when my friend recommended it after wanting some breakfast at 4am that wasn't Dennys or Ihop. I am really glad he did because this place makes some awesome food at a reasonable price. I mainly love the sausages they made for us, it had a nice spicy kick to it. 

If I got no where to go at 4am and need some breakfast I'll probably drop in here. I've never seen this place packed, it's a nice quiet place each time I've been here, great place to have those late night serious talks with people over coffee.
author: Wells Y.

description: It's a diner. Somehow ended up here late at night and ordered french toast. Pricey for just the french toast That I ordered. It wasn't even that good, but just OK. They didn't give me my maple syrup for a while. Service could have been better, but it was just a whatever place. I wouldn't have gone here by choice. Only came here because it was open late.
author: Julie L.

description: This is such a cute little diner in the Castro! They have all the basic diner food served at normal prices for the city. The staff is always wonderful as well. If you love burgers I highly recommend them, and the Hawaiian burger in particular if you like being adventurous. It comes with pineapple and cream cheese on it and I definitely recommend adding bacon! Definitely a spot to check out if you like the quirky spots in SF. It is a small restaurant and you might have trouble getting a table right on the spot, but overall the wait would be worth it for a cream cheese pineapple burger!
author: Courtney V.

description:
Delicious, dependable, inexpensive, open 24/7, this Castro institution should not be missed.

The space is small, 5 booths, 12 counter stools, a couple tables in the window.

Fun, often hungover or high, gay waitstaff.  The waiters may sit down at your table, they are personable, down to earth and have seen it all.  In fact our waiter has worked there for years and years. 

I crave their hand pattied burgers and crispy fat fries.  For around $8 you can have a simple delicious burger.

My husband always has the same thing; The Goldminer, which is basically a roast beef melt, he requests the au jus on the side.

You cannot go wrong with any breakfast item and the chicken fried steak is BOMB.

After a night of bar hopping or a midday craving Orphan Andy's will always hook you up.
author: James S.

description:
We always see this place is crowded right after being at the clubs in Castro. When we finally tried it before thr busy hours, the menu was not really what I was expecting. I could not pick what to eat because there wasn't really anything that looked appetizing. Finally,  my cousin and I decided to share a New York Steak. The meat was actually delicious. 

The service was great! Our waiter was super nice. Very welcoming place, and I would love to go again!
author: Sheryl R.

description:
Sometimes I feel like copying the Yelp's sample review because it describes the experience better than I could write it myself. 

But in any case, I've been coming here on and off for the past number of years for a quick bite to eat for the occassional brunch or an ungodly but blissful three AM dinner after a late night out doing...well, stuff :). The food is always top notch and the service endlessly pleasant. I never leave without experiencing a good time and today is no different. My stomach is probably rolling around in the heavenly flavors of an amazing cheeseburger I just voraciously consumed. My conscience though is no doubt glaring at me for eating an entire day's worth of calories in one sitting, but hey, there's no such thing as a healthy cheeseburger, fries, and pancakes altogether at once. If someone can figure out a healthy version of that, I'm coming to you.

Orphan Andy's, rock on.
author: Eric H.

description:
Great to grab a bite after a night of clubbing, wish the line wasn't soo damn long! 
#2 big boy was the bomb.
author: Mateo M.

description: I am such a fan. Great food, decent prices and friendly staff. The decor made this place very comfortable and I like the straightforward but versatile menu. Great experience both times I have visited.
author: Kristy F.

description: Went to orphan Andy following the recommendation of the doorman of a bar on the Castro. Waited by the door 10 minutes before any of the servers acknowledged us. When finally seated we ordered a veggie burger (no vegan option on the menu at all) and a meatloaf. From where I say I could see that the cook used the microwave several times to heat stuff up and food was left to be picked up by servers for a very long time (it was NOT busy!). When we got our food my fries were lukewarm and I have very little good to say about the veggie patty) . My friend's meatloaf came with chicken soup (he said it was good with plenty of veggies and chicken); his meatloaf was also nice but it came with a rather disgusting biscuit; a below average potato mash and runner beans which looked straight out of a can and cooked for hours. Waitress was friendly but was not interested in any of our comments. Not recommended! Avoid!
author: Davide S.

description:
Wonderful little place. Open 24 hours a day and right next to the castro muni stop. 
Good food for a reasonable price and the wait staff are always sweet and funny. :) I would recommend it.
author: Laura D.

description:
This place gets zero stars. My friends and I were grossly disrespected at this restaurant. The attitudes in this place are ATROCIOUS! On Sunday night November 1st at around 10pm, my friends and I ran into this shanty for a quick bite to eat. We were not at all drunk but we were giggling and having a great time talking. We were told by our waiter that were too loud and of course, we obliged to this request by lowering our voices and  keeping it down. 

About 20 min later, our waiter, who started to become increasingly nasty over basic interactions such as "Can we have more fries" came over to our table, picked up our food, asked us to "Look At This" (to which we had no idea what was going on) and then threw our food in the trash! FURTHERMORE he demanded for us to pay and threatened to call the cops if we did not. I understand if he wanted us to leave, that is his right and his prerogative, but he could have simply given us boxes, presented us with the check and sent us on our way.... but randomly THROWING AWAY OUR FOOD AND DEMANDING WE PAY FOR IT? Thats taking it to a level of disrespect that just doesn't need nor should ever be crossed. 

Quite frankly I think the man has some pre connived prejudices, and needs to find another line of work. Bigotry and a nasty attitude will  only get you so far in life.... but then again sir, you are serving me subpar onion rings  in a tattered apron. Congratulations on this life you live!
author: Nadya H.

description:
Open 24 hours, Orphan Andy's is a great option for those "I'm starving..what's open this late?" kind of nights. 

After participating in a 5 hour race (essentially, a big game of tag) called "Journey Into The Night" around the city, my famished friends and I flocked to Andy's for some much needed sustenance. 

With a huge menu, Andy's selection of both traditional and modern diner food was just what we needed after running around, and up and down hills all night.

Our eyes were pretty much bigger than our stomachs because we ordered A LOT of food to share. I ordered a hot chocolate with whipped cream and chocolate syrup (delicious!) to warm me up, and a Hawaiian Cream Cheese burger. The burger sounds weird right? I thought so too, which is why I wanted to try it. 

Basically, instead of regular cheese, they give you cream cheese and the sliced pineapple gives the burger its "Hawaiian" touch. It comes with the standard lettuce, tomato and onion on the side. Although really heavy and fatty, the cream cheese was unique and the combination of cream cheese and pineapple gave the burger a really sweet, island flavor. I surprisingly liked it. 

My friends ordered the onion rings (yummy but verrry oily - dab with napkin first!) and chili cheese fries for us to share and a country fried steak, hotcakes (or what the rest of us call it: pancakes), and french toast for their entrees. I even ordered a root beer at the end to help me digest all of the food. 

With huge portion sizes, the food was waaaay too much but perfect if you come hungry! Even as hungry and exhausted as we were, we had trouble finishing the food and had leftovers.

Located in a fun cross-section of the Castro (aka party central with people dancing on the sidewalk!), there's always something going on and people to watch. 

And as a cherry on top, the Creme Brulee cart is parked right across the street and open until 2:30 AM for a great dessert option! We skipped dessert at Orphan Andy's and opted to get creme brulee instead. Basically, a great way to cap off a great night :).
author: Chival N.

description:
This is probably my favorite breakfast place in San Francisco. The people here are always bubbly and friendly and there is never any attitude.
As a big eater, I never leave this place hungry! My usual is the ham and cheese omelette with the Swiss cheese and a bowl of oatmeal. That breakfast keeps me going for hours!
author: Tony S.

description:
IF I COULD  GIVE A NEGATIVE  5 STARS, I'd gladly do that.  The waiter Steven was SO incredibly rude.
I was shocked by the way he dared talk to me, when I was nicely asking a question about their menu. 
 I've had some bad/rude servers in my life, but this is probably the worst I've ever had. 
I will Never come back there ever again, and I recommend you guys to pass and save your money, even if it's the only place to get food late at night. Getting a sandwich at a gas station would have been a better experience.
author: Ido P.

description: Don't know how the food is, was told as I'm standing next to a open 24 hours sign that they were not open till 6... wtf.
author: Russell T.

description:
The service here is abysmal!!! They hire these young gay guys with a horrible attitude. I've come here many many times through the years, and it's always been the same. I know they want to hire gay men here because it's a gay business in a gay neighborhood but I'd rather be served by middle aged straight women like Alice, Flo and Vera than be served by these snots with a bad attitude.  And I'm Gay!

It's a shame because there is so much potential here. The location is great. The decor is cute and the food is okay.  But don't expect much from the food. It's typical diner fare and falls somewhere between good and mediocre.
author: Daniel S.

description: Terrible terrible service! It's like the waiters have some unspoken code that no one knows but them, and if you break it, they will ignore you and treat you like shit. I hate that this place gets such great reviews, their service is terrible...
author: Zach C.

description:
Fantastic.

Every once in a while I (or I & some friends) drive down from Folsom/Sacramento for a  weekend of boozin' & carousin' & hell-raisin'. Yeah, we're too old for that sort of behaviour...maybe that's why we leave town to do it? =)

This place has the best morning-after food, hands-down. My choice? Biscuits & Gravy, Two Scrambled Eggs, Link Sausage. I don't know what it costs because I'm just needing my remedy at that point. I guess you could say that any monkey could make that breakfast, but the portion is ample, the flavor is great and it hits the spot.

The staff are super-friendly and accomodating. At first, years ago, I was really annoyed by that chirpy friendliness, But have given in and just have accepted that that's Andy's. They at least pretend I'm a regular and that's nice. (in truth, I go no more than 3-4 times a year).

I like sitting at the counter, closest to the kitchen. With friends, I've sat at a table, and have even shared a table with strangers. I do understand why people would lament the lack of more seating, but I think it's great. By the time I get my sh1t together on Sunday morning, I guess the massive crowd has cleared out because I've never once experienced a wait.

I hope the touristy masses never figure this place out...

Seriously...Fantastic.
author: Tony M.

description:
Out shopping with my gal and we craved a meal, and we love to go to places we haven't gone before, we found Orphan Andy's...Nice!
Fun little spot that give's you an old school diner feel which we really enjoyed.  Delicious burger's and shakes, we left feeling full!  I can't wait to go back!
author: Jim P.

description: This diner is a gem. Great food. Great staff. The locals are to die for. It's a  blast to just hang in the corner people watch
author: Danny and Christina M.

description:
It was a Saturday night. 

Rather than go to one of the nearby hopping clubs or bars, I ended up here with some new friends.

The setting was nice and warm, a small classic diner with quite an elaborate 3-fold menu including breakfast items, burgers, and sandwiches. 

We came here for a snack, and this is what happened:

Fries: Ordinary fries, but honestly can't go wrong with them. They hit the spot for an 11pm snack.
Malt Shake: I got this instead of the milkshake. Regrets run strong. It was just way too sweet. I drank about half.
Double Chocolate Cake: Someone else ordered this. The cake was a huge slice, but there was a weird green/red frosting on the top that tasted rather disgusting. The waiter then admitted that he didn't like it either and had covered it with chocolate sauce to mask it. Hmm...

It's a 24 hour joint, so that's useful. I probably wouldn't go here on a normal day, but if needed, it's nice to know it'[s always open!
author: Stephanie L.

description: I came here with three other friends for brunch recently and had a pretty good time. The food was very good; just what you would expect in a diner. The menu is pretty classic with things like eggs, bacon, pancakes, burgers, etc. and they do a good job at making all of these things. The prices are a bit high for what you are getting as the food is by no means excellent, but the portions are pretty large. I would definitely recommend ordering less rather than more. The staff was very nice and friendly which was another nice feature. It is certainly your classic diner with decor, food, and friendly staff so if that is what you are looking for, I would definitely recommend Orphan Andy's. Just don't come in expecting fine dining and organic vegan food.
author: Eliza J.

description:
I'm a Yelper Virgin . I know, a total dinosaur but thanks to my kids and South Park hear I am in the 21st century.  
This past December my son and I took our first trip to San Francisco together and spotted this charming spot.  Now, we are New Yorkers, which is the Capital  of Diner Heaven so you know we have an attitude about everything (especially diners) My son is 15 , your typical picky PIA teenager. so  even getting him to enter an establishment other than McDonalds is a challenge . 
As I dragged his starving ass in  we were greeted by this lovely gentleman(I wish I remembered his name because he made us feel welcome and inspired my son to eat real food)  Ok, I'm old I have  CRS (can't remember Sh*t)  My son had the grill cheese and fries and I had the best homemade chicken soup ever, sorry mom.  My Moms Jewish,need I say more.The gentleman that waited on us( I  believe  was  the manager)    actually took the time to share his personal  experiences  as a San Franciscan  ,the history of the Castro and Orphan Andy's. I am ever so grateful  to him in  sharing this wonderful moment with us.  We actually enjoyed ourselves and forget that  we are supposed to annoy  one another , based on  our genetic link . 
 The ambiance , staff and food at Orphan Andy's is just wonderful.  Remember ,is a diner so if your expecting Bobby Flay (yuck) to come out and whip  you up something you cannot pronounce ,walk on by and don't let the door hit you in the ass.
We loved our experience so much that we returned to Orphan Andy's  on our last day in San Francisco. We will be back!

Thanks ,  Stacy and Ezra
author: Stacy G.

description:
I spent the day running around doing some tourist activities with a friend.  We ate and walked in North Beach and had some high quality food.
I sat down to my meal at 8:30pm on a Saturday at Orphan Andys.  I wanted to spend a little of my money in the Castro District.  I specifically chose the counter as it is historically known for faster service.  The waiter put his initials on the check, asked me if he could bring me water, I told him I wanted water and chamomile tea.  I got the water.
I looked over the menu, made a choice, put the menu back, and waited for the waiter to return.
He began to sniff the coffee pots and got highly engaged with other patrons.  One told him that he looked like Drew Carey.  He talked with the other waiter behind the counter and they chatted about the relationships they have with their mother.  During this time, the man who washes the dishes was putting the clean dishes and silverware away.
At no time was I acknowledged as being there.
After 10 minutes of not being served or spoken to I looked towards the door.  At that moment a man who presented as a woman emerged from the back of the restaurant and said, "Goodbye boys."  The waiter left his post to get a goodbye hug.  As the person was leaving, new people were arriving.
At that moment, I left (without a tip for the water).
The restaurant was not crowded and the prices were not particularly reasonable.
The service was non-existent and I would never return to a venue that has such disregard for its patrons.
....
11/2017 
I returned and ate there twice.  The servers from before are gone.  At least one of the persons who waited on me was an owner.  Food order was taken promptly and served at the appropriate temperature.  Coffee refilling was vigilant.
Things change over time and I take back what I had said earlier.  I'm upgrading my review to a 4 star.  I'd give it a 5, but that bathroom was about the size of something you'd see in an airplane.  Sorry, I know you have to work with what you have, but it was way too tiny for my comfort zone!
author: Garrison H.

description:
Ahhh...an old fashioned 24 hour diner in the Castro is such a good idea. This place has been here forever satisfying late night  hunger. 

Went last night as I was craving pancakes and their's are good. There was no wait for a booth, and service was calm, efficient, fast and friendly.

Despite the late hour patrons were surprisingly sober.
author: El B.

description:
My wife and I frequent this place when we can't decide where else to go, or if we're craving pancakes. Or milk shakes. Or pretty much any other diner food. Everything I've had here has hit the mark. It's open 24 hours so you can rely on getting a good meal at odd times.

The servers sometimes are a little flirty and I think it makes my wife jealous, ha ha. No harm in a hetero dude being called 'Hon' by a gay guy, right?
author: Matt J.

description:
Remember something good.

One of the best songs of the year: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PcXLLG9Z0wA

One of the best memories of early San Francisco days: Stumbling drunk into Orphan Andy's and devouring food. Think so. Perhaps. Well maybe not the best memory.

Years later returned sober. This time there would be no forgetting:

- Grilled chicken sandwich on a sourdough roll and a side of soup. While absolutely delicious the $12 price is high. Until you realize it's big enough for two meals.

- Pancakes embedded with sliced bananas. $7 gets you two and $8 gets you three. Glad the decision was to save a buck because there was no will power to stop.

- Chocolate brownie filled with walnuts. As rich and decadent as the best of the city and quite a generous portion for just $3.

This Castro institution has been around since 1977 and open 24 hours. While the decor wasn't memorable the enthusiastic, warm and welcoming service was.

Something good indeed.
author: Jason B.

description: Cool little hole in the wall diner. Very nice staff and very good food. Sandwiches and such. Open 24 hours.
author: Adam E.

description: This place is a classic dinner, greasy food and all. Serves was good and waiters friendly, but food was not to par, especially for the price.
author: Eric M.

description:
Review is for their fresh-squeezed OJ only!
(I have yet to eat their food)

The best fresh-squeezed OJ this side of Florida.  
I had two big glasses...that should ''cold-proof" me 
for a while!
author: Dale N.

description:
Really loud music with a side of attitude...
This place is in a great spot, but it isn't that great.  The menu seems to come right out of 1977, along with the coffee grounds in the machine...yuk!  The orange juice is obviously fresh squeezed, since it contains tons of seeds.  The home fries are way too big to be appetizing, and the scrambled eggs can be runny at times.  Their salsa comes from a jar.  The wait staff are surly and seem to resent requests like more water, since they're not into keeping your glass full.  I know this is the Castro, but the b***hiness from the waiters isn't cute at all.
I was told by a local that locals don't eat here, only tourists.  I understand why.
Save yourself the bad meal and skip this outdated place.
author: Jose G.

description:
This "greasy spoon" as it's referred to by the locals is more than that. It's a case of family being the harshest critics, in my opinion.   I stayed in the area for a week and was glad to have an interesting source for decent food at any hour in addition to all the foodie-finds the area has.  In fact, I enjoyed the late breakfast and even later lunches I had here.  The food is good for diner food. The burgers were ground in house. The OJ was freshly squeezed. And the service was always friendly, attentive and proud to work for one of the oldest gay owned businesses in the Castro. 
When I mentioned it to some locals, they regarded it a bit harshly in a loving way - like family members.  Honestly, I'd be happy to have a diner like this in my neighborhood back home.
author: Mike G.

description: First time here and love it! Definitely coming back. Double cheeseburger is HUGE! Handle with care guys. :3 Also Erik is an absolute joy to have around!!
author: Hunter P.

description:
I came back here thinking maybe something had changed for the better but it's just worse. What does it take to work at Orphan Andy's? Let's see:

1) Must have no social skills
2) Must be totally unable to multitask
3) Must saunter around aimlessly
4) Must have no sense of urgency
5) Must ignore guests

And that's pretty much it.
author: D M.

description: Orphan andy's is one of the best places ever!! The food is absolutely wonderful, the service is amazing! Beautiful people!!! We will be back.
author: Rebeca R.

description: Food was great, but the worst service I have encountered in 12 years of eating at this diner.  Michael, our server, was rude and condescending for the entirety of our meal. I was mocked for wanting a rootbeer in addition to my coffee, and our server made comments under his breathe (but clearly audible) when we needed additional time to order our food. When we paid for our meal, Michael grabbed our cash and said "this looks almost correct" and then proceeded to verify the amount of money on our table table top. Keep in mind, two of us were paying with credit cards and signing our receipts, so no one was rushing out to stiff the bill. When told that he was acting extremely unprofessional, Michael refused to provide his last name or the contact information for the general manager. He continued to engage in a conversation from behind the bar emphasizing, "look at where you are at. What do you expect."
author: Stephan F.

description: Nice cute place I had a French dip which I enjoyed they give a lot of fries . My server was good she didn't bother me a bit . I thought was weird that the dishwasher washes dishes at the front counter .. I will be back ..
author: Terry C.

description:
After going out for a run, we stopped at this place to grab some dinner. Staff was very friendly. Some people might not enjoy it but my fiancé and I liked it. 

Food was ready so fast! It was classic diner style food on the menu. It is such a cute place to go for a hang out.

The wait staff was very friendly and nice and continued to crack jokes and carry on fun conversations throughout our meal.
author: Irem G.

description:
This place might have a chance at being a cool diner to pop in for some occasional classic diner fare, if it wasn't for the asshole employees making your meal as uncomfortable as possible. I've come in here several times thinking the previous bad services were a one time deal, but boy was I wrong. The food is good, but not good enough to make it worthwhile for me to return EVER again. (Ok ok...probably unless I have been out drinking in the area.) 

The servers were snotty, took forever to get our order and bring food, and gossiped about my friends and I really close by-talking about our clothes nevertheless! How childish. Definitely not a fun experience-2 stars because the food is good, but pricey. I suppose its the only way this place has stayed open...
author: Anna G.

description:
The food is good. Some things are delicious and some are just ok. I think that comes with having a menu with 50+ things on it. You can't make all 50+ things amazing but you can make them ok and some delicious!

My one big complaint is if you eat at the bar, don't sit in the middle. That it's the area where they do dishes and they fling them around and soapy water splashes on the counter. Thankfully I was finished with my food cuz soapy water went smack dad on my finished food. They did not notice and I did not say anything cuz I was done. Maybe get some kind of barrier that comes out over the sink a little bit.

Also watching them do them makes me wonder if they get all the soap off. How quickly they dunk them into the clean water.
author: Matthew W.

description:
Nasty old men who hate most everyone! 

Decent diner food, but their crankiness gets tiresome.
author: Suzanne S.

description: Food is good, perfect neighborhood "greasy spoon" joint. One of the guys is a bit too chatty but very nice. Definitely check them out
author: Philip C.

description: Food was pretty decent and that's what my two stars are for. Other than that it was a pretty downhill experience. I went here last night around 10 PM and whoever waited on me was obnoxious and out of line. His jokes were offensive and he was condescending referring to me and three friends as "Kids" because we asked politely to split the bill in two?!? And he was speaking loudly to the other waiter about having to do so. Finally the most uncomfortable part about this whole experience is that he literally looked at us and said "come on! Do we have to split the bill! Can't we just all pay in cash?!" That was it for me. I mean, it's your job...quite frankly I would only recommend going here if you're looking for attitude and an uncomfortable setting/situation. Please Orphan Andy's hire some better waiters!
author: Briana G.

description: My wife and I really enjoyed this place. She ordered French dip and she loved it. I ordered a double cheeseburger and it was delicious. The waiter was very cool and attentive. Our food came quick and I highly recommend this spot. out!
author: Kenape E.

description:
Orphan Andy's could have redeemable value for convenience and availability of a good old fashioned "greasy spoon" joint if it weren't for the blatantly abhorrent customer service.  After many visits to this place over the past several months, I'm now convinced that the bitchy, condescending and generally disinterested attitudes of the wait staff (numerously cited in other reviews) is not such a coincidence, but rather an ongoing trait for which they must be proud.

If you're lucky enough to pass the once-over approval scan by the waiter without being told he's too busy to merely record a take-out order for you, you may possibly be graciously served after a long while standing out in the cold...and maybe not.

No doubt there's plenty post-night-of-drinking clientele to satisfy the financial appetite of this little beacon of belly-bomb satisfaction so many of us seek late at night.  But if you care at all about patronizing a local establishment with your hard earned money and being treated with respectful gratitude for the honor of that humble patronage, I suggest you go elsewhere.

Sparky's 24 Hour Diner is the alternative option just a few blocks away on Church Street just south of Market.

Peace.
author: Dana G.

description: Service was great and food was good, but while I was there the guy cleaning stuff cleaned the floor around me four times in something like 15 minutes. I had to grab my stuff and throw up in the gutter outside from all the cleaning fluid vapors. Sure, I was there at 5am, but late night customers shouldn't be treated like that. Thumbs down.
author: Josh G.

description:
I was hungry, but not for a big meal.  The diner was right across the street from where I was working.  Perfect.

I ordered a salad, cup of chili and a side sourdough roll.  I could not believe the amount of food that came...or the absurdly large plates this was all presented on.  It was embarrassing.  

The Ceasar Salad was a pretty big portion but really anemic looking...pale, un-nutritious "greens".  It tasted fine.

The "cup" of chili is not served in a cup.  It is a huge portion. Served in a bowl on a huge plate of its own.  Huh?  I couldn't even finish half of it.  And I didn't touch my salad...took it home to eat for dinner.

The sourdough "roll" was cut into 8 small pieces, toasted and served with (I kid you not)...half a stick of butter slopped into a plastic cup.  All of it was presented on a huge plate of its own.

So there I was, with two others...and my "mini meal" took up half of the entire table.  I don't know.  I guess some people value portion and the presentation to make you feel like you're getting more value because its BIG BIG BIG.  But someone needs to think about waste...wasted water during a drought to wash all those plates...wasted butter that will get thrown away because it was absurdly out of proportion to the bread it went with...wasted ordering (if I order a "cup" of chili, give me a freakin cup...so the customer can realistically order the portion size they want)

The food was decent.  The service was ok.

open 24 hours.  ok.  bonus, if you need that type of diner in your life.
author: Lorilee L.

description: I went around 9 am on a Sunday by myself and there was plenty of open seating. Staff was super friendly and food came out quickly! I went simple with eggs, bacon, and French toast, and everything was delicious. Will definitely return next time I'm in SF!
author: Anna S.

description:
Not the kind of place I expected to find in the Castro (most restaurants tend to be super trendy), but it's a cute gem in itself! After another place closed its kitchen, a couple guys on the corner suggested Orphan Andys. 

We walked in wanting some good old H20 and a solid late night dinner (after a long day of venturing around the bay). The guys said we could sit anywhere so we chose the cozy round table by the window. Here's the rundown:

Food: I ordered the turkey club (fries, wheat bread, no mayo), one friend ordered the fish 'n chips, another ordered two eggs with hot cakes, and another just went with a cup of hot cocoa. The hot cocoa came in a metal canister along with a mug and spoon topped with whipped cream -- cute presentation. My friend's eggs and hot cakes were just as expected, and pretty good sized. My other friend devoured his fish 'n chips, which came with a giant helping of tartar sauce on the side. This is a diner, so I didn't expect fresh fish 'n chips, but it was a little weird to see the guy pull the box of breaded fish out from the under-the-counter fridge. My turkey club was pretty good. Turkey meat, crisp (but not too crispy) bacon, fresh tomatoes, lettuce, and onion, all sandwiched between slices of toasted wheat bread. The fries were pretty good. Crunchy exterior, soft interior.

Service: The guys that work in this place are really nice (and not too bad on the eyes either...). They took our orders with a smile, delivered our food in a timely manner, and kept our water glasses full.

I wouldn't mind coming back if I wanted something other than pizza late at night in the Castro.
author: Leana L.

description:
Ever wake up the morning after and think, "WHY DID I DO THAT?!?!?"

I woke up this past Saturday morning thinking the same thing as my stomach was churning. Not the hangover "churning" but the sickening feeling like your intestines is trying to digest a tub of Crisco. 

We (I) walked into Orphan Andy's heavily inebriated. Wait was 15 minutes for a table. Too drunk to Yelp something, I ordered the Fried Chicken with Pancakes ($12.95) which sounded like a good idea at the time. WORST. IDEA. EVER.

I know you can't expect much from a 24-hour diner but what I got were three pieces of shriveled up pieces of fried chicken that looked more like chicken strips rather than real chicken pieces. I would have taken a picture but I couldn't aim and shoot at the time. The fried chicken was disgustingly overbreaded, overfried, and greasy. I normally inhale my food when I'm drunk but several bites which tasted like a fried batter-dipped sponge made me want to puke so I went for the pancakes. They were mediocre and were on the thick side. Simply put, the food was overpriced, ingredients were low-quality, and execution was poor. 

Seriously, I was better off polishing a tub of lard because that's what I felt like afterwards and when I woke up. At least, lard itself has NO carbs. 

I can stand inattentive service but what I can't stand is rude, bitter, and condescending service. Yes, I'm talking about you, Mr. Pretty Boy with the blonde hair and the black shirt with the pompous attitude working on 10.8.11 at around 2:30 AM. For god sakes, it's a freaking diner NOT a Michelin Starred and/or a James Beard Award Winning restaurant. Even then... *"accidently" kicks off pedestal* Oppsie!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Orphan Andy's is more about the experience of eating in the Castro rather than the food. The servers are always friendly and welcoming.  It also is one of those places that makes you feel safe to be yourself.
author: Paul D.

description:
Awesome late night cozy diner spot in the Castro - it's always interesting to see who comes in, who does what, and yummy food - onion rings and chicken soup are great! 

Open 24 hours! How can you go wrong with that??

They do not serve alcohol but that's probably better! Haha
author: Alissa L.

description: Orphan Andy's is great! It's right by Twin Peaks Bar off of Castro. It's a little diner and their burgers are really good!
author: Jeffrey H.

description: Food of very poor quality. Have only been there once and that was enough. Waiter was rude to customers and coworkers. We call it Raggedy Andy's.
author: David H.

description: I have been enjoying your corner restaurant since SF in the Eighties - thank you for not going away
author: Thomas C.

description:
I really don't understand all the negative reviews, especially about the service.  I eat here a few times a week.  So much so, I know the cooks names.  From my very first visit, I have received excellent service.  Most importantly, I never feel I'm being rushed.  Orphan Andy's is a diner.  You will get best results if you order exactly what you want, and how you want it.  The kitchen is happy to do it.  And it's up to you the customer to know what it is you want.
Like your fries crispy?  No ice with your water?  Extra spinach in your omelet? Egg white only? toasted bun?  It's up to you.  This is a diner.
Remember when visiting, some of the waiters have been working at Andy's for 25+ years.  A little respect, politeness and not being a drunken asshole really improves service.
Thanks to Bill and Dennis who work so hard to keep this jewel going.
author: EC N.

description:
Soooo disappointing!!

I came here earlier with my 4year-old daughter and was shocked so shocked by the service!  Got seated, I ordered a coffee and two waters for me and my daughter.  The smart ass asks me "She is going to have coffee too?!"  Yea, dumbass!  I always give my toddler coffee!  That was the first thing.  Then, when he came back for our food order, I asked for a fruit salad for my daughter with a side of bacon.  He didn't hear me the first two times and when he finally heard that I wanted a fruit salad, he goes "Yea....  What about it??!"  With a very annoyed look on his face and a bitchy tone.  Why else would I bring up fruit salad when you are taking my order??!  

I had an omelette it was meh.. Potatoes came with.. SURPRISE!  A hair!  Yum...  Coffee tasted old.

Bacon for my daughter was super greasy, she threw up when we got home.. Over all experience sucked.

Love the Castro, but there are tons of other places I where I would much rather spend my money.  This place needs to get it together.
author: Danielle D.

description: GREAT food, nice atmosphere. Old fashioned diner, nice decor. Stays open really late, are here at about 2AM after dancing, hit the spot
author: Anon Y.

description: Open 24 hours, Orphan Andy's is a Castro institution. It was old when I first came here more than 20 years ago, on a weekend trip to SF. The jokes on the menu and the decor appear not to have aged at all. It is generally reliable diner fare. Turkey Reuben sandwich is pretty good. Burgers, fries, and other diner food are reliably good.
author: Cage H.

description:
The food was good. It was good old fashion diner food, the kind that tastes good at any time of the day and it's open 24 hours with a full menu.

The bad: everything is ridiculously overpriced for a hole in the wall diner
author: BP R.

description: Food was alright, standard diner fare, but the waiter was awkward and a bit rude. Not worth me going back again.
author: Laura H.

description: I love this place on a Saturday morning (9ish if it can be helped!). The Big 2. Sausage, French toast, scrambled eggs, bacon. Yummm! And I love the guys that work there that call you Sweetie, Darlin' and Cupcake. I think what I most appreciate about this restaurant is that I can roll in with a hoodie and I can rely on good service and good food. Of course I'm not sure how this changes during other crazier hours of the day, but I know that showing up before 10 am is ideal for peace and quiet in the Castro.
author: Natasha P.

description: Very pleasant neighborhood diner/coffee shop. Friendly staff, pretty good menu (I have been happy with the burgers and fish/chips), very well-priced. Quite convenient to the Castro Theater.
author: Jethro B.

description:
A friend gave me a warning about this place. 

"Orphan Andy's, uh-uh. Don't go there"

This place was packed when we arrived after midnight.   We managed to squeeze into the last 2 empty seats at the counter. 

I sort of heeded my friend's advice and decided to keep it simple:  2 eggs over easy with 2 pancakes.  Bf ordered omelette with ham and mushrooms. He also had 2 pancakes. 

Lo and behold!  the servings here are huge!  My pancakes are literally the size of my plate.  They must have given me 1/2 a stick of butter on the side.  I picked up my knife and cut the first slice. And cut. And cut some more. 

Either I need a sharper butter knife or my pancakes were left a bit too long on the grill.

The omelette came with no cheese.  (oops, cheese is $1.25?  extra) but the thick cuts of ham and copius amounts of mushrooms made up for the lack of flavor.  Our bill (without tip) was $17.08

Needless to say, the food here is not good. The two stars go to our server who was quick on his feet and for the fact that they are open 24 hours. 

Guess I should've gone to Mickey D's instead.
author: Janice C.

description:
Dont go here unless you're 1)male 2)gay 3)hot  (you have to be all 3) 

The service was alright but not as good as it was for people that met those 3 criteria which kinda sucks. I get that it's right in the castro but If you want to get a date go to the club/bar not while you're at work. The food was pretty good, basic stuff, but again pretty good. I'd go there again just for the food, but only if I was with a bunch of friends to help offset the service some.
author: Kate M.

description:
This all American diner is open 24hrs, so its great after a late night out with friends or after seeing a late show at the Castro theater. 

Their food is (depending on what you get) pretty good for a diner and the price (depending on what you get) is fairly reasonable. I do gotta say their chicken fried steak is really friggin good, definitely recommend it :^) They have a nice menu of choices so you'll find something that will satisfy your hunger.

The staff is hit or miss. Sometimes bitchy/catty and rude or sometimes hilarious and accommodating. You just gotta catch em when they're on a good one. 

I will say that the restaurant is pretty small for how busy it gets, but i suppose thats to be expected being in SF and all.
author: Cole C.

description: Extremely rude and no attention to our table when we sat for 15 mins or longer. Terrible to be in the middle of Castro and to be treated and disrespected as less than a value for service.  I guess long live Trump
author: Tim H.

description: This place is awesome for a late night meal after club.  I like their veggie burger with pepper and also some breakfast plates.  The surprise of it all is that they only have one person in the kitchen... one!  He (never seen a female cook there yet) is amazing to pull out all the food he does alone with the place being so packed.  If you plan to go here, do it at least thirty minutes before the club lets out or else you will be wait listed.  I've yet to see this place not have a line after 1:30 AM.
author: Andrew N.

description:
Orphan Andy's is my go to for after hours dance night munchies. I love this place! The decor is appealing, the space is intimate, the staff is as nice as you can be when your restaurant is always open and the food is solid, tasty,and dependable. The pancakes, chicken tenders and onion rings are my faves.

And my hat's off to Shane who works the late shift. He's super congenial, a great server, and takes good care of his customers.
author: Storm A.

description:
A nifty place with reasonable food and I've never had bad service. Sometimes packed and sometimes empty. Counter seating if you're alone ( unless it's really empty), the booths hold four.

The staff has always been friendly, and there seems to be a stream of regulars. 

The prices are reasonable, as is the food. It's not four star and not meant to be.

I've been several times and will keep on going.
author: R H.

description: We stumbled past Orphan Andy's with our friends from England and Australia. We normally do not go to diners but this was a wonderful surprise. The service and food - all of it was exceptional. Will return over and over again.
author: Eva M.

description: came here for a late night food run from work...checked on yelp all good reviews so im thinking why not ..i get their the place is super tiny ...the food came out quick and i see why the shit taste like they just put it in the microwave i mean how hard is it to make french toast scramble eggs and sausage. the guy cleaning tables looked hella uncomfortable the guy at the register was to busy tryn get other guys numbers  ....its all good you live and you learn only reason its 2 stars is the because it came out quick 14 dollars for trash...yall need to put more time into your food instead of speed the basics shuldnt be hard
author: Joseph R.

description: More of a drunk food place, which I unfortunately didn't realize when I went there for dinner. The food is too greasy and at times cafeteria-like-- made me feel sick. The vibe is kind of depressing and the service not 100%.
author: L. Y.

description: Went to this place for the first time today. It was pretty good! I had 30 min left for my lunch break and my food came out in about 20-25 so I pretty much had to rush to work and wait to eat later. BUT the food tasted good and I noticed how friendly and personable the staff was, with customers and with each other! Is small and busy, but that's a good sign! On a Saturday late morning too. Will try again, with more time on my hands.
author: Jazmine F.

description:
The prices are OK, probably better than average for the neighborhood. 

However, the food is mediocre and the service is f'ing terrible. TERRIBLE.  All the servers are dudes and they are all c-words. Yes, that's right, *c-words*.

I've been back two times and each time was the same. F that place.
author: Tim W.

description:
This isn't one of those "breakfast reimagined" bistro places, but the prices sure were on the high side.  Simple bacon and eggs breakfasts for 2 was nearly $30 before tip.    I suppose higher prices in this part of town are to be expected, and we were on vacation so we didn't care too much.  Overall breakfast was good.

It's a regular old diner with a regular old queen waiter who had a bit of a 'tude.  (A middle-aged queen waiter with an attitude?  NO!)   He was a bit clipped and made several  disparaging remarks about other patrons' tips when they left.  Everyone could hear him, and I thought it tacky.
author: Just Me ..

description:
Take out only when its slow.

It's a hit or miss with this place. It's a very simple breakfast & lunch spot. Perfect place to go when you are drunk, no doubt. 

I don't come here that often but every time I've came by, it's a different waiter but staff is typically nice. If they are an ass, it's because YOU are being an ass first haha.
author: Mau T.

description: It's a diner. No frills or fancy but If you like greasy burgers or breakfast at 2 AM, you'll appreciate this place. I did. It was en route as we walked back to our hotel from a night out.  We may have had a drink or 8, but we found ourselves seated at this little place with hawaiin music playing in the background.  There was something very Twin Peaks about it. lol. But the service was great and the food was good. I would definitely stumble in for pancakes at 3 AM again.
author: Alex G.

description:
Popped our cherries at Orphan Andy's. First timers!

I must be lucky to have a pretty hot husband. We were greeted & seated with smiles =) 3 to be exact; the entire staff at that eerie hour. (and when I say eerie, I mean its QUIET in the 'STRO' whoa). This was a spontaneous 'I NEED BREAKFAST' outing, so the open 24hrs schedule worked for us. Parking at the corner (near Hot Cookie) was easy.

Upon entering, you will step back into time. Its got that retro diner feel for sure. Decor is on point. 'Red light special' - lights are dim and red/maroon-ish leather at every booth. (booths have a 2 person limit btw). At every blink of an eye, you've got Marilyn and Orphan Andy tidbits of art; oh wait there's more - fit the kitchen and the counter/bar into those blinks, too. Music softly plays whatever the manager feels, I guess. (those cute tabletop jukeboxes - just for looks). Not good for groups; its tight in here!

Now time to read about...the FOOD:

We ordered steak & eggs (added 6 egg whites to please the hubbs obsession), their special side of biscuits & gravy, and stuffed french toast. No coffee, just water. 

The steak was cooked the way we ordered it; medium well. The egg whites were nice & fluffy. Nothing glorious, tho. 

Biscuits & gravy - those deserve a 'wittle' bit of glory! Of course the gravy makes this dish; thick creaminess and bits of sausage - UM YUM *in my southern accent*...The best I've had yet. Huge serving...huge!

Stuffed French Toast - if you love cream cheese, you'll ALWAYS want this. Its like they put a brick of cream cheese in the middle of two thick slabs of toast, and topped it off with innards of a warm cinnamon apple pie. Had not experienced anything like it before. Pretty delicious and creative. This too, was a lot for one person. 

Oh! Can't forget about the money part. Before ordering, we both stared at the menu and felt our faces do the 'raised eyebrow 'hmmm?' squint. A little pricey for a breakfast spot. BUT, in the end the portions made up for it. 



So folks, what have we learned here today? If you are super hungry at the crack of dawn, near the STRO,  feel like having your ego boosted a bit (if you're a male), and are with someONE; Orphan Andy's can satisfy all that. 


*Twinkle, twinkle, I gave 3 stars* - took a little while to get our food but it was good, the staff were preoccupied with stories of roommate drama most of the time, and the extended smiling at the hubbs made him uncomfortable lol...I'd only come back for the biscuits & gravy.
author: Cherie C.

description:
Open 24 hours.

The first time I came here years ago, was because I doze off, missed my stop and got off at the end of the line of the F line streetcar.

I seldom dine at late hours nowadays. But for those who do, this is the better choice in terms of food quality, out of the 3 diners that were open late night along Market street - Bagdad Cafe (now closed), and Sparky's.

The menu and prices are similar to Sparky's, but in my opinion the food is a bit better here. Service is a little rough around the edges. And prices were comfortable around $8-11.
author: Luis C.

description:
I've been to Orphan Andy's a few times now and I love them.

Their service is tops, their food is always fresh, tasty and yum, and for some reason I really like their layout. It's cozy and homey bordering on bursting with a big dose of a feeling of community.

I usually order their Philly for the heaping piles of MEAT that they smother a sourdough bun in... wait... theres a bun under there?

And while I could give or take their jukebox I love their fresh OJ.

Mmm... meat.
author: Meg T.

description: Horrible horrible service from this place. The server/cashier was extremely rude and just toss my check down and not even make eye contacts with me and he sounds extremely annoyed when I asked him to add avocado to my meal and he just rolled his eyes and yelled out loudly that they don't have avocado!! And then he whisper something to the cook . I'm pretty sure to spit in my food. Ughhhh!! Whatever. I will never EVER eat here again. I do not recommend this place to anyone. I don't even want to give it a star. They don't even deserve that!!
author: Melani L.

description: Our waiters were such sweethearts. We ordered the big 2 with French Toast. Sooooo yummy! They were so friendly and attentive. They also made fresh iced tea for us, always keeping our glasses full. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. I would strongly recommend this place to anyone wanting a delicious meal in a friendly, caring environment.
author: Austin C.

description:
I moved out of SF nearly four years ago and my favorite little diner nestled in the Castro has lost it's luster :(

Hubby and I were in town to shop like the metro wannabes we are and decided on breakfast at our favorite spot. We were greeted by the usual suspects (good to see some things haven't changed) and took our seat at the booth. Starving we ordered up their famous omelets and waited for the feast.

Our food came piping hot and we dug in. No flavor. Huh? What happened?? Our omelets had all the fixins we wanted however lacked the flavor we'd grown so accustomed to. So we thought it was just a fluke then we started in on the potatoes, no flavor again? There is something terribly wrong in the kitchen. Either they scaled back on certain ingredients or the cooks can't cook for s**t! I'm thinking the latter.

What a disappointment however I do give props to the staff for their consistent friendly ways. I should come back and ask for flavor next time however not sure what I'll get *wink*.
author: Steven G.

description: Great for late nights post club pre after party. Had the sloppy joe omelette and it was amazing. Friendly servers and a fun atmosphere. They're open 24 hours but I imagine late nights are the best time to go when your looking for something greasy to fill your stomach.
author: Nathan R.

description:
One of the FEW 24 diners in SF. We were dropped off the megabus at the ungodly hour of 2am and had no where to stay. So we sought refuge at Orphan Andy's.

What a name for a store - I first thought.
The people in the place are all so much fun - was my second thought.
That's kind of pricey - was my next thought.
That's a freak ton of food - was my last thought.

Just saying - that 2/3 pound hamburger steak would feed a lion. 

Yes, this isn't the nicest, bougiest joint in the world. But for the culture, vibe, and memories, I'll give it 5 stars.
author: Richard W.

description:
I deleted my rave review from the past.  My buddy and I got food poisoning last night.  I'm calling the owner first, then the Health Dept.

Update:  the owner offered to comp me a meal.  the city did nothing and did not answer 2 messages.
author: Kevin L.

description:
After closing out an after-hours club this last weekend, we were hungry! But, where to go at 7:00 am on a Sunday morning? "I know, Orphan Andy's!"

 Immediately after being seated, I had to use the restroom, which is through the kitchen. The bathroom was gross. There was poop or vomit on the floor (I didn't inspect it that carefully). And it turns out that the sink to wash your hands is outside the actual bathroom. It made me wonder if the staff really bothered. The state of the kitchen also seemed pretty iffy.
