Orphan Andy's is a staple of mine when I visit San Francisco.  It is a small diner in Castro.  This time I ordered a bacon cheeseburger with fries.  David ordered the chicken potato soup.  I actually liked David's soup better than my burger.  The soup tasted like homemade soup that Mom would make on a cold day.  After a cold, rainy day in SF, the soup was very warming.

The burger was good.  Nothing to blow me away but it was good.

I think I like the atmosphere as much as the food.  There is a counter you can sit at, about  4 or 5 booths and 2 tables.  The wait staff has always been attentive.
author: Adam F.

description: Awesome at night! Basic food, well prepared with people watching that is as good as it gets. I'd say this place is my favorite spot for after midnight dining in SF.
author: Michael S.

description: I have mixed feelings about this place. It's in Castro and the waiter was gay and fabulous. The garden burger and fries were delish and the waiter's humor was even better. The downside-the bathroom...WTF! You have to go down some stairs, through the dirty kitchen where I saw the dirty chef sitting at a table on his break, around the corner, up one stair where the gross bathroom is. My knees were seriously touching the door after it took me a minute to get the door closed because of how tight it was...and no mirror in there either. Other than that, it was a super fun place. A lot of the regulars were eating at the bar area and chatting with the staff. We only came here because of the name and I'm glad we did ;)
author: Christine S.

description:
I love this place as a late night after the party spot. 
Today I came in for lunch  and had the chicken fried steak, it was great ! 
but my salad .. well the mushrooms on my salad were unwashed.
which then lead me to think the rest of my salad may have been unwashed ..This really bothered me.
author: Wiley O.

description:
-At Badlands- 
"You know what sounds REALLY good right now? Chili cheese fries from Orphan Andies"

Yeap, always hits the spot!

I would never choose to come to Orphan Andies but you somehow always end up here. Especially if you're like me and get drunk munchies. 

The crowd can be very obnoxious (myself including) so the noise level can get really loud. Servers are kinda bitchy but it's a 24 hr restaurant, not expecting too much haha. 

The food is actually cooked very well and the selection is pretty long! Overall a so so restaurant but I know I'll be back.
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
Admittedly, my first trip here was inspired by getting a smog check at the gas station next door coupled with my wife's desire for biscuits and gravy.  Why not?  

The B&G were delicious, even if the gravy itself was a little cooler than I would like and as with most gravies except the ones I make myself, needed more pepper.  I had the Huevos Rancheros with a heaping side of breakfast potatoes.  Quite a lot of food done up well.  I don't know that I'll be going out of my way to get back here, but it was worth the stop.  Very nice service and endless coffee.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
I can't believe I've waited this long to review Orphan Andy's! For shame! Anyway, it's pretty hard to go wrong here -- attractive and friendly men serving you delicious and hearty diner food, with the added bonus of tiny tabletop jukeboxes to enhance the whole experience. And it's open 24 hours. 

My most recent experience wasn't quite as stellar, only because the sloppy joe I ordered wasn't as exciting as I hoped it'd be, but everything else I've ever had here has been tasty -- the burgers are great, the shakes are exactly what you want a shake to be, the breakfast food is a stealthy combatant to a hangover. In short, I keep coming back.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
If you didn't notice all the rainbow flags outside on the street all you have to do is look at the menu logo for Orphan Andy's to realize you are in the Castro! 

The even bigger surprise is what you will find inside the menu. You will find a selection of great diner food. You can have breakfast if you want. In fact it is served 24/7!!! For those from the South that miss it, they do have biscuits and gravy!!! 

I ended up getting a grilled chicken sandwich with mushrooms on wheat toast. Plus a side of fries. It was a great sandwich and you get plenty of fries.
author: Justin C.

description: Not best place in town but the meat was great!
author: Suer_one ..

description: Well I think that their food is awesome and everything is fresh in what I like is there a meatloaf is so good, I'm quite sure that place has changed a lot since I was there last time Dennis and Bill are very nice people to work for and they have helped the gay community very much in many ways they always been good or nice  of the restaurant and the food is amazing good. Love always, luis ortiz
author: Luis O.

description:
Love the cozy place
Staff was friendly, but more importantly service was fast
Food is good and the portions are big

Keep group size to a minimum as the place is small, try for no more than a table for 4
Sometimes a long wait
author: B M.

description:
Place was cuter than I had expected!  Diner food with a cozy flare.

This restaurant is steps from Castro theater, and always good for a post-bar eating binge (open 24 hours!).  Waiter was charming, and attentive.  Breakfast potatoes were over done and dry as a bone.  However, the pancakes were excellent!! Overall, I'd eat here again.. maybe try the tuna melt next time, yum!

PS: We were 5 women, and were treated with the utmost grace and respect.. I wanted to add this because there seems to be some comments about women being ignored for service here.
author: Nicole W.

description:
Great food but DISGUSTINGLY horrible service. Blonde facial-haired waiter was the rudest person I have literally ever met. My boyfriend and I went to have dinner and we were ignored by our waiter until he speed walked past us without making eye contact WITH HIS EARBUDS IN. That was the only contact we had with him.  He was obvious being very rude and trying to piss us off for some reason. I discreetly ask the other waiter if they share tips, (he was very nice and I didn't want to screw him over with a bad tip.) our original waiter comes over, SITS DOWN, and hostilely asks, "What was wrong with my service?" And I said, "I'm sorry, We just felt you were kind of aloof and gave us our service in passing." And he scoffs loudly to cash my payment, (I still tipped 10%,) and he FOLLOWS US OUT and yells at us, "Remember, Castro is for the gays." And I said, excuse me? Not even believing that that was what he hated us for.
I asked for a manager's number, and he writes it down angrily and says that we will get an earful for disrespecting him. We leave and he follows us AGAIN and calls us homophobes and says "we is why they need the castro to protect them from straights." We talk and I explain that I had no problem with his sexuality and that we love the castro because it is inclusive and loving, and he is just an arrogant, piece of shit asshole. He then says, "fine, if you're sorry, give me a hug." He swoops at me and I say, don't touch me, (he's obviously hostile and unstable,) and he screams, "NOT A HOMOPHOBE, RIGHT? SHE DOESNT WANT ME TO TOUCH HER, I'M TOO GAY," causing a scene and I start crying because he literally is just set on being volatile and caustic and is profiling us as HOMOPHOBES. We are both liberal, accepting, loving people who speak out for rights of all kinds and this cannot be FARTHER from the truth. He then calls me, "venomous," and says I "need to learn how to communicate." I walk back inside and ask the nice waiter for the managers number and he apologizes and gives it to us. Super sweet. More passive aggressiveness and I call the manager who calmly and respectfully apologized. Haven't decided if I'm coming back. Only if they fire him. 
Discrimination is discrimination, and no one deserves it.
author: Stefanie G.

description: Stopped in with my daughter for a quick lunch before heading back to Felton. Loved  the vibe in the place & the waiter was sassy & fun. We split a burger (which I often hate doing because restaurants kind of frown on that sometimes) and it came on 2 separate plates with fries on each & our very fresh condiments on the side! So awesome! The meat was well seasoned & SO good. Perfectly cooked! We both left there perfectly filled up & didn't have to deal with leftovers. Even had room for a cookie at the Hot Cookie place around the corner. We LOVED this place!!
author: Redwood G.

description: Came in here for some late night grub.  Suffice to say I was not disappointed.  Milk shake was great along with the chicken tenders and onion rings.  Not only was the food good but the service was also quite friendly and attentive.  This is a great little gem in the Castro.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Let's see - cold eggs and non-existent service. 
Take a pass.
author: Bill G.

description:
Typical diner food, nothing to special except for the service and price. Both were awesome! Came here with a small group for brunch on a Sunday and expected a wait, but the rain must have turned people off because we were seated immediately, right next to the window. YAY!

We all got your typical breakfast stuff and it was all fine, portions were kind of huge for the price, which was great! Local friends we met up with suggested it and it was super fun, but would I trek here normally? Nope. Good place to stop in if in the area though.
author: Rebecca S.

description: good folks, in the castro, lgbtq friendly, good service, good prices, and open 24 hours. small long lines at 130am 2am when the clubs close down, so that speaks for it self
author: Leigh G.

description:
Good, 24hr food in SF. Eat-in, cooked to order, avoid the 2AM crowd. For Swing Shifters, or those not in the "I need the perfect meal at 3AM, although I can't even spell my name" it's awesome.
With so few food options in a major American West Coast California city...it's a great establishment.

Party folks...eat shit and just pass out already. No one want's your business anyhow.
author: Enoch K.

description: This is what it is. 24 hour diner food. Not terrible, not amazing, just okay. Good for when you're in the mood for it or when you want some pancakes and no one else is serving breakfast.
author: Heather R.

description:
I come to Orphan Andy's 'cause it's open at 2 a.m. when I want a banana pancake. Or two. And tea. 

Service is hit or miss here. Most of the time, there's only 2 servers for the entire diner and they have to deal with drunk obnoxious people so I forgive them. 

When we do actually get to order food, it's delivered in a quick manner with the proper condiments and a smile. At 2 a.m.  I'd come here for breakfast foods, not burgers or sandwiches since they come out a little dry and makes you leave desiring for better.

Don't mind the nasty drunk people getting rowdy in the booths along the wall-just try to grab the window seat and you'll be sheltered from all that. 

The last time we came in, we had a lovely man wait on us and enough though he did seem thoroughly put through the ringer, he was always accommodating and on time with everything. I think he was new since he was asking other people how long they've been working at Andy's and if they liked it. I hope he stays.
author: Jessica K.

description:
I love eating at 24-hour diners. hungry people filled to the brim with booze, eagerly awaiting grease and some water [or coca cola] and happy for that wait to be 35 minutes because there are only so many places in SF still serving at 3 AM.

Orphan Andy's does really good 24-hour diner food with a fun Castro twist. this past weekend I stood in line 45 minutes [yes, a long wait] because we unfortunately hit at the after-bar magic hour. the place was packed with revelrous and buoyant folks enjoying their meals. all three in my party ordered the egg sandwich [I honestly haven't ordered anything else] and everyone agreed they were sheer yumminess. served on wheat with all the regular burger fixin's [lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle!] - yumm. add an order of onion rings [the best I think I've ever had - onion and crunch break off in a seamless bite each and every time!] and you're guaranteed a happy tomorrow.

our server was attentive, fast, sweet, and totally unfazed by the craziness swarming around him. at 330 AM - a task in and of itself. I left happy.

I cannot attest to daytime vibe, but weekend wee hours are fun, noisy, and very Castro, and I totally dig.
author: Rachel W.

description:
Horrible service last night/this morning from the snotty queen with plucked eyebrows.
Yes, its 2 am and you are waiting on a bunch of drunk fools..but you know what its your JOB..if you dont like it get a job somewhere else...

Butterface aside, this place has pretty good diner food.  My friend had a Strawberry milkshake and kept stopping every ten seconds to tell me how good it was....I had mozarella sticks....yum.

I'll be back...wont tip Butterface if he waits on me again.
author: Ripley B.

description: the world needs to know beat country fried steak and eggs 100! great customer service from bruce and team!
author: Hella 7.

description:
For people who love getting a truly home cooked breakfast 24 hours a day in a diner type environment, this is the place to go to in San Francisco. I discovered this place years ago after searching for a cure to jetlag when I was still living in a foreign country and would only make it back to the bay area a few times per year. 
They have one of the best chicken fried steak and eggs in town, which I always order with a side of country biscuits and gravy. The pancakes are awesome here too.
Be warned, if you come on a Friday or Saturday night... expect lines and a somewhat energetic crowd that lets out after the Castro bar scene lets out.
author: Mark Y.

description:
Not sure how I never went here before, just a few blocks from my house and serves one of my favorite cuisines... Breakfast.

It's an old fashioned, bit queeny but not over the top, diner breakfast restaurant. Seems like it is always full of people but I had no trouble getting a spot at the bar.

Ordered the hot cakes, eggs and veggie sausage. The waiter was fantastic, incredibly busy but he managed to make my breakfast pleasant with coffee refills before I even needed to ask and food that arrived just a few minutes after ordering.

The pancakes are huge, nearly 1/2 thick and probably 8-10 inches around. The eggs were cooked as ordered (over medium) and the veggie sausage, surprisingly, did not appear to be the frozen variety and if so, a much higher end than many restaurants serve. It was delicious.

In the future I think I would order one pancake, not the standard two but other than that, it was the perfect little breakfast. 

I find it difficult to give any restaurant a five star review after only going a few times, much less once as in this case but if I did, it would be because of continued quality food and service as well as some experimentation with their menu. It's pretty standard and that's just fine but part of me wanted to see something unique for such a unique establishment.
author: Justin S.

description:
Standard diner food. Open late (only late sit down restaurant in the Castro).

Why 4 stars then? I like how cozy the space is. It's a great place to grab a late night snack after the bars close. Thanks to its central Castro location and its small, warm layout, the place is always buzzing with energy.
author: bart m.

description:
I'm in the process of moving to San Francisco.  I spent the weekend in my new apartment and explored my neighborhood.  I saw Orphan Andy's.  

I am so happy to have come across this place because it is EXACTLY what I was looking for:

1.Open 24 hours
2. Good breakfast

After a night out on the town you NEED to eat some breakfast at a diner at 4am.  It's required.  

Thank you Orphan Andy's to be my new after-party spot.
author: David M.

description:
A great place to go to for sobering up after a night of clubbing. But when you're sober, don't. It's mediocre food but the staff was nice. It has a very "mom and pop" shop feel to it.

On nights when the Castro is busy this place can also be busy as well. But not worth the wait in my opinion but it is the only place that is opened super late.
author: Hayden P.

description: This is the kind of place I wish there were more of in NY. It's super super tiny, it's really worn in, but the food is great. Good quality, great tasting foodstuffs. Sometimes there's naked people chillin' outside so there's that too.
author: Mark C.

description:
Matt met wifey for lunch at this busy Castro St. diner. This place is also one of many stapled lunch-spots for her with/without co-workers, as Seinfeld to Monk's cafe. Whenever she comes here, it appears that she is the only female, besides the waitresses, at the restaurant. Many people, who live in the neighborhood, come here in desperation, if other places are busy.

Matt has only been here a few times, with some of the "catch-22" dishes can be "at-risk." Last visit, Matt ordered the cheeseburger here, and it tasted "OK". On the date of this review, wife recommended the Country-fried Steak breakfast. The meal includes mashed-spuds, and eggs for $11.00. It was ok, at least better than the burger from Matt's previous visit. She ordered the Denver Omelet. Her meal was good for under $10.00. We bypassed desserts and opted to find sweets at other places in the Castro.
author: Matt G.

description:
1. The food is greasy spoon done well.

2. You have to love the fabulous kilt-clad and completely adorable wait staff.

3. Sit at the counter and order a club sandwich with onion rings - you won't regret it.

This is the second time I've been to O.A. and it was definitely more entertaining this time around due to the fact that it was my friend MJ's wedding night (her husband was at his bachelor party) (LONG STORY) and she got the cutest Married Pie evah!

Also, I put my fork down after my final bite and this dude who was dangerously drunk stabbed at it with his butter knife and then just pulled the plate over and started eating my leftovers. F*cking crajee, right?!? Apparently he just couldn't wait for his tuna melt (gag).

Like I said...totally entertaining.
author: Tara H.

description: On August 9, 2012 Thursday Night around 10:30pm, I saw two mice while waiting for the restroom. I informed the rest of my party that was waiting for our table on what I saw on the level below the kitchen, I informed the staff  about the issue and they where Extremely rude about it.
author: Walter T.

description: Delicious food. Wonderful and respectful staff. Better than Sparky's 'cos you get acknowledged right away, your order gets to the kitchen and back to you in a reasonable amount of time, and they go out of their way to connect and have a little fun too.
author: Cory M.

description: It is pretty much the only place in the Castro that's open late. When you're drunk you gotta eat. So come here for some good ol breakfast place. However, don't expect much. Usually the good breakfast place opens at 6:00am and not closes that time. However people gotta eat and have the need to continue the party which is great. I like the name, Orphan Andy's. Like the what Peter Pan once said, "I guess we do have something in common.. We are all orphans."
author: J C.

description:
Orphan Andy's is the best place in the Castro for late-night munchies.  It's open 24hrs, so when all the bars close at 2am (or when you accidentally stay at the Endup until 7am) and you need a quick bite, keep this on your short list.  The menu is standard diner fare, but everything is pretty spot-on and satisfying.  The chocolate-chip pancakes are especially tastey, and also love the patty melt.  Just be sure to take some Tums before hitting the sack.  3.5 stars, rounded up

-A&L
author: AdamLowell C.

description:
Had a desperate need to get french fries and a milk shake the other night after a pretty screwy day. It was late and most places weren't open anymore. Luckily Orphan Andy's is 24 hours and in the Castro so it was still lively in the area. I'm not big on walking around a quiet area. 

The strawberry milk shake was really good, but a bit too sweet and this was after the guy said he was going to make it less sweet for me already. It was almost $6 just for the shake, but it was worth it. It was also not as big as other places like Mel's where they give you the glass and the extra in the tin; all of it fit in one cup. But that is a-okay with me because I still couldn't finish it. Nothing special about the fries, but he did offer me different sauces. I love honey mustard. 

Overall, great place to get that milk shake/ french fries fix.
author: Angela T.

description: This place looks like a Castro institution.  A simple diner- and I usually love diner food, but the food was mediorce at best.  Very friendly server.  Very good coffee.  Great location, love the fact that its open 24 hours.  Just not the place to go for good food.
author: Evan G.

description: Very good Diner food.  Open late for the night time munchies.  Wait staff is always pleasant and helpful.  I stop by here for dinner while hanging out in the castro.
author: AJ M.

description: Really disappointed after my last visit tonight wednesday 11/26 at 1:15 am. 1st the guy that took my Togo order tried to skimp me on my change. I handed him a 20 and he tried to give me back a dollar and all I ordered was the breakfast bagel, which is 7.20+ tax he tried to say I only gave him a ten but I only had 2 twenties that I had just got from the bank. He gave me 10 after our brief conversation but that still didn't equate to the correct change. I should have gotten another dollar even to begin with had I given him a ten the change was not correct.  I come in here fairly regularly as I work across the street and this guy never seems to have that great of an attitude. He kind of a bigger guy and always where's a hat.  Next  time I won't even allow him to take my order. it's extremely obvious that he is not happy with his job and on top of that I'm sober and thus know that my change was wrong.... how about the drunk ppl that come in? I really hope this guy's pockets arnt getting fat trying to take advantage of the fact that most of the people that come in are under the influnce. BAD VIBES all around with this one.
author: Kody S.

description: Delicious old fashion dinner with good food.
author: Rob P.

description: First time at Orphan Andy's. My server really didn't seem to care about me. I ordered the mushroom burger with a side of fries. My burger was dry and slightly burnt, my fries were lukewarm and half were over fried. I was never asked how I wanted my burger so I thought it would be medium well, like most good burger places. Denny's has better burgers and less attitude. My partner had the minestrone soup, I had a spoonful of it and the soups vegetables did not taste fresh and it was over salted. I wish the Castro had better places to eat. Maybe this place is better at 2am when your drunk off your ass and have numbed your tongue. First time here and last.
author: V M.

description: 24 hours, which is a huge plus for the city, but the food never tasted good, no matter how many times we came there and what we ordered. The bathroom door looks like you are Alice in Wonderland opening an elf door to begin your adventure. But the servers are nice.
author: Sasha Z.

description: Its 24hrs diner in a small place. Great for late night. he waiter is very attentive.
author: Ivy Ziwei L.

description: Took my friend who just returned from teaching abroad in China here because she HAD to have Bacon and Eggs!!  Well we ordered that and then some - Amazing!!
author: Daniel P.

description: The food is decent, but tonight I have to leave 2 stars b/c I asked for extra mayo with my take-out sandwhich and fries and I was told "of course!" but I got not only no EXTRA mayo, but NONE at all.  And that just pisses me off.  I was obviously taken for a fool b/c they thought I was dumb and drunk and it didn't matter.  RUDE AS FUCK.  It just wasn't nice.
author: Gregory S.

description: I live in the neighborhood and visit here often for either a group late night post-bar sober up meal, or a solo at the counter quick no cook dinner. The food is always decent for a diner, quick, and incredibly cheap. The staff are always nice and often sassy, but leave me alone when I want it that way.
author: Colleen T.

description:
Probably the best 24-hour diner in the city!  Wide selection of delicious choices.  

Hungry in the middle of the night?  This is the place for you.
author: Tod G.

description:
I just got out of the Popsicle Concert and was lookin for some good grub.  It was ~3am and Orphan Andy's was one of the few places that offered food at the time.  Having never been to Orphan Andy's, I saw a line outside (5 people) and a sign posted in front of the door, covering the entrance, and it said, "Please Wait to be Seated".  So my friend and I waited IN LINE for about 15 minutes and we saw a few people just zipped us and went on in.  WTF?  So I went in and inquired the wait time and the waiter at the front said, "Is your name on the list?"  "No, I didn't know there was a list.  I'm just following the sign"  "Sign your name on the list"  "How long do you suppose the wait is, approximately?"  "Look, you either sign your name on the list, or not" and he set the list down and walked off. 

Eff that.  I looked around and noticed that the food looks incredibly delicious!  But if the service isn't there and I don't feel wanted, I'd prefer to dine elsewhere.

And we did....Sparkies?  (FYI:  Food may be mediocre at Sparkies, but at least the service was better than Orphan Andy's and I felt wanted) =P
author: Dararith L.

description: I love their grilled cheese sandwiches.  Exactly what you want if you're looking for classic diner food, and they're pleasant and the prices are reasonable.  No complaints :)  I wish I was eating their grilled cheese sandwich right now.
author: Amy M.

description:
Check out the health inspector's report on Orphan Andy's: 

http://dph-extranet2.sfdph.org:7777/pls/eeop_htmldb/f?p=132:2:2226601787041124::NO::P2_LOCATIONID,P2_VIOLATION_TYPE_ID:1289,631

The report says it all!
author: Haji D.

description:
Annie loves Andy!

Oh boy the burgers were so yummy!
Oh boy the waiter was so cute and nice!
Oh boy we got a great table and people watched!
Oh boy they put a brick of cream cheese on my burger!!!

I bet this place is great even when you're sober! 
OH BOY!!
author: Lee P.

description: Food is good and great location. Love the home cooking.  However, service needs improvement. Waiter took my order then sat down at the counter and began eating his own food. I was thoroughly grossed out when he brought me my food and had a mouth full of food! Disgusting!  Obviously, management doesn't have any rules about employees not eating in the dining room or in front of guests.  That's what employee break rooms are for! I won't be back after this nasty experience.
author: Brandon L.

description:
The meals I've have had at Orphan Andy's over the last ten years have all been OK. I appreciate their being open 24 hrs. After all, the only times I've eaten there are when nothing else close-by is open.

My beef with OA's is how rude, condescending and indifferent the staff there can be. I worked in the service industry for many years - waiting tables, bartending - so  I know how difficult a job it is to put up with the clientele which being open all night attracts. Given that, when I go to OA's, I've already lowered my expectations for service. Still, there's just no excuse for the smarmy attitude expressed by SOME of the staff the past several times I've visited this establishment. As a resident of SF, I hate to think of the impression their staff may be leaving on visitors to "our fair city."
author: Scott B.

description: Cute diner in the Castro with good service and hot food. I had the french dip sandwich with potato salad. The sandwich was delicious with the au jus being one of the best I have tasted (most places serve tasteless oily au jus). The potato salad (which I am usually a big critic of at most places) was perfect, freshly prepared  with just the right portion. Prices were cheap to boot.
author: Zak P.

description: I rarely write one-star reviews, but the staff here is so intent on finding and punishing drunk a-holes, they punish regular customers in the mix. So disappointing to wait over an hour for a shitty meal as people who have been waiting almost half the time get their food. This place sucks, consistently.
author: Michael S.

description:
I was transported here under the pretence that it was named, 'Orphan Annie's'. When it is difficult to move me, my mates pander to my ego, I like to think everything is named after me. They actually kept that charade up for over a year, it's only through Yelp that I am learning Andy is the proper name... It should be Annie. Ego aside, I love this place.

After drinking far too much in the Homestead, we were deposited at 2 am from a moving car like the lecherous drunks we were to this mecca of... Well, lecherous drunks.

You have to give props to servers that are polite and patient with folks that have willingly drenched their brains in vodka & beer and therefore read at a 4 year old's level.

Everyone loved their food, and no I was not that far gone to remember what I got and how it tasted. It was good! Italian sausage, poached eggs & pancakes! They aren't afraid of huge portions here.

Bone of contention is the loo. Kinda unnerving walking through a kitchen whilst alcohol is embracing and dictating my mobility... I kept looking at the knives and hot stoves whilst swaying... Then there is the friggen stairs down to the loo... Basically think long and hard about whether you wanna pee here. Ask yourself can you hold it in till home? If not, start your drunken mobility training now, cause it's like Indiana Jones in there.

Atmosphere at that time of night is obviously tipsy but, jolly. Everyone was in great form and it's great to see the one night stands forming over eggs and bacon.
author: Annie L.

description:
On a cold crisp slightly rainy night, there is nothing more comforting than a bowl of chicken soup from Orphan Andy's.  The stuff is fantastic.  Nice big pieces of chicken, plenty of veggies, and flavorful broth.  Order it to go, bring it home, strip your clothes off, jump into sweats and a sweater, and curl up on the couch with a good horror flick.   And if your stomach wants something more hearty, try their chicken fried steak sandwich - sure to get you full.   

Also, Orphan Andy's is open 24hrs.  Gotta love it.
author: Juv C.

description:
I can't believe we waited an hour for a table here at like 3 or 4am.
Waiters were grumpy but I'd probably be too if I had to wait on a bunch of drunk people on a drizzly San Francisco night...
However, the food was great! I had the sloppy joe omelette which was phenomenal! Fluffy and tender! 
Was it worth the wait? The crabby service? Nahhh...but a yummy one time experience nonetheless.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Can't say it's a favorite late night place, but works in a pinch. 

The ice cream you get here is that fluffy, watered down kind that you used to eat as a kid. It's just not as good as it was back in the day, just like twinkies and zebra stripe bubble gum. Something about the flavor and the textures have soured with age. I mean, your age, not the age of the food, because no one wants to eat a 10 year old ice cream sundae. 

I will say, though, that they are very generous with the pies, if you know what I'm saying.
author: Kevin L.

description: Found this place on Yelp when we were searching for a place open late after a show at Cafe du Nord - what a great surprise!  Friendly and engaging staff, great comfort food and super reasonable prices.  Even got a little history on the place from our waiter!  If you're looking for a great 24-hour diner in the neighborhood, this is your stop.  We loved it and can't wait to go back.
author: Tommy T.

description: I know a lot of the reviews are down on the service but it's never been a problem for me.  I love their grilled cheese sandwiches (yeah, the last one kind of tasted like hamburger, oops...) and the giant plate of fries you get with it.  My friend got an omelet with toast and potatoes AND a whole plate of pancakes that just comes with it.  Mmmm.  I like a lot of food.  No complaints here - well, except when my grilled cheese tasted like hamburger, but that was unusual.
author: M C.

description:
Orphan Andy's is great diner food served 24/7 at a great location in SF. The food is decent and the portions are generous. I always order breakfast food and they do it well. I've been there probably 7 times and I always get an omelette or pancake dish of some sort and it's never been bad. The location at Castro/Market makes it very convenient and close to the Castro bars. 

The service is really friendly (even with having to put up with drunks every night). I got charged an extra $10 one time on my credit card, but the waiter kindly adjusted it. Sometimes there's a line to get a table b/c of all the people leaving the bars want to grab some great food.
author: Phil H.

description: I love this place. Consistently tasty food (the pancakes are fantastic), super-friendly service and very reasonable prices. Is it gourmet? Well, no - it's a diner. But easily one of the best diners in the City!
author: Kimberly J.

description:
The late night wait staff is bitter and never friendly. On a few occasions, I called the wait staff out on their rude comments and their replies were always, "go somewhere else." 

The wait staff has no customer service experience. Bottom line--if you're reading this, save yourself the stress and do what the wait staff always told me to do..."GO SOMEWHERE ELSE."
author: TED N.

description:
I came here a few months back and saw it in someone's reviews, and I decided to review it since I didn't have Yelp at the time I actually went. Within ten minutes of arriving at this place, I:

- got called a slut by two bitter looking queens for working a pole on the side of the street while we were waiting to be seated. How can I be a slut if you already know I'm not going home with either of you?

- got in an argument with a drunken drag queen from Stockton who was giving an OLD LADY the evil eye through the windows for taking too long to eat her meal

- had a burger with blue cheese, portions were pleasingly hefty and did not cause my wallet too much damage.

I had a great time. I don't come to the Castro nearly as often as I used to, but I'd like to come back.
author: Aivy C.

description: My family and I went to Orphan Andy's while on a trip from Southern California, and I have to say that the service and food were great. Not a place to go if you want to eat and run, because they do get busy, and a lot of the customers are regulars, so there is a constant flow of friendly conversations going on with the staff.  We didn't feel out of place in the least, because our waiter engaged us instantly in conversation as though we came there everyday.  I ordered the pancakes and they were by far the best I've ever had.  I'm 45 so that's saying something.  My husband had the cheeseburger and he said it was delicious.  The kids were equally impressed, though my oldest didn't really care for his omelet.  Definitely a place that we'd go back to when we're in the City!
author: L V.

description:
Probably one of the most awkward situations I've ever had at a restaurant. So I get there and ask if there's any chicken noodle soup, a normal question I thought but boy was I wrong. He answered yes but in a way that made me feel like I was a moron for even asking. Totally uncalled for and such a buzz kill. I responded yes as I uncomfortably sat In the 2nd to last table. He the continued to speak to me as if I a child and made me feel so uncomfortable as he
thankfully put on some music but even the song chose was off. So as if he didn't make it most uncomfortable, the  Biz owner then sat at the last table so that he was facing me and put a menu on the condiment tray to try and cover his face as e slept. I'm glad he was comfortable at my expense.I pretty much lost my appetite by then. Then the chef who is also Mr clean decided to sweep under my table totally hitting my feet and not caring which was followed by him cleaning the floors with a strong smelling pine sol or something to that nature while I was trying to eat.  The cherry on top, the sleeping slobb in the back farting or passing gas and his employee also catching the unpleasant sound and just giggling about it all while Mr clean is throwing dishes around making as much h noise as he could. Al in all it was uncomfortable, disgusting an oldd soup was way too salty. Definuteybmy my last time
author: T J.

description: I have an old menu from Little Orphan Andy's that dates back to the 70s and today their menu still features hearty breakfasts and burgers for lunch, dinner, and snacks. The prices are reasonable. They are conveniently located near the bars in the Castro so their fabulous club sandwich is a favorite choice for a late night meal.
author: Ted C.

description:
The chicken fried stake is amazeballs.

Service is okay, last time I went the young skinny tall waiter who I've seen there before served us, when I went to try to put a selection to play on the jukebox, he stopped me and said he was listening to his own playlist! REALLY??
author: NC B.

description: I had high hopes for this quaint and picturesque dinner but my experience and more importantly my food was mediocre. To start with, the bathroom was out of order.  Ummm, where am I supposed to go??  Its never fun to eat a big meal on a full stomach.  Regardless, I was starving....I ordered a cheeseburger, fries and a coke.  The burger was just ok.  Not super juicy...and definitely dint give me that "hot off the grill" feeling.  But it wasn't bad either.  My server was your average cute and friendly neighborhood Castro boy.  He mentioned being hungover but he made me laugh and he was attentive.  Overall, this place has average quality dinner food but the location can't be beat!
author: Liz B.

description:
$30 for chicken and French dip.

To be fair, the best French dip I've ever had was from some random place in Bumfuck, Utah in the heart of Mormon territory where it seemed like they'd quarter gays with SUVs and pick-up trucks, round-up masses of Mexicans into concentration camps through operation "Cable Splicer", and bring back lynching for blacks. Best French dip in my entire life, even when the staff surrounded me suggesting how "really good the food" was and how "perfect" the service was,--which it really was. But it was almost Texas Chainsaw creepy for a moment. 

But that is not what this review is about. 

Feeling much safer in San Francisco, a friend and I went to Orphan Andy's for the first tonight and the only good thing was the exceptional service from the girl with the cute voice. The French dip was really chewy,--not tender at all--and "at best mediocre". The fries I got tasted good, but a little like they came out of a Costco-brand, flash-fry frozen french fry bag. 

My friend got his food with gravy against his wishes, and his biscuit in the middle of his meal so all the grease was absorbed into it. It was really bad for the price we paid, I think. But really, if it hadn't been for the awesome service we got, it'd be only one star. Too bad you can't just rate the staff, ¿no?
author: Federico E.

description:
You know what you need at 2AM when you are tanked and starving? *delicious french fries*!! You know what orphan A's has? Some freaking *delicious* french fries. On top of that, they also have red shiny leather seats, an awesome 60s kitsch theme, and milkshakes. MILKSHAKES people! OK, actually I'm not sure if they have milkshakes, but given the level of loaded I was at when I was last there, I was convinced the did. I hope its not one of those situations where I brought my own ice cream to a place and demanded them to make something with it...hmmm.

But I digress...take home message? You should be here next time you are tanked.
author: Sean C.

description:
I was both annoyed and saddened from my latest visit to Orphan Andy's because one of the servers was unapologetically rude.

Getting annoyed is self-explanatory, but I was saddened because this server (who was once a breath of fresh air, eager to provide great customer service with a radiant smile) now seemed older and haggard, crotchety and jaded.  He seemed broken at such a young age.  I think he realized that he was rude, but instead of admitting his mistake, he tried to lobby for support from another table instead.  It failed, because they came over after their meal and offered us his name.

It's sad to witness this type of change - the transformation of a once amiable individual into someone so irreverent and impolite.  Is this the result of the restaurant industry?  Life?  Time?

But there's hope!  Our actual server was perfect.  He was friendly, efficient, attentive, kind, and apologetic.  I think he's new, and I sincerely hope that he doesn't suffer the same fate as the server before him.

Regardless of last night, I still like Orphan Andy's overall (just one star less).  I'll return and hope for at least 4-star treatment during my next visit.  I guess I have more faith than my dining companions who swear never to return.

Previous 4 star review:
Chicken fried steak with eggs over medium.  This is my standard order after a full night of drinking in the Castro, and it always hits the spot!  It's greasy enough to soak up the alcohol, and the semi-liquidity of the gravy and runny eggs helps it to go down easily.  Hey, after that much drinking, you're too tired to chew, right?

The servers are pretty amazing, and the cook is the sweetest.  One night, I asked him to put extra bacon on my order on my way to the bathroom (which is through the kitchen and down the stairs), and he did!  Yay for extra bacon!  They're pretty fast at clearing tables too - the last thing you want to do that late at night is to wait for a table.

The food is better than some of the other greasy spoons nearby, and definitely more flavorful, probably because they don't skimp on all the fatty goodness.  For the price you pay, the food is good and the portions are perfect.

The Orphan Andy character (on all menus) also rocks!  He's this old-school, curly-haired, furry chested, bulge-in-pants, 70's/80's Castro clone wannabe who's searching for a place to belong.  He's certainly found a place in my heart!
author: Vicente G.

description:
You need to know 3 things in any city: a good dry cleaner, a good coffe spot, and a good 24 hour diner.  I think the first time I went to Andy's was New Years eve and I was drunk to a point of WOW.  I think i even fell asleep on the counter.  The staff was very sweet and didn't mind my slurring or god only knows what else.  I was hooked.

I have been back man times for late night milkshakes and bacon or fries and I am always really happy.  It is a tiny little spot and it sucks that it is so hard to get in or just hard to find parking near the place because I would go alot more often.  I live their stuff and will continue to come here after a night of shows.
author: Amy P.

description: What a horrible ending to a wonderful night.  Stopped by Andy's Saturday, 10/19/13, after a night of fundraising.  I stood in line waiting to be seated.  Next thing I know two people walk in and seat themselves.  I asked what is going on as I am waiting in line?  The waiter was so rude in his response that I walked out of the restaurant.  What a little punk-ass.
author: Patrick N.

description: The diner has a quaint old school inner city diner feel. I had the sloppy joe omelette and pancakes. The omelette was pretty good, decent sloppy joes and good eggs. The pancakes were good also, though not amazing. Maybe a 6/10. Although it's hard for me to judge them effectively, because I slathered them in butter. Seriously, a ton of butter. Imagine how much butter I probably put on them and double it. I'd say that's not so much a slam on the pancakes as a compliment to the butter. It was delicious.
author: Chad C.

description:
In one week Orphan Andy's has saved my drunk ass from doing unmentionable acts to whomever I may have been out drinking with TWICE. Yes, two separate nights of throwing back (one thanks to yelp) led me to your doors. What can I say - beer makes me horny but food brings me back to reality and reminds me to keep my pants on. 

Open 24 hours, huge portions. yummy burger, decent enough fries and onion rings, grilled cheese was totally not greasy enough though. If I am ordering something fatty bring it on - I'll hit the gym when I'm sober I promise. Exceptionally nice wait staff who I observed handing drunk obnoxious patrons with class. AND the first night I was there some random adorable couple bought my dinner! 

Thanks for helping me not be a whore Orphan Andy's - I'm a fan even though my drinking buddies probably hate you now. 

peace, love, and good booze ~ chase
author: Chase S.

description:
9:45, after we peel out of the Yelp party due to hunger.

Orphan Andy's down the street.  24 hour diner.  Awesome.  We're in.

Sat at the bar.  Two waters.  A heaping plate of bacon, eggs, toast and potatoes.

The servers are ridiculously nice.  And Klassy with a K.  Thanks for putting up with our gibberish and bringing out the food super fast.  You rock!
author: Jenny L.

description: Many a drunken night at the Castro has ended here at Orphan Andy's, primarily for its hours and location.  The food is typical diner faire.  Their walls are adorned with interesting Orphan Andy artifacts to look at, and it's a cozier 24 hour diner than Sparky's, but Sparky's definitely has greater variety on their menu.
author: Jenn C.

description:
This is a great place to go for a late night meal after partying in the Castro, or for a lazy afternoon lunch after a yoga class.

The menu is pretty classic american diner-style and the food seems to always satisfy my taste buds.  I came here a few years back to get a burger for lunch and remember being very pleased by the experience.  I came here two days ago after my yoga class with some friends for brunch and was pleasantly surprised by the huge breakfast portions.  I had the 2 eggs special with french toast (only $1.25 extra), orange juice (freshly squeezed and very sweet, though I'm guessing they must have added sugar), and green tea.  We all cleaned our plates!  The waiter was super friendly, had just the right amount of sass, and was very accommodating when we asked to split the bill on three cards.

The booth seating is really cute and the ambience is perfect.  I definitely will come back for more!
author: Ben T.

description:
Good, old-time place complete with all that Castro feel.  Pancakes are very good
and you can't go wrong if you stick to week-days.  Very crowded on week-ends
and bet not to go then.
author: Richard D.

description:
After reading a handful of reviews, it is quite apparent that I need to set the record straight (so to speak) about what y'all should expect at Orphan Andy's.  

The Castro is the gay Disneyland.  It is a place to watch and be watched, to hook up (if you're into that sort of naughty thing), and to put it simply, to be gay, bitchy, and utterly fabulous.  Do yourself a favor and before you walk into OA, take a look at the waiters and customers.  Do they look conservative and business-like?  No.  Does the place look like a high-end restaurant with imported decor that was professionally designed?  No.  Do the waiters look like they give a fuck?  Definitely, NO.  And that's the beauty of OA.  This place is a 24 hour diner that caters to drunken and obnoxious fags and dykes at all hours of the day and night.   If you're not a fellow homo, you may not understand the magnitude of that previous statement.  Queers are in a species of their own.  We are not easy to please.  The staff at OA knows this, so they don't even try.  And I love them for it.  Case in point:  I ordered oatmeal and a bagel with cream cheese for breakfast.  They forgot the oatmeal.  When the waiter asked if there was anything else he could bring, I said, "Yes, the oatmeal I ordered."  He replied, "May I have my oatmeal please?" to which I responded, "May I have my oatmeal please?"  Then he brought me my oatmeal.  If that doesn't tell you how wonderful these guys are, then you're a complete tard.  My advice: eat there, don't expect to be treated like the princess that you think you are, and give them very generous tips.  They deal with queers all day.  For fuck's sake, show them some mercy and gratitude.
author: Bobby D.

description:
Orphan Andy's is my go-to place for 24/7 comfort food.  I know the waiters and they are always nice to me and I have never been in there and not seen the place filled with my friends. It's very homey for me.

Only 4 stars because seating is limited and you can end up waiting, but it's worth the wait.
author: Rebecca G.

description: I haven't eaten there in years, but their potato salad is almost comparable to mine! It was really very good! Their angus beef double blue cheese bacon cheeseburger was made to order, and was fantastic! I won't forget about them the next time I want good American food!
author: Veronika F.

description: This is a 24 hour diner in the Castro that serves up warm, standard diner fare. It's not going to knock your socks off but it is good, the menu has plenty to choose from, and the service is friendly, even when super busy. The pricing is moderate for San Francisco but the portions are decent. The booths sit 4 people comfortably.
author: Frank L.

description:
This is definitely a great place to come if you've been out drinking around the town; however, be prepared to wait in line if you get here around 1:30am and after. 

Food is mediocre; however, the staff seems to be pretty efficient and friendly when not so hectic. When I come here I usually order the chicken fried steak to soak up all the alcohol that I've been drinking all night. 

On this occasion with two other friends, our food came out pretty quick, our server was super bad ass, and the food was better than I've usually had. My friend who ordered the ham sandwich was extremely happy with all that cream cheese that they put in it. I took a bite out of it and boy that was what the doctor ordered for a night out of drinking. 

Aside from the food and the late night hours, it's a great place to people watch and absorb the late night San Francisco crowd. Many characters to be seen and interesting conversations to be overheard. :)
author: Norm D.

description: i don't recommend this place to any one. the service is shit! there is server  his name is chad, all the time he gives is attitude, and treat the customers like low class people. never says thanks ,welcome, please.. just trows the check at your face and walks aways..."william", please fire his ass and his little friends that are destroying your business. ...and the food is not that good either because no one cares.
author: B H.

description:
It had been a while since I'd been to Orphan Andy's. The first time I went this month (total fat kid) I was with 3 others. A british guy was our waiter and my group had fun trying to figure out where the heck he was from! I had a polish dog that was pretty darn yummy. Anyway, once we crossed the street the waiter tapped me on the shoulder and said, "You forgot your coat, love!" and I was very impressed! 

The second time I went I was with my boyfriend. We went for some breakfast. I had a hankering for French toast with bacon and hash browns BUT when I tried to substitute eggs for hash browns the same British waiter said no. Sooo I just got French Toast with a side of bacon and the boy got some omelette with home fries. Mr.Belvedere came out right away with my munchies but, unfortunately, my date's came out 5 mins later (I won't eat until everyone is served). I kinda wish Jeeves kept it under the heat lamp but being the fat kid I am I dove into my syrup orgy without complaint the moment my boyfriend's food arrived. Refills were pretty slow as well as waiting for the check. It was still deelish so I'm gonna write it off as Mr. Sheffield having a bad day.
author: Heather E.

description: Brownies for dessert was A-OK.  Extra star for being open late.
author: Jaye B.

description:
We were starving after a day of tourism around the City, and we settled on Orphan Andy's for some time off our feet and some food in our bellies. It was a pretty good choice: a haven of diner food in a sea of increasingly-foodie fare. I had the fried chicken, and my partner in crime had the Monte Cristo.

The food came quick, and it was pretty good. It wasn't gourmet, but that wasn't our agenda. Big portions, too.

The service was good -- not aloof, not clingy. A trek to the bathroom takes you through the kitchen and down a set of stairs to a restroom that is an example of the minimum ceiling height allowed by code in the City. Quirky, but functional and pretty clean.

We walked right in and sat down in the fairly-small place, but I can clearly see how this place gets hopping really quick with the post-bar crowd craving breakfast food to dilute the booze. Not a bad choice overall whether or not you're lit.
author: Aaron R.

description:
I woke up Sunday morning to a text from a friend which simply read, "Awesome."

After rifling through my phone's text history, I found what I had sent him at 1:36 AM the night before: "This is night that will go down as am epic fail." 

Not quite http://www.textsfromlastnight.com/, but I'm young. With a smidge of moxie and a splash of rum, I'll make it happen. 

So I gathered myself together, grabbed the roommate and the random friend crashing on the couch, and we sauntered over to Orphan Andy's for a revival/pick-me-up brunch. It really is one of those neighborhoody type places that locals swarm around and tourists avoid...it doesn't have the glitz of Lime nor does it boast the name of Harvey's, but what it does, it does well.

Chocolate malt? Awesome, huge, and exactly what I wanted. 
BLT minus the T plus the C (cheese) and plus the G (guacamole)? Delicious, and I have to give the server props for letting me deviate from the menu as far as I did. 
People watching? Some of the best in the city. Grab a table near the window and watch people scurry across 17th and Market, going about their Sunday errands. 
Supergay waitstaff? Fantastic. I love it when my waiter is wearing a kilt, nose ring, and a belt that says "NUDIST" in rhinestones. 

We'll definitely be back for brunch again, even if it's just so I can salvage more lame nights with fabulous mornings after.
author: Devon S.

description:
Ah, Orphan Andy's. A great spot to stand outside of when arriving just at the time when drunken hordes spill from adjacent bars, seeking liquor-sopping comfort foods. I love the completely disinterested wait staff, the one guy always in denim shorts and other guy, all ZZ Top beard and Utilikilt held aloft by a belt with the word NUDIST spelled out in nail head studs ... Lord knows I do not want him to stoop to collect a dropped napkin or silverware cuz one must suspect that the belt's text refers to what he does &./or does not have going on under the aforementioned fashion abomination known as the Utilikilt. 

But the food is pretty good. I encourage your exploration of the turkey melt to which you gotta add many shakes from the pepper holder and a couple squirts from the French's yellow mustard container. be sure to ask for well done fries cuz they're often enough mushy and damp with fry vat oil. which is gross, really. 

added pluses here: the perilous trip through the kitchen then down the greasy stairs to the bathroom wherein you gotta watch your noggin ... ceiling so low it's like the toilet in an airplane, really. and then there's the print of a naked dude riding on the back of leaping dolphin, looks to be an illustration by the same guy who did the spectacular image once associated with the defunct Lion's Pub, you know the one, the image of the supine 70s hottie getting plowed by a lion ... but back to the "man riding dolphin" print ... the guy is totally fucking the dolphin's blow hole. how gay is that?
author: Kevin M.

description:
Staff:   5 stars
Food:  1-2 stars, blech

I stopped in for a late lunch, desperate for nourishment.    The staff are awesome - I sat at the counter and they are friendly and attentive.

The food, not so much.    I had a meatball sandwich that was rather disgusting.    Especially for the price!
author: Oaklandish a.

description:
The best 24 hr diner in SF..hands down! Come here before you go to Sparkys! They actually service REAL food here and tastes homecooked like diner food should! The waiters can seem a little standoff-ish, but they are never rude or give bad service. I haven't had a bad experience here! My boyfriend took me here for my birthday super late at night....couldn't have been happier! 
It's very small inside so it can get crowded, but it's worth the wait. All the other 24 hour places seem to lack good cooks or people with patience.
author: Annie H.

description:
Minus five star rating.

  This is very hard to write. I will keep it simple by sharing with all vegans and vegetarians to avoid this place. Unless you want to have bacon "accidentally" slipped onto your plate INSIDE your veggie burger. Then harassed by the manager or who I think was the manager on your way out.

 After pointing out the bacon I took from my mouth with a napkin to realize there was more on the veggie patty the waiter replies: 
 "Oh, yeah that's bacon." continues to wipe the table next to mine as he later adds: "I'm sorry hon, we can take it off from your check." I get up and wash my mouth and hands in their filthy bathroom, gather my belongings and leave. 

  A short young woman intercepts me on the way out, blocking the exit: "Are you the one freaking out about the bacon on your veggie burger?" I lowered my eyes wondering why she blocks the exit and nod. Then she raises her voice and adds: "Well, you know you should not be hating on my people, It wasn't the waiter's fault, it was the cook's fault, you know.." At this point I went from being sad to very upset. #1 I never said anything to the waiter and who was this troll? why the tone?. Oh boy. I finally decide to tell her: "I don't care who you are and what you have to say, now if you'll excuse me." I notice she does not move so I try to slide sideways past her... and she pushes me, almost fell on a patron sitting at the booth. I simply left without taking any further action and was starved and kind of buzzed so I let it go.

  My next meal was 15 or so hours after and I am still very displeased with the whole situation. I hope I never run into this girl, ever. I will most certainly pepper spray her face. This behavior is very unlike me, yet still...

 I hope nobody ever experiences anything like this.
You've been warned, though.
author: Valentina C.

description: So, it's five in the morning and I was up telling my friend about Orphan Andy's and it's been almost 3 months since I've been there.  I loved it, I went with my five other friends and our table was FULL of food.  There was barely any room for drinks and we were in food comas when we left.  I loved the service, we goofed around with the staff and just had a bawl.  On top of that someone paid for $20 of our meal!  Thank you so much anonymous donor!  We really were running low on money!  But that was such a great experience, I hope to go back there again next time I'm in town!
author: Alanna F.

description: nice late night spot, quick, cheap and tasty. Exactly what you want from a diner like this, rthey lose a star for not offering waffles, what's up with that. Everything else I had was as wanted.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
The breakfast food is just what you'd expect from a diner. it's affordable, greasy, and served with a big gay smile. The breakfast plates are served with 2 huge pancakes or toast and potatoes.

I've only had breakfast, but I'd expect everything there to be nice and greasy and comforting.
author: Rex D.

description: I love this place. I always will. The staff handle biz & treats there guests with kindness & give great service.
author: arzo n.

description: Adorable diner in the Castro! Teeny tiny with really friendly staff and tasty food. Open 24 hours...so what's not to like? Nothing. :)
author: Ashley P.

description: I had a really good combination omelette here last night! Nice, friendly staff. Met some crazy characters too!
author: Brenda I.

description:
Starting a graveyard shift, I'm now hypersensitive to businesses open when I am awake, especially those offering things upside down like breakfast at dinnertime.  

Orphan Andy's is famous for food that can soak up booze; conversation flows over the plates.  Big colorful butterflies adorn the ceiling, like the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence watching over us.

As it turns out, the all-night vibrancy is perfect at the beginning of my "day", the low level heavy metal underlining my survivalist worldview.  The breakfast bagel is absolutely delicious, even sober; the coffee is watered down just like I like, especially when I'm going to be drinking coffee nonstop for hours.

Best of all, they provide a boost of gay to carry me though a hard shift.
author: Phoebe G.

description: Small little burger joint, not as packed as the Baghdad Cafe. The food is decent just the prices are a bit higher.
author: M C.

description: great little place for a small snacks last night, pick up a tuna sandwich and andy's chilli, its spicy and not running. i like it!
author: JessePanda C.

description:
Ugh..this place is a disaster, through and through...

- 1 star... For the  shitty attitude we encountered from the waiter after waiting in line FOREVER!

-1 star... For the attitude we recieved when they had to split up our party of 8.

- 1 star...For the sticky stuff oh my chair.

-1 star...For service so bad, we decided to up and leave.

- 1 star...For the waiter and one of his goons trying to rough us up as we left. Ripped my friend's Emporio Armani shirt. 

Yeah...I think that pretty much says it all....
author: Matteo G.

description: For a small diner this place is bursting with personality and frankly, damn good food.  I go here regularly for breakfast and am never disappointed.  The pancakes are among the best I've ever had.  But beware, they are on the heavy side and you will definitely need to walk it off.  And the staff is friendly and attentive.  Yes, I know what you're thinking.  Why would you give a small diner 4-stars?  Well, because it's fabulous!
author: Kurt L.

description: The servers are great! They give great service no matter what hour! BEWARE of the Latin barback after midnight, though, he steals wallets and cell phones, and he's such a lowlife that he charges 6 am  breakfast at McDonalds  on his way home to his refrigerator box in some crack addict park. Really, he'll steal anything you leave on the counter for 2 seconds!
author: Daniel W.

description:
My family and I accidentally stumbled in here last weekend.  We took seats at the counter and had a great time watching and listening to the wait staff interact with our kids and other customers.  My 4 year old was very interested in our waiters nose ring and also pointed out his tshirt with naked men on it (oops).  Everyone is called "cupcake."  

We all LOVED our food!  I shared the banana & peanut butter chip pancakes with my 18 month old.  They were huge and delish!  4 year old ate all the bacon we were supposed to share - so I would guess it was pretty tasty.  My hubby got a mean omlete with everything but the kitchen sink thrown in.  And a side of onion rings and flapjacks.  He made me proud with how much he devoured.

I would have given 5 stars - but did we really need all the naked men pictures?
author: Jennifer T.

description: Food was pretty horrible. Gluey pancakes, super salty bacon and fatty fatty sausage. But is the only thing that's open late night.
author: Mike P.

description:
This place is Awesome. The Chicken fried steak was the best i ever had. I had it with eggs and potatoes. It was so good I ordered a Chicken Fried Steak Sandwich to go. 
The waiter/cashier guys was awesome too.
author: Muncheez I.

description: Great 24 hour spot in Castro. Old time diner. You have to have 2 or more in your party to sit in the booths and singles have to sit at the bar. We went here twice during our trip for breakfast and we felt that the food was great and that it was a great price. Their biscuits and gravy and pancakes are top notch!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Bottom line is, we waited outside for a bit, found out that there's a notepad to sign-in for, (only saw a "please wait to be seated" sign), the manager/waiter there asked the person behind us if they've signed in yet first, we asked about how long the wait would be and the guy gave us this "well I don't know do you want to be on the list or not!" Well sir, the answer is no.

Despite not be being able to try the actual food, this experience did not leave a good taste in my mouth.

However, the food did look good from the outside.
author: Gabriel C.

description: Poor service every time, tonight just looking for some low key coffee shop, and we were asked to move, the server was not impressed we did not order more, but even when I come with a large group and order lots of food its bad service, unwelcoming, and unfriendly servers. There are lots and lots of places in the city to get a fried egg or pancakes sans the attitudes.
author: Satoshi K.

description:
Orphan Andy's was named by Playboy in it's 'Nightlife A-List' as one of the nation's 10 best late-night diners.

For more:

http://www.playboy.com/articles/best-late-night-diners/index.html
author: Matt M.

description: I can't even rate the food because I wasn't even given the opportunity to have any. My friend and I came here for lunch and sat down at the bar stool area. We sat there for at least 15-20 minutes and NO ONE asked us for our order. They didn't even acknowledge our presence. We didn't even get glasses of water. The staff either completely ignored us or just stared at us. Eventually we just got up and walked out when it became abundantly clear they weren't going to help us. They even asked the people sitting next to us if they needed anything and continued to ignore us! The 2 guys working here were the rudest staff I've ever seen at a restaurant.
author: Monica C.

description: A Castro treasure! I loved the atmosphere, and the staff was super friendly. It was my first time there, and I felt right at home. The food is yummy too! I ordered the french toast with apples and cream cheese. It's right by muni, so it's super easy to get to as well.
author: Deborah R.

description: I'm THRILLED we discovered this place!  This has the best french toast I've ever had in my life.  The guys who work here are awesome and know how to make a mean chocolate malt.  Can't wait to go back 5 stars all the way!!!  Love you guys!!
author: Ilia F.

description: Went there for brunch and ordered scrambled eggs (yummy and fluffy) and hotcakes (very good).  My friend ordered a veggie omelet that he scarfed down and home fries (I prefer hash browns but these were good home fries).  We left stuffed and no needig food until dinner.  Waiter was warm and friendly and engaging.  We also had coffee and the mugs were refilled free of charge.  Bill came to $23 (plus tip).
author: SF G.

description:
4.5 Stars!

I heart the Castro!

This is a MUST if I'm in the city even for a day. The first time I ever came here, the server (there was only 1..) told me to 'live a little' and try something new. So I closed my eyes and pointed to a random menu item.. the Cream Cheese Burger. Sounds simple enough, right? Right.. but it was SOOOOoooo oo oo o good! It's really just what it sounds like it would be, too. Maybe it's the meat or the bun.. or both, but with the toppings and softish cream cheese piled on top it's by far one of the best burgers I've had the pleasure of sinking these pearly whites into.. ever.

A word, though, about the bathroom. Get ready! I laughed so hard the first time I saw it.. I nearly pee'd myself (and that would have been a real shame heh). To say it's small would be a vast understatement. Think.. church confessional, then think smaller than that and you're close. You almost have to back up into it and close the door, which will be touching your knees if you're anything over 4'11. And you have to go through their kitchen and down some stairs to get to it too. I'm not complaining, I'm just mentioning it because I think all of the above is part of Orphan Andy's unrelenting charm :-)
author: Jessica H.

description: Good food, endless drinks, great atmosphere, interesting decor, love the kites on the ceiling.
author: Michael L.

description: I am a local who eats at Orphan Andy's on occasion,but after watching my waiter  on his I phone while we were ready to order, then drink his milkshake and make a date with a customer at the counter,while our food  was in the pass- thru with the cook ringing the bell, was just too much for me too stand.I will never eat there again,beyond unprofessional, he really couldn't give a crap,except to get a date.
author: Sam Y.

description:
It's late. You're drunk. You're mind is telling you you're starving even though you've been eating mini pizzas and nibbling on cheese all night, but you rationalize that as a growing girl you still need to eat at 1:30am, but the question is, where do you go?

Well, if you were my tipsy crew last night, you'd come here, but on any other "sober" night, hmmm, not sure I'd rush back to return. I also definitely would not order the Philly Cheesesteak even though our kooky server said it was really good and one of the best things on the menu. Lies, Lies, Lies get out :) This thing reminded me more of a dried out shoe sole than a piece of meat, but if you are into that, then more power to ya ;) Also the green peppers weren't even cooked? What kind of a Philly steak is that?

Judging by what my friends were eating, nothing looked move the Earth worthy either, but for a late night drunky Magoo meal, this will work just fine and seeing as how it is close to my house and only took about 10-15 minutes to get into during a busy time, hey, gotta give em points for that.
author: Stephy S.

description: Great place for breakfast! It get super packed no matter what time it is..... the staff is really nice, food is good, portions are big, great for a late night!
author: Irma R.

description:
"That's MY dollar, bitch," is what I should have told the waiter Saturday evening when my friends and I attempted to close out our evening here...

As we waited for a table, I gave my friends a dollar to pick out some songs on the jukebox . Shortly after they made selections, a very rude and bitchy waiter by the name of Andrew started to yell at us and other customers to wait outside (even though there was plenty of standing room inside). He repeatedly, and aggressively, insisted that we had to wait outside even after we told him we had just picked out some songs on the jukebox, to which he said, "too bad...and that was my money in there anyway, i put some in earlier."

UH..I don't THINK SO. 

Is that really the best way to treat your customers? We were so turned off by the guy that we decided to leave (and never come back).

I can understand everyone has a bad day now and then, but man, someone needs to change their @ss tampon, or at least not work late-night shifts where common courtesy and politeness are required.
author: Thuy-Tu T.

description:
There's a reason why Andy's parents put him up for adoption.

The prices are ridiculous for the type of food being served here. A friend and I managed to spend $15 on a milkshake, slice of pie, and glass of milk. To make matters worse, the glass of milk was completely rotten -- and it was 35 minutes before our waitress came back to check on us. Someone ought to call the health department.
author: Wayne F.

description:
Recently, after waking up in another someone else's bed one morning, I was surprised, looking out this someone else's bedroom window and after finally sniffing through the thick fog of poppers clouding my nostrils, that I had somehow made it to the Castro. Rolling into my clothes and running out of that scene, I made it to Market and Castro and into Orphan Andy's. It was the middle morning so any sort of a rush was over. Being a thin, whippish little thing--and preferring to stay that way-- I kept away from the very tempting breakfast meals listed in the restaurant's menu and chose instead the rather simple breakfast sandwich. It came simply enough; unadorned and plated quaintly. Four slices of bacon, fried eggs, cheese on sourdough toast: perfection. I looked torn and frayed from the previous night and received a decent welcome from the lovely gentlemen behind the counter. I felt like I belonged, if only for my one lowly sandwich.

I could rant and rave about the burgers I've had here, or the to-die-for mashed potatoes, but I much prefer to talk about the place that's there even on the mornings when last night's regrets are still floating like a cloud above me. Orphan Andy's is the place for that twenty-fourth hour's substantial meal after coming down from those heady twenty-three hours of revelry.
author: Mick S.

description:
It was my first time here last night -- we walked out before we were even served our coffee.
We were seated in the back (near the cooks), which led me to realize that the waiter here must have some sort of power complex.

Instead of having a good time, I got to hear you being a complete dick to your fellow human beings/employees. And I am sure that you do not even give a fuck.

"One of you follow me with that plate NOW. C'mon, don't be lazy."
And when no one followed you (because who wants to follow someone around who treats them like a piece of dirt?).. You came back and started saying "Andele, andele, andele."

It just felt pretty degrading, and pissed me off. I will never eat at someplace that treats their employees this way.
author: Alycia K.

description:
The service in this place blows. 

I was new to the town and i went for some quick dessert here with my best friend. So the waiter was a complete racist asshole. Sadly enough the most delude people are those who don't know it and just think they are being funny.

We get dessert and he tries to make a fat joke at my friends expense. We took it lightly and i laughed along for maybe the first time and the other three i just ignored. 

 I sketch a lot in restaurants. He sees this and takes my book and pencil out of my hand and proceed to draw some cheap pointy hat chinky thing with slits for eyes- on my book. and says thats what my friend looks like.

(we are both asian) Again he thinks he's being funny. He's either just stupid or insensitive because we bother weren't even laughing.

I would normally just leave, pay and no tip. but then when we got the bill back he fucked up our order and tried to over charge us $20 for an orange juice and some cake. 

Normally if the waiter wasn't such a douche i would totally understand mistakes. but wtf? 

so we paid and left- so many better 24-hr places out there. I guess its a 24hr place so they probably get stuck with dipstick people sometimes- but still that was a bit much even for a bad place.

I was really surprised because everywhere else ive been too before has been good.
author: oth k.

description: It's 2 a.m., The Cafe just closed, you're drunk and sweaty but it's a cold night and you and your gal are not ready to go home, so you queue up for the 24 hour diner. You call it bonhomie but she gets grumpy because you're paying attention to strangers. Twenty minutes later you're inside drinking a hot cup of mud and the boy to your left asks you whether he has any obligation to entertain the deaf man sitting to *his* left. You say, "He's in love with you!" and then ignore both of them. Your girl is pleased with you again and your knees touch and I don't remember what happened but I think there was a cab and then an apartment and then a bed.
author: Mandy H.

description: It's a diner.  It's open 24 hr, which apparently is a rarity in SF.  The food is OK, can say that I've had both better and worse in any number of NYC area diners.
author: Andrew S.

description: Orphan Andy's is where my friends and I go if we're in the city at night and hungry. They have chocolate chip banana pancakes, as well as any other typical breakfast selection (all very delicious). Home fries are amazing, service is really sweet. It's also just a cute and cozy spot to go and have a cup of coffee. It's usually busy between 2 and 4 a.m. (bar crowds, I assume), but between 4 and 5, if you're still up, this is the place to be. Keep in mind it IS small, so if there is a wait for a table, you may have to wait a while before someone leaves. They do have a counter to sit at if you're just grabbing a bite by yourself.
author: Alexa S.

description: Some of my cousins and I decided to go to San Francisco today. We walked the bridge about 5 am so after awhile we worked up an appetite. My cousin wanted to hit up a Denny's but I wasn't feeling that. I said dude we are in frisco lets hit up a "real" diner. So we went on yelp read a few reviews and decided to come to orphan Andy's. First thing I noticed was that the prices were pretty steep. Apparently if you go alone you can't sit on a booth you will have to sit on the diner. I've read how a lot of people here wrote about the waiters being rude. I never got that vibe. I've must have been hot : d they were actually quite friendly with me. One of my cousins got the 2x2x2 and my other cousin got a bagel with an egg. I just got a stack of pancakes. Food was not that great. It was all bland and lukewarm. Sad to say but Denny's cooks a better omelette. They did keep refilling my coffee so a few stars for that.
author: Enrique C.

description:
Top 5 Reasons to hit up Orphan Andy's...

#1 - It is open 24 hours. 

#2 - Their breakfast portions are GINORMOUS. Pancakes as big as your head. I had the banana and chocolate chip pancakes, which were OK. A little too heavy on the banana, with waaaaay too much butter, and the watery syrup is a bit of a turnoff. I started feeling nauseous halfway through eating them, but maybe that's because I had been up for 20 hours. 

#3 - Fun mini-jukeboxes at each booth. The larger jukebox has more selection...Ms. Graceypoo was able to get her morning fix of Prince. 

#4 - The people who work here are SUPER nice!

#5 - I'm sure there is another reason, but I am blanking and wanted to make this a Top 5 list, which sounds so much better than Top 4.
author: Steph P.

description: This place is great for late night munchies in the Castro, but if it's too busy, everything changes.  The food is okay, but that's not really what makes this place desirable at 1am.  It's a great place for people watching.  I had a Patty Melt and Fries, and I think the fries should have been cooked longer.  The patty melt was okay, not the best I've had, but okay.
