The service is good, but when it get's busy and the drunks come in, everything gets different.  I commend the staff for their patience and tolerance as the line goes out the door at 1:30am!
author: Carlos P.

description:
MR. SHORT-TERM-MEMORY WORKS HERE ON LATE FRIDAY NIGHTS. STAY THE FUCK AWAY. THE GUY WITH THE GLASSES IS COOL THOUGH.

so, a few friends and i decide to meet at orphan andy's last night (about 3AM on January 26, 2008), having a lot of great times there before involving either the malts or burgers or both depending on how much we felt like expanding our waistlines. 

we had to wait outside, which wasn't a problem, and we had to wait a little while longer because there were 8 of us, which was understandable. after a while, however, things went south.

Mr. Short-Term-Memory forgets to put our party's name on the list, so people keep walking in and getting seats ahead of us even though it's painfully obvious that we don't like standing outside and getting drizzled on. so after a while, we did get our seats.

we split the group into two tables and get to it- the we put in our orders and think that's the end of it. but of course, since the punk didn't even write it down, Mr. Short-Term-Memory completely forgets my order [a vanilla malt and a cup of coffee, of all things] and for some reason thinks we also ordered cheese fries. so i feel the need to remind him.

this is where it got interesting, in a bad way.

i calmly ask if my coffee and malt are coming, and Mr. Short-Term-Memory glares at me like i'm making a late addition to my order, then says that it's coming right up. so after a few minutes he puts a HALF cup of coffee in front of me. i calmly ask if he can fill it up, and he gives me the lame excuse that some people like room for sugar and cream [i mean, hello???]. and, of course, he says it's coming right up.

so i get back to the table to continue the conversation. a few minutes later, he slams down the malt in front of me, still fully in its metal cup and without a straw. in a very rude and sarcastic manner, he goes "here's your malt, and here's how we fill a coffee cup!", proceeding to pour so much coffee into my cup that it overflows and nearly drips off the table.

at that point i got the idea, so i said my goodbyes and took my leave, leaving the coffee and malt where they stood because, frankly, it was bullshit. the entire situation. it was clear that Mr. Short-Term-Memory was making no effort to appease anyone. 

i made no unreasonable requests [just reminding him of my order, which he should've wrote down in the first place, and how a half cup of coffee isn't exactly acceptable]. i was perfectly calm and sober. 

i went last that night to partake in what i would still call the best malt in san francisco. but, apparently, satisfactory service [in terms of having your order taken down correctly and your coffee cup full] no longer applies at Orphan Andy's. 

what a shame. someone fire that motherfucker and maybe i'll go back.
author: Charles C.

description:
Chili Cheese Fries and lots and lots and lots of sausage. 

Good times.
author: Jay H.

description: Just had brunch here - what a wonderful little place!  I loved it for its great prices and fantastic service.  I was a little surprised by the omelette style (the eggs just sorta sat on top of the filling, not pocketed), but I'll admit, I liked it quite a bit!  Great little breakfast spot.
author: Mark M.

description:
This place is a little too small. I went here with 2 other doormen and 1 doorwoman ( I work club security)
The waiters all must've been through hell and back on the early am morning we came in (about 445am). They all snarled at us, but us friends all workin the doors of clubs, we just "killed them with kindness" and in the end the service and food was fantastic.

I'll remember to come here again after the early 2am drunktards are already home passed out.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
Very. Dry. Burgers.

Walk a block to Harvey's. There's more window space and the burgers are a lot better.
author: Karsten P.

description:
I was always wondering where the hell is 24hr diner in San Francisco? There is Sparky with god-why-your-food-so-bland, but let's talk about that later. I think my question is supposed to be where the hell is a decent 24hr diner in San Francisco?

I have to admit, the decor was cute but not cute enough to cover the fact the food was just blah. The customer service was even worse. These two cute waiters were just too busy chatting up with regular customers hence they were so frickin slow!

Ugh, definitely not coming back! Unless, if I'm drunk. Or desperate. Drunk and desperate.
author: Perry S.

description:
This is my default 'drunk and hungry' restaurant.

I must have been here over 20 times, but the only thing I can recall ordering on a consistent basis is hot sauerkraut and potato salad. Now, it has come to my attention that the sauerkraut isn't supposed to be served hot- rather the first time I had it, it was hot because it had been sitting under the heating lamps in the kitchen for some time. But its damn good, for no apparent reason.

Typically, I hate breakfast foods (especially when it's not breakfast)- but its GOOD here! It's like an old fashioned diner. I've replaced Mel's With Orphan Andy's, and for good reason. The food is superb, its open 24/7 (so you can always count on a table), the staff is amazingly sweet and attentive, and what can I say- I love the gays.

If you ever go here, order hot sauerkraut, potato salad, and the club sandwich. You won't regret a thing.
author: Lauren A.

description: Big gay delicious helpings of delicious gay big food in a  deliciously gay small environment and many big gay delicious smiles from gay delicious big wait staff! Wonderful food, great coffee, superb ambiance. You can't go wrong.
author: Phil R.

description: My hubby & I go to San Fran every December - just a nice getaway.  We just noticed this place for the first time and decided to have breakfast.  We should have gone elsewhere.  It looks like a cute little diner, which usually serves up some great breakfast, but dang, this one was not one of those.  The food was expensive and rather bland.  The service was ok - nothing to write home about.  If you want breakfast, you might want to look at other places.
author: Kevin V.

description:
Stuffed French Toast = cream cheese with preserved sliced apples

Puke. Puke. Puke. Never again will I ever make such an unpalatable mistake.

But the service was great. Food, not so great.
author: Cathy H.

description:
After the opening night of the SF Silent Film Festival at the Castro Theater, my husband and are were starving and looking for some hearty fare.  We came across Orphan Andy's and were lured in by the huge plates of food carried over to the customers.  Despite being pretty full and busy, we were quickly seated at the bar of the diner and served ice water.  

We did have to wait for some time for the food to arrive, but one of the staff told us that there was a shift change, and apologized for the wait.  No worries!  The location of the diner is great for people-watching, especially around midnight on Market St.  Ah!  French fries and drag queens are a great combination!

The food was great!  Tasty hearty diner fare you want after downing too many gin and tonics.  I ordered a chicken fried steak sandwich with a side of country sausage gravy (otherwise the sandwich might be too dry for some).  The CFS sandwich was so good!  SO GOOD, in fact, that the customer who sat next to me was inspired to order the same exact thing.  My husband had an Ortega Burger which was crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside along with some perfectly done onion rings.  Good coffee and nice spicy Chai (came from a mix packet, but still good).  

The staff was nice, especially the person working at the counter who appeared to be the manager/owner (?).  Will return and recommend!
author: Beth K.

description:
Good old fashion American dining with a twist of gay. 

Its a nice change from It's Tops because the service is quick and they don't ignore you after you get your food. Its 24 hours so you can enjoy the classics such as Tuna on rye with split pea soup or a rad Meatloaf dinner with awesome mashed potatoes whenever you want without venturing into those God forsaken Denny's chains.
author: Jordan A.

description: This place is seriously BURSTING with Castro personality. It is such a fun place to eat. The wait is always very short is there is one and the service is spectacular. The food is pretty good for average diner food. I loveee their feta cheese omelet and the stuffed french toast is the BEST.
author: Samantha W.

description:
I'll be honest: this review is about one thing.

 About 2 or three times a year (one being my birthday) I get a hankering for something specific. I go to Orphan Andy's in the Castro, pick out some tunes on the juke box, settle in to the old fashioned diner setting and place an order for THE BEST CHICKEN-FRIED STEAK AND EGGS IN TOWN.

 Come to think of it, there is something a little queer about this place ...
author: Nathan P.

description:
***Update 10/17 - I called to place an order for pickup. (I HATE that this is the only place right in the castro that's open late night). They put me on hold for 5 MINUTES before I finally hung up. I was closing at my job across street so I hadnt realized how long it was until I looked at my phone. I called because after a long night of dealing with drunken assholes, I wanted to pick my order up, and go home and sleep. I called back every 2 minutes for the next 15 minutes (while I continued closing), and the line was busy!!! MEANING, they had left me on hold and forgot about me. 

So, my coworker and I finish out duties and walk across the street to the restaurant. Now here's what made me even more pissed. THEY WERENT BUSY. 4 of the booths were open and no one was sitting at the counter. We saw some people we knew and sat with them to eat. But really? I just wanted my food to go.

AND the waiter was again not very friendly (big surprise), and had an attitude about nearly every request we had. Im changing my rating to 1 star.

original review: Be forewarned, this is NOT a female friendly establishment. Especially during the day when the big heavyset, flamboyant bear man is working. Night can be a different story depending on who's working and what night of the week it is. The food, well it's diner food, so what can you expect? But the service sucks. On the plus side, they are open 24 hours and in walking distance of all the major castro bars. I work in the castro and my coworkers and I often place phone orders. Which would be nice and conveniant IF they ever got our orders right. Basically, it's reached the point that I only eat here when I'm drunk.
author: Risa R.

description:
Got a few hours? Good, because you'll need it if you're going to eat at Orphan Andy's. 

My boyfriend and I dropped in on a Saturday afternoon (some time around two) and ten minutes must have passed before our orders were taken and twenty minutes before our food arrived (we kept going, "Oh, oh, I think it's us! No... Oh, is that it? No...") I think at some point during the twenty minutes, my stomach had begun to digest itself...

Then, to add insult to injury, the food wasn't even that good. Maybe I chose the wrong dish, I'll give Orphan Andy's the benefit of the doubt, since it's such an old establishment (there has to be a good explanation for their longevity).  

What went wrong? I got the mushroom burger with cheese and when my burger arrived and I tried to grab it, the bottom bun just fell apart, because all the water from the mushrooms had made it a complete soggy mess. Okay, that's okay, I can deal with a soggy bun, but the patty was really bland, like the meat was never seasoned or something. I don't want to be over dramatic, but that was probably one of the worst burgers I have ever eaten and I'm sad, because it was a waste of calories and I hate wasting calories!
author: Jennifer L.

description: We can in and found a booth right up front. Our waiter was very nice. We had chocolate and banana pancakes and biscuits and gravy. Biscuits were nice and soft and plenty of gravy. Pancakes were tasty and steamy hot.  Would definety come back again.
author: Latisha C.

description: A fun place for a late-night meal in the Castro. You feel like you're eating your greasy hamburger amongst the spirits of famous gay people. Not as expensive as it could be, especially if you order a la carte. They seem to have a nice pace, even though it gets packed.
author: Andrew K.

description: Went there with friends on Sunday evening after the Gay pride parade. The place was packed.. I was pretty wasted, and yet... I remember not only the handsome waiter (Chad), but also my awesome turkey burger with delicious home fries. I just loved the food, the ambiance, and that handsome Chad passing by before my eyes... Don't worry, sexy, I will be back!!!!
author: Laurent M.

description:
This place automatically gets three stars because it's open twenty-four hours.  For as important and cosmopolitan a city as San Francisco is, it suffers from a serious lack of twenty-four-hour establishments.

This is a diner with limited seating.  The food is, well, diner food.  It's not bad, but it's not terribly good either.
author: John S.

description:
Classic neighborhood diner.  At the perfect location (corner of Market and Castro).  If you are with two or three people, get a window table...  the best place for people-watching in the Castro that is not a bar.

I am surprised at the low ratings...  what are they expecting?  Le Cirque?!?  There are too many twinks in the Castro nowadays.   I gave it a 5 Star rating just to counter-act the stupid reviews.

Orphan Andy's is perfect for two or three people (not a party of eight)...  for folks looking for diner fare (not vegan or diet food)...  basic, quick service.  You will get filled up (perfect after the bars, but that is when it is BUSY).  Best time to go is in the afternoon, when you can sit and watch the passers-by and not feel rushed.
author: Ross H.

description:
So my partners in eating and I cruise into the diner only to find there's only counter seating...I'm okay with that. We sit down, start checking out the menu....I feel like I'm being stared at so I look around....THERE'S THE UGLIEST LITTLE DOG WITH BUGGY EYES at the counter with some guy who's eating breakfast.

Do I want to eat at the counter with some dog I don't know (don't say it)? AND do I want to be stared at throughout breakfast?
NO....guess what...we left!

FIrst of all, don't hate, I don't mind dogs IN THEIR PLACE.

It's against every health law ever created to have dogs in a restaurant, save for assistance dogs.  I mean, having a freaking dog sitting at the counter of a diner, over the dish sink and drying dishes, how stupid are the owners anyway, to even allow that?  

 EVER HEARD OF THE HEALTH INSPECTOR?  Keep up this "oh, we're so cool, we even let dogs in" attitude and they'll know the Health INspector WAY too well.

Needless to say, we didn't try the food and I may be talked into someday, but I want to be sure they "curb" their dog policy!!!
author: Annie S.

description:
This orphan treated me ok. Apparently this place gets very mixed reviews, but I didn't Yelp ahead of time; just was wandering and figured there must be something open in the Castro after I picked up an energy drink at Walgreens at something like 3:30 AM. 

What did i have? A turkey Rueben with fries. Nope, I'm not a veggie, so that helps. Right off the bat I was really glad they weren't upset about my energy drink. He just asked if I would like something else to go with it or not and I said I was fine and that was that. He didn't seem annoyed when I stupidly didn't notice where he gestured regarding the menus, either. Quite chill. Food came up pretty quick, but I guess it was a relatively dead Tuesday early early morning, so there's not too much excuse for slowness. 

As for the sandwich itself -- delicious! Not a paragon of health by any means, but then a Rueben never is. Of course, you pay 24 hour prices -- in this case, something like $10.40? But you know, at 4 AM they probably deserve it. 

I would give this place another shot if I found myself hungry in the Castro at crazy hours again.
author: Emily B.

description:
Quintessential Castro diner...

Love the decor and staff...

Food hit the spot as well...
author: Nathan W.

description:
Nice little neighbor diner. 
Food is good.
Burgers are fried.
Food service is not fast, but not unacceptably slow either.
A few customers can be scary.
Restaurant a bid dusty. Could use a good cleaning.
Staff is friendly, but not very tolerant. Given some of their customers, it understandable.
author: scott h.

description: WOW!!!! this place is amazing!!! friendly staff and great food what else could you ask for??? I had a classic eggs bacon sausage and hash browns breakfast. Bacon was very good and not those skinny limpy strips of bacon from other restaurants. Same as sausage nice full portions of sausage, but what stole the show was the bannana pancakes!!!!!! WOW!!!! MUST try, they are very very good i will def be coming back to get some more of those. Very fluffy and rich with flavor, my mouth is watering as i type. Overall 5 STARS!!!! great food great service and one very happy returning customer!
author: Andy L.

description:
Breakfast 24hrs while in SF. 

This place is great if you like waiting. The line stretches down the block so pack a meal before you come.

The service was fast and friendly.

The restroom is underground is use the bathroom before you go. One stale and its unisex.

The restaurant is rather small so if you go - try going with a smaller party and just like most place in the bay...no parking.
author: Andrius A.

description:
So ... Last night my date, her friend, and myself had wandered about the Castro, just drinking and dancing and chatting and all that good stuff.  Bars started closing around the predictable time and we were on the sidewalk.  A good buzz was floating around in my noggin and I flagged down a Peachy Puff Girl for a quick pack of smokes (totally not realizing that I could have saved $3 by just purchasing at Walgreen's (24 hours).  Oh well.  It was at that point that somebody said, "Anybody as hungry as I am?"

At 2:15 in the morning, all somebody really has to say when you're standing on the sidewalk amidst all the last minute-hooking up and squawking and hurling and bouncing is one of three things to get you really, really hungry:  "Food?", "Hungry?", or "3-Egg Omelet?"

I realize that all I've had to eat today was a banana, two slices of left-over pizza, and a lot of slices of cheddar.  My golly, I was freaking FAMISHED.  My date said, "Orphan Andy's -- it's right around the corner."  I solemnly agreed that a greasy spoon was in order (seeing as my fridge at home has (you guessed it) a bunch of bananas, some left-over pizza, and a block of aged cheddar.  (I have food-food, too, but damned if I was actually gonna MAKE something.

Word of warning for those who go to Orphan Andy's on a weekend night at 2:20 in the morning:  You're going to wait for a while.  There's what -- only about 5 booths, 2 tables, and a counter-top?  Yep, my friends, you're gonna have to wait.  And the longer you wait, the hungrier you get watching those people inside through the windows stuffing their little faces off.  People were sitting on the sidewalk.  Some crude jokes about genitalia were thrown into the ether.  We waited.  I needed to go to the bathroom.

Word of warning to anybody who goes downstairs to the only bathroom whilst generally intoxicated and hungry and is impatient to use it:  Watch your head.  That door frame is so low (and hard), that if you just walk on in (and you're about 5' 10" or taller) you're going to hit your head on the fucking thing.  And it HURTS.  Ow!  Some girl said, "Didn't you see the sign that says, 'Watch Your Head?'"  I said, "Yes, and funnily enough, I've been staring at it for five minutes while those 3 hipster girls were in there snorting coke."

So the three of us finally get seated.  It's about 2:50 at this time.  Our waiter joins us and we tell him that we are totally ready to order, you you just take it now?  So he does, but he doesn't write it down and then when he repeats what you ordered, he always leaves something out.  We go through it about four times until he gets it right, and then we wait some more with very mediocre coffee and water that tastes a little silty.  But it's almost 3:00!  I'm not going to complain.

When the food comes (I ordered a bacon, mushroom, cheddar and sour cream omelet with home-fried potatoes and a side of sausage links), I just can't hold back anymore ... and I eat it all.  Every fucking bite went down like a gilded prize.  And tasted good!  And was just perfect at that particular time in that particular place.  I was foodified.

Then we parted ways, and I took the Luxor chariot back to my 'hood, and then I lay down in bed.  That's when that little brat Orphan Andy kicked me in the stomach.

My God, man.  My tummy was making sounds that brought to mind Marilyn Manson's most gloomy groans.  I felt itchy and hot and cold.  I tossed and turned like a leaf in a hurricane.  My cat got grouchy 'cos I wouldn't hold still for him to lean up against.  Oh my, I felt like SHIT, and it was all my fault for eating it so fast, I know -- but I knew, deep down in the cockles of my heart that Andy was culpable as well.  Why is the food so greasy?  My tummy seemed to be full of the stuff, and my guts were pressing up against my insides, feeling, as they were full of red hot lumps of lead.

Groan, groan, groan.  I made it through the night.  Oh, Orphan Andy ... you tried to off me from this Mortal Coil and YOU FAILED.  I'm still kicking!  And next time I am there in your general vicinity, and somebody says, "Anybody hungry?"  I will remember you and I will think twice.  Peace out.  See you in another couple of years.
author: Thomas B.

description: Top marks for service and location, but these two stars are all about the food. Its a diner, I get it, and if I was looking for a late night snack after bar hopping this would most likely hit the spot, but unfortunately I wasn't and left disappointed. I had the pastrami rueben, gf had the steak and eggs, and I also tried the chicken apple sausage and pancakes. I will admit, the chicken apple sausage was good, but the steak was meh and the pastrami the same. I would give this place 1 star, but the potential for me coming back wasted and the excellent and the fact that the Creme Brule truck is across the street yields Orphan Andy's 2 stars. Creme Brule or booze are about the only things which will redeem your meal here. Enough said.
author: Phil C.

description: We ate here one early cold fall morning after seeing that it was open 24 hours on yelp.  The portions were pretty good and the food was your typical diner fare.  I ordered the chicken fried steak but it tasted more like a sausage patty that was deep fried in batter, which was tasty and weird at the same time (probably because I couldn't quite figure out what kind of meat I was actually eating).  My boyfriend ordered the steak and eggs which was huge but still edible by my hungry man in one sitting.  Overall the ambience was laid-back, the service was friendly, and it seemed like it was a food joint catering to locals...  A good diner experience, not amazing, but good...  Sometimes at 4 am you can't be too picky...
author: Jeannette P.

description:
I love this place.
Not so much for the food, but for the fabulous servers!
They're attentive and funny and sassy as hell.  

A great place to take your friends from out of town, and an AWESOME place to visit during Pride/Halloween/NYEish.
author: Meh M.

description: Great old-school diner. Sit on the left side of the diner for breakfast. Michael is a sweetheart! The BIG 2 is my go to. 11 bucks including your drink. But sometimes I have to order the fried chicken or the chicken fried steak. Best stuff on the menu. They've got a great Diet Plate straight out of the Mary Tyler Moore Show. Oh Rhoda, you gotta try this place.
author: Dennis C.

description: Cole is awesome! He makes us the best shakes and is very funny. He remembers who we are remembers little details of our previous orders. There are only a few all night places in S.F. but we drive out of our way to go to Andy's because we hope Cole will be working. :)
author: Matt C.

description:
It's better than Sparky's. That's the best I can say for the food, which isn't much.

The decor is cute in the absurd kitschy kind of way, but don't look at things too closely if you're there during daytime hours, the grime and dirt might scare you.

Our server was cute, fagulous, friendly and very attentive (and yes, that's why he got a 25% tip), but the other one was a heterophobic asshole who kept complaining to some patrons at the bar how he hates it when "straight bitches" come to his restaurant and that he just "hates heteros" (so I hope you guys don't pool tips).

For the sake of our server I wish I could give three stars, but considering the grime, the bathroom, the unmemorable food and the attitude from the other server, I just can't.

PS: oh, and asshole: straight chicks need to eat too. And you're not as cute as you think you are, the nice one is way hotter!
author: Tatjana G.

description: I actually have never been to a diner that was AMAZING! We decided to eat around Castro and we kinda landed in Castro without any research on places to eat. After roaming the streets for about forty minutes we decided to eat here due to the fact that we were now starving. The workers are nice and the diner is small and homey. The food came out fast! The food was good and service was good. I would eat here again. Good food for LATE night eats!
author: You Would Like To Know S.

description: Kitchen open 24hr and you usually get a great show with your diner food.
author: Charlie D.

description:
I only go here late nite when I'm too sober (ha ha) to stumble to Sparky's.  My best butch-impression moment:


Guy to my female friend (drunkenly): HEY *follows us into Orphan Andy's* HEY i'm talking to you, sweetie!

My polite female friend to Guy: Sorry, we're uhm eating now. . . 

Guy to my overly polite female friend: YEAH, I wanna SIT here with YOU.

Me to Guy: LISTEN *expletive* LAY OFF MY FRIEND.  I think the LADY said she Wasn't INTERESTED!


Moral of story: Ah.  Nothing like have a straight fight scene in Orphan Andy's :)  oh, and the food is so-so.
author: Glamorous D.

description:
I love this place.
The folks who work here are a dream...funny, creative, clever, wonderful people!! To eat here is to have an experience. 
OA's always boosts my mood.
The food is diner-licious. 

Please eat here today!!

I LOVE ORPHAN ANDY"S...
author: Claudia B.

description:
OMG, did the waiter just sit down at my booth to take my order? What is this, an Applebee's? Woah, he just trash-talked their own fresh squeezed orange juice! Edgy! He told my friend she was "pushing it" by swapping her eggs for hash browns! Touche!

I know that sounds sarcastic, but I actually love that kinda thing. I also love pancakes at 1am. Pancakes taste better after midnight. It has been proven with science.
author: Vic W.

description: I love going to Orphan Andy's whenever i get from the clubs. The pancakes, french fries and there sandwiches are to die for. I love the taste and the customer service the waiters give. It makes me feel more welcome when I come in there.
author: Cadarious M.

description: I love the burgers, but on more than one occasion they've sent me running....
author: jonathan b.

description:
Points for being open 24 hours, being conveniently located around the corner from the Castro Theatre, and for attracting clientele that includes the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence. 

Points off for surly and unattentive waitstaff who snarl at you when they finally get around to paying any attention. 

Average for the actual food. 

It evens out.
author: Melinda K.

description:
Yummy breakfasts!

I've been here twice in the mornings for breakfasts - once I chose chocolate chip hotcakes and the other trip I chose scrambled eggs and ham along with a couple of hotcakes.  The food was excellent - big, hearty chunks of ham (not the little cubes you see at some joints).  The milk was a bit small for the price, but I can nurse it through the entire flapjack as needed.

The service here is very friendly - very welcoming. It is a nice place to come in to shoot the breeze with a friend over breakfast, especially if you grab a table with a view of Castro and Market streets.  Interesting people watching vantage point.  :)
author: Jamie W.

description:
Yumm...and open 24 hours! I have frequented Bagdad Cafe and even flirted with Sparky's but I have finally found my go-to diner. A stand-up establishment be it post-show Saturday night, weekend brunch, or random mid-day lunch/dinner thing. The staff has always been lovely and usually quite interesting/appealing. Yay for a jukebox with Belle & Sebastian. 

One drawback, during busy times, which is generally always, they won't seat incomplete parties so choose your friends according to timeliness.
author: Angela N.

description: A great cozy alternative to street pizza after time spent in a club or bar in the city! I had the chicken fried steak with gravy on top. It was really juicy, and the gravy was so good, you can just dip anything in it and it transforms the taste. We got there in the nick of time and did not have to wait. I believe it was around 1am, and then people started rolling in and there was a huge line formed for a table. The waiter got really testy when this one group decided to hover over a table when it wasn't cleared. I felt bad for the guy, because I've done the whole waitress bit, and the last thing you want is someone watching you while you clear a former group's table. It's very intrusive, so word of advice...don't do that to him or any other waiter/waitress when you are out.
author: Nancy B.

description: late  night fatty delight. well priced and fast service. Only crappy thing is how small the place is and the seating situation. Be prepared to wait for a table
author: Lauren V.

description:
One of my all time favorite movies is Pulp Fiction. And well the day I had one of those $5 milkshakes (maltshake in this case) from Orphan Andy's reminded me of that specific scene in the movie that went something like this:

Mia: A five dollar shake.
Buddy Holly: How do you want that shake: Martin and Lewis or Amos and Andy?
Mia: Martin and Lewis.
Vincent Vega: Did you just order a five dollar shake?
Mia: Ummhh.
Vincent Vega: That's a shake . . . that's milk and ice cream.
Mia: Last I heard.
Vincent Vega: That's five dollars? You don't put bourbon in it or nothin'?
Buddy Holly: No.
Vincent Vega: Just checking.

Now in this case, I was Vincent Vega and my friend was probably Mia despite the gender switcheroo. My friend was so convinced that Orphan Andy's had in the words of Kanye West "thee best milkshake of all time... of all time!" and me, never being a skeptic decided to take his word for it. At first I was little reluctant, I mean really? $5 for a milkshake? Why not just go to In & Out and throw down the same crinkled five dollar bill and get a cheeseburger, fries AND a shake. That would sound like a more reasonable and realistic action for a cheapskate to do, wouldn't you say? But my friend definitely knew what he was talking about. This milkshake was NOT frothy, fluffy, painstakingly sweet, thick as a poodle, you get what I'm saying-- it was just right. As a matter of fact it was delicious, sweet, almost close to perfection. It was also very chocolately because I did happen to order the chocolate malt while my friend got the vanilla, which also was just as amazing.

Now the only thing I could disagree with is the price. The Vincent Vega in me definitely was not pleased to throw down $13 for two shakes and tip. AND there was no bourbon in the shake?

Note to Self: The next time before dropping by to Orphan Andy's, remember to drop by the closest liquor store and buy a personal bottle of bourbon so I can slip some into my shake. More bang for my buck and more party in my shake.
author: Ally C.

description: I just love this place.   The food is good and the staff is wonderful.  What more could you want?
author: Ed J.

description:
Super Cheap. Super Good. 

Love the service. It's my Sunday breakfast haunt. 

Get the Big 2 if you're going. It's the best price for a good sized breakfast in the city.
author: Darcy V.

description:
Even though I've been going to this place since the mid-80s, I figured that since I've been here not once but TWICE in one week, it deserved a review.

OK, best part is that this place is only closed maybe 2 hours out of the week (for maintenance) and you can pretty much eat anything here at anytime of day. As far as food is concerned, it's decent and doesn't suck because you're pretty much bombed out of your head anyway if you're eating here. Location is perfect if you've spent any time drinking in the Castro that evening. Staff is punchy, friendly, indifferent, depending on who waits on you. Crowd is drunk, sober, quiet, rowdy, and E, all of the above. 

Quote from my dining companion "The Yes Man" from my last visit, "Monte fucking cristo!" Quote from me, "Mmmm (slobber), chicken fried steak and eggs."
author: Rolo T.

description:
I actually loved this place because it DONE DINER GOOD. Seriously folks, this place is a diner. I don't expect amazing service or food. The name should probably indicate that; the word 'orphan' is in the name of the restaurant... come on!

But what you will get is a fulfilling slab of artery clogging deliciousness. I ordered the classic BLT with onion rings and it was probably the best onion rings I've ever had. The friends that were with me thought the same. They ordered a Turkey Reuben and some other monstrously that disappeared in a couple of minutes as well.

On the scale of "Diners" and late night food, this has to top the list... Yet again, I'm a grimy individual with no class.
author: Nick D.

description:
BEST DINER OF MY LIFE!!! I am such a diner whore and I LOVE coming to this place! Not only are they SUPER cheap but the service is ALWAYS super friendly and when there's not too many people around they'll let me bring my pup in with me. The food is your typical diner menu with lil twerks (eg my favorite dish on the menu....buffalo chicken salad...yummm!). It's a cozy lil place you can sit down at and talk and eat with friends for as long as you want. beautiful kites adorn the ceiling and beautiful people adorn the chairs. 
always poppin. always delicious. always fabulous...just like the rest of the Castro! =)
author: Jen S.

description:
All I can say about this is it's all very average. It wasn't too expensive but it wasn't very good either. The only reason my friend and I ate here was because we spent a really long time trying to figure out what we wanted...we pretty much just settled. 

I had an egg salad sand which and it was okay. They went red onion over board though. I still tasted the onion a little after we'd left the restaurant. It also came with fries- which tasted like Mc Donald's fries. It all came down to approximately $7.00
author: Jessica L.

description: When I have the hankering for some diner nostalgia, I head to Orphan Andy's. The food is good, I mean, it's diner food, but the service can turn any frown upside down....24 hours a day! I've never gone at night, but this is always a solid option for a standard weekend breakfast.
author: Leslie T.

description:
We decided to check out Orphan Andy's after a night of heavy drinking.  Obviously, you go get your grub on and hope that the food that you eat will magically soak up the alcohol you consumed.  Maybe the hangover won't be so bad the next morning?  

I believe we arrived at about 1:30 am and the line was out the door.  We put our names on the list and waited outside.  The wait was extremely long!!!  I peered inside and noticed that the restaurant is super small!  No wonder there was a huge wait list and it took forever to get a seat!  I think my apartment is larger than the whole restaurant . . . and that is depressing!!!

For my food review, I guess you can compare this place to a Denny's.  Think Denny's food in a space that is 500 square feet.  You can get American food such as hamburgers and fries.  NEXT!
author: Manton R.

description: For years I was telling people about "this place around the corner from the Castro Theater" - I finally ended up here again and made sure to note the name of the place this time. The cream cheese menu items are genius. Our server was beyond sweet. I like the atmosphere inside. It's not a large place so there was a wait after the bars closed but it turned out to be not too bad since a lot of people before us left. My only real complaint from my last visit is that my sandwich was kind of slopped together - I like a bit of every ingredient in every bite but there were bites that turned out to be all ham or mostly cream cheese, so I had to get in there and redistribute the ingredients inside my sandwich for maximum enjoyment.
author: Cristina C.

description:
I think I should have ordered the chocolate chip pancakes. I had the stuffed french toast, and the separated slab of cream cheese with pre-fab apple pie filling on top didn't really do it for me--I was imagining something more like the stuffed french toast I first had at the Bath St. Inn in Santa Barbara, but alas, that wasn't what I received.

My super attractive gay counterpart was treated like a king, but it took me a few reminders to get a glass of water, even though we sat at the bar. Our waiter was nice, but he really only paid attention to my male friend's needs, as far as our breakfast experience went. 

The hot chocolate was exceptional, though.
author: Caroline C.

description:
Really wonderful diner food. Exactly what you want or would expect from a greasy spoon diner. The menu gives diners exactly what they want. There's even a whole section dedicated to biscuits and gravy! 

As for ambience, I love all the old movie posters on the wall. We had absolutely zero problems with service, but maybe I came at the wrong time to be one of the mistreated ladies I read about. After being served by a number of employees, we had nothing but friendly, speedy service with a smile. And it was rather fun watching them professionally deal with the drunks while keeping the mood light and fun for everyone else. Hard to see why I would go back to Baghdad Cafe with Orphan Andy's just a couple blocks away. Well, except that they don't serve drinks. Oh well. I'd rather have a great grilled turkey melt, or a some tender chicken fingers, or especially the incredibly yummy, better than homemade chicken and vegetable soup. Now THAT hits the spot on a cold, rainy night like we've been having. So welcome after a noir double feature at the Castro Theater.

Oh, and BTW, they don't serve the fried chicken after 10 pm. Boo! But understandable.
author: Veronica L.

description: Meh the food wasn't super tasty. I feel like they switched from fresh cut fries to frozen. My friends "home fries" tasted like boiled potatoes that had been warmed back up. On the bright side his toast was good. Lol. Not my 1st time here, but probably my last. My friend thinks I'm being overly generous with my 3rd star. So I guess this is 2.5 stars.
author: Matt C.

description:
'The food's category:  cafe grease-E(spoon):

The food's only mediocre if you don't talk to the master fry cook at the back:  need I go on?

It's one doze breakfast 24/7 places, bing around for just under 100 years.   .  .    .   begin w/the chicken fried steak, country biscuit & gravy.   .   . CB*

So, lass night I hittem for my personal special:  Hamburger steak grill onions w/ 2 eggs sunnyside AND gravy, as close to LOCO MOCO azzit getts in my neighborhood;  order med/rare and get a perfect medium!  You ketchma drift.  -AND, it comes w/choice of toast and potatoes, three ways, or potatoe salad, or, (an excellent ) cole slaw.  all for UNder $10!
[Avoid the U.Ben's style rice, unless you like it that way.]  

-and, the milk shakes.   .  .

and, killer lemon pound cake/ ala mode (you should see the size of that ice cream scooper!);  the chocolate devil's food layer cake is not 2B sneezed at;  the fruit pies are seasonal.   .   . 

[I have yet to try their other adventurous desserts b coz I have my top 3 favorites already [ref, pls. th'olla reviews here.]

Need I go on?  [All misspellings are on purpose!]

*CHOLESTROL BOMB, BUT WHO CARES?

N JOY
author: Clifford L.

description: I love this place! Authentic Chai, wonderful service, good prices, good food. A nice break from the sometimes-chilly-surly-service in SF. Whether I've gone sober, tipsy, or hung-over, the food always hits the spot!
author: T'Hud W.

description:
I am feelin' this place sometimes and other times it makes me want to hurt someone. It is awesome that it is 24 hrs but everything is hit or miss. Sometimes the fries are awesome, sometimes you get soap in your drink.  Go to the bathroom before you go, theirs is nasty.  Breakfast is  usually better fare than dinner and don't expect to see more than 2 women in the resturant at a time. The staff is super busy, and understaffed most of the time, so sometimes it takes forever just to pay. It's an "I am starving" @ 2am last resort. At 2 you don't even care that, yes, that is soap in your coke.
Update:
Gained a star. Best Biscuts and Gravy breakfast.
author: Autumn R.

description:
I love this place when I'm like trashed and want some onion rings, or if I wake up in the morning after I got trashed and want a spanish omelette, or if i'm trashed and want a tuna sandwich which I projectiled all over some poor citizen's doorstep on my 21'st birthday.

Breakfast is definitely one of the best in the castro.  This place has been open forEVER so you know it has to be pretty decent.  The staff is a little unaccomodating sometimes but it is understandable when they have to deal with drunk people all night in that kind of environment, I have been a waiter so I won't ride them too hard on that.  Oh JEFF is the best waiter by the way!  They have a great blue cheese burger, biscuits and gravy, homemade soup, chili, it's kind of like one of those highway side diners that's just been picked up and plopped in the castro.  It's definitely got a couple of healthy options, but overall the food is good 'ol stuff your face american food, which will definitely get you through one of those cravings!  OH, and it's not overpriced.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
I went here to get breakfast with my boyfriend. It was a busy Saturday morning so we did have a bit of a wait for our food, but it was definitely tasty. 

I had a some tasty hamburger meat, juicy and delicious and the potatoes were fantastic. My server was good on keeping my coffee mug and water glass filled, which is good because I go through 8 cups of coffee pretty quick. 

Service was good. Friendly, and talkative, but not to the point where it was annoying. 

It was reasonably priced, not cheap but not expensive, the seating was comfortable and the atmosphere is nice - neat things on the wall and kites on the ceiling.

The only real complaint I have is the bathroom...it is clearly geared towards men (I realize it's the castro and most things are geared towards men, but come on, please!). When I sat down I had to spread my legs really far because just having them bent made them hit against the door. The sink is on the outside of the bathroom in case you find yourself desperately searching.
author: Vanessa T.

description: If not for its location, this restaurant would be out of business. I ordered the fish and chips and could not bring the fish down my throat.....the food's that bad. Really disappointing restaurant.
author: Joe M.

description:
If it's late, you're drunk, and you need food, then it might be good.  But otherwise, there's better around.  The place does well because it's right next to the watering holes.

The staff was delightfully eccentric, however.  I went on a Sunday morning and had standard breakfast fare.  It was, well, fair.  It wasn't all that crowded for me.  But I've been to better greasy spoons in my time.
author: Nathan N.

description:
Late night, it's really nice to have a place that serves a full menu of decent food. I'm always happy to grab a burger here when everything else is closed.

On the weekends, I'd go somewhere else for brunch. It's a small place, not kept up very well, and the service is lacking. You'll have to ask for a refill on your coffee, and there will probably be bits of the last patron's breakfast in the jam jar-- butter is slapped onto bread haphazardly, and omelets are woefully under-filled.  

Keep this place as your midnight rendezvous.
author: Heather M.

description:
I have to give Andy's 5 stars, because I've never had a bad meal every time I've been here in the last 6 years I've lived here.  It's always delicious. Food is always served quick and I've never waited more than 15 minutes.  

I had the tastiest Strawberry Malt here last week.  As I write this I'm craving biscuits and gravy.  And a malt. Damn.
author: Joanne D.

description:
Solid diner food.  Great service.  It wasn't packed when I went in with my group of 5; we got seated right away (10AM 1-1-08).  Awesome eggs/pancakes/coffee/steak/toast but the bacon left a little to be desired.  maybe it's too thin... or it's deep fried... something was a little off.

4 Stars for exactly what I expected from a little diner... with great service to boot.  It's not fancy food, but that's not what a little diner is for.  Good bacon would have gotten a 5.

Bathroom is small but cheery and clean.  Great effort here.  Thanks for keeping it clean!  I will return to a place that has a clean bathroom over awesome food anyday.  If they don't keep the public areas clean, why would they keep the kitchen clean?  OK, that's a bit of a rant... and has nothing to do with this diner.  But it's still true.
author: Bruce W.

description:
My favorite place for biscuits and gravy: mmm mmmm mmmmm! I usually go for breakfast but the few other dishes I've had have all been good. I really like the wait staff, too. It's like an old fashioned diner in the heart of the Castro -- I love the pterodactyls and other beastie kites that hang from the ceiling most of the year.

It gets busy on the weekend so the early bird gets the B&G! Oh, they're open 24 hours, too!
author: Dave R.

description: This place gets worse and worse by the second.  Since I work in the neighborhood, I am a frequent visitor of this place so one would think I would get better service since half the staff recognizes me, and the other half hits on either myself or my co-workers.  However, the service is TERRIBLE, and sparkys isnt much better, though the food is! here is the typical OA's dining out experience, getting ignored by the server and seating yourself, having them come by one time to take your order, dropping off the food, and then you having to get their attention for everything else including the check...they are tooo busy sitting down at the bar talking, or worse eating right in front of customers! Seriously, I am done with this place...I understand being a bitch to tourists...but come on...not to someone who eats there 3 times a week....get a clue
author: John H.

description:
I'd agree with Mana K's "okay for an all night diner." I'd also add that the "cream cheese stuffed french toast with apples" has an appeal but I haven't mustered the courage to order it. Anyone know how it is?

Gus had a friend who worked at OA's many years ago. There's a low overhang on the way to the bathroom and there was a tinfoil roll there that was great for the staff. They could pluck off a piece to fashion a pipe, go to the bathroom, and return energized. Go figure.
author: Tyler S.

description:
Old friend of mine took us here one night after drinking. My first thoughts were nice,a little small but alright.The food was decent,but the characters that walked in were by priceless. It was a joy and quite fun.I have told other's about this place.

The food is decent and the people who work there are friendly.
author: Dani D.

description:
"Excuse me, where's the restroom?"

"Feel free to walk through our kitchen where we prepare food to use our restroom.  Oh and when your finished, please feel free to wash your hands in the same sink our cooks do. Can I get you anything else."

"The check please."
author: Jamie B.

description:
What's open 24 hours, is very inviting, and has the BEST pancakes in town?

That's right, Orphan Andy's.

This is one of my favorite places, never had problems with the service, or the food. In fact, I've been hit on by some of the staff, and that simply cements the place as a "must go to" location.

BEST pancakes. I kid you not.
author: Dave M.

description: Orphan Andy's was a 24 hour greasy spoon diner with lots of character and attitude.  I asked for a breakfast with only egg whites and was refused, he didn't want to be bothered to separate the whites from the yolk.  The coffee was bad.
author: George L.

description: This place has cool decor, but i have to still give it a 1 for food and 1 for service.  The fish and chips was well done and greasy, actually pretty disgusting.  The side salad looked past its expiration date.  Waiter very in attentive and aloof.  If you are looking for good food, I would go somewhere else.  If looking to hang out in a cool-looking place,this place is for you, just order a beverage, though.
author: Sabrina H.

description:
Service is mostly surly and slow.
Parking can be a pain, but late at night it seems to be a bit easier.
Usually, food is edible but inconsistent, typically diner-like.
Need to bring cash to pay (pretty sure no plastic accepted).
Keep coming here because it's open 24-hours and close to home.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I'm glad to see this place hasn't changed much since I lived here. Too many shops on the Castro go missing between my visits back home. 

The food is decent... not top notch, but I don't have high expectations for a 'greasy spoon' diner. The service is always pleasant when I come in, and it's not too cramped, despite the size of the place.
author: Tiger W.

description:
Trust this review at your own risk since I was totally intoxicated and weren't sure myself if I would eat here sober. 

We shared the Short-stack Banana Pancake and the Three Egg Omelet with Provolone & Mushroom, Home Fries& Wheat Toast.  I remembered the generous serving of banana pancakes were  delicious and the home fries were very flavorful.  I have absolutely no recollection as to what the Omelet tasted like. 

The food was probably greasy but I didn't think there was any sign of bacon grease. As a drunken vegetarian at 2:30am, I was content to have grab a bite here :-). 3.5 stars.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
If you are in the mood for a good plate of home style, American, diner-esqe food, and HATE Mel's like me, then check out this place. It's smack dab in the center of the Castro, is always busy, has cute help, but is to die for when you want that kind of a meal.

I recommend the meatloaf sandwich...don't tell Mom but it was better than hers. Shhhhh!
author: Allison P.

description:
3.5 - loved the pancakes - they are huge and buttery and fabulous.  Actually I was a huge piggie when we came here for breakfast and ordered two scrambled eggs with the pancakes and the scrambled eggs were perfectly done too.  The BF got the Spanish omelet and must have liked it because he ate every last bite.  
This place is quaint and  has really great service.  I love that it is open 24 hours a day -- and there is always lots of people watching to do here too.
author: Katie P.

description: This is a late night favorite. Food is always on time and prepared the way you want it. Well, as far as I can remember... Those late intoxicating nights, you know.
author: Thomas Nathan S.

description:
It's a good thing I don't make new year's resolutions about how I'm going to eat less or eat more healthily because this year's would have lasted all of four days!

I found myself here, after several dozen cocktails, diving into a chicken fried steak and eggs.  I liberally buttered my english muffin and I loved it all!  Until I woke up the next morning.
author: Marcus C.

description:
Years ago one midnight, locked out of my apt., waiting for my partying roommates to come home, I'm walking in the rain and see bright neon lights in the distance --- Orphan Andy's.  Easily distracted by shiny things, I enter. 

It's warm and inviting and the staff is friendly.  I ordered breakfast, pulled out a book and read, waiting for the bars to close.  At the booth next to me were four beautiful drag queens.  They had come in around 1:30am, ordered breakfast and were now huddled over the bill.

Drag Queen No.1: "Help me with the tip."

Drag Queen No. 2:  "It's something to do with the tax, either double it or cut in half. No wait, that's my meds."

Drag Queen No. 3:  "Here's a tip: Never wear that color again."

Drag Queen No. 4:  "And never wear pearls in the shower."

As they passed my table, they smiled, one winking, as they left.
author: Cary Y.

description:
I have lived in the neighborhood for almost 30 years (the entire time Orphan Andy's has been open).  While it has always been the 'local greasy spoon' and nothing more, I must say that over time, their attitude toward their customers has gotten tiresome.

You certainly do not go there for the quality of the food--that is understood.  Most items go right from the freezer into the frier.  But their rude treatment of customers (not all the time, but way too often) has really gotten out of hand.

It is almost as if they think it is cute to chastise paying customers loudly in front of the entire (small) restaurant for the smallest of infractions.  

I just cannot force myself to go there again, even given the convenience of the location and the 24/7 hours.  I believe I will be trekking to Sparky's for future late night burgers and early morning breakfasts.

Orphan Andy--shame on you for the way you treat people.
author: Terry H.

description:
Orphan Andy's....I wish you could be better.......Having a nice breakfast place near my house would be awesome when I don't feel like cooking, but man the food was just ok. The waiters are very fun and welcoming. They greet you as soon as you come in, and seat you very quickly. The food was a bit slow to come out, but it just looks sad when it is set in front of you. 

Pros: Great service. They call you "Sweety" and "Honey"! 

Cons: The food was slow to come out. The food was so mediocre that I wanted to go home and cook myself something better.
author: Chris D.

description: Great little place for an after hour breakfast, or very early morning pick me up. Always order the omelets, hash browns, & coffee. Its a hole in the wall convenient quick fix, so don't expect a night at The Ritz
author: Robert R.

description: Typical diner food for a tiny little 24 hour place.  For some reason though, if you want to get something to eat at any of the night, the Castro has a couple of places to choose from.  I'd imagine this place would be ridiculous when it's crowded, but when it's not, it's a great place for food and conversation with friends.  The prices aren't terribly expensive and the servers are cute cute cute.  I will keep this place in mind next time someone wants a late night snack.
author: Amy J.

description:
Orphan Andy's is wonderful. HUGE breakfast and open 24/7, what else can one ask for in their neighborhood.

Needless to say I order the breakfast preety much everytime. I have ordered the rueben good but not great. So my advice stick with the breakfast.
author: Nichole M.

description:
Love that Orphan Andy's is open 24 hours.

Don't like the drunkards at 1 in the morning. But that's not Orphan Andy's fault. 

Their Chicken Tenders Sandwich is pretty good. The chicken pieces are kinda big for the sandwich and some pieces don't fit... but that just means you have more chicken tenders for dipping!  I've had better chicken sandwiches but since Orphan Andy's is conveniently located and is open 24 hours, it's a-ok in my book!
author: Christine C.

description:
I rate this place a lil under average for the quality of the food. It is your typical average busy late night diner, serving you mediocre food. 

We decided to grab a bite to eat on the way home, and upon arriving a 2am to a crowded Orphan Andy's we had to put our name down. Roughly 20 mins is what the guy informed us. Took awhile for him to even get to us to write our name down, then immediately informed that we have to stand outside. 

Brrrr...roughly 20 mins or so later we ask how much longer. And was told in a slightly irritated voice, there are still 3 parties ahead of us. So we said ok, and then got scolded to go back outside (geezeus its cold, & we're not in your way...later to find an older couple waiting inside.. not to be cold hearted, but why do they get to wait inside?). 

So finally sitting down, I ordered a turkey burger and my bf, Chicken fried steak. Overall, the food wasn't that spectacular..especially for the wait. It was just okay, but not horrible. You can order the burger with fries, or they have diet plates which come with a side of cottage cheese & pineapple. 

Weirdest part: bathroom. You go down the stairs thru the kitchen and one your right is a tiny bathroom with a toilet, barely enough room between u & the door to bend down to pee. Sink, outside the bathroom which oddly seemed like where they washed either the dishes or food, because food remnants were lingering...hmmm kinda yucky? 

Well the place is just okay. A very small diner, and open 24hrs for your late night junk food cravings...
author: Catherine O.

description:
Our server told me I was a lucky girl when the fiance went outside to go throw up on the curb after a night of drinking on an empty stomach. I liked him, its true, I am a lucky girl. He called me "hun" a lot.

The food was adequate and average, its 24 hours, not bad.
author: kate r.

description: Burger the size of my fucking head and a pile of fries. I could go for a little a little less quantity and a little more quantity or flavor but over all pretty standard diner food and nice waiters.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
Orphan Andy's is an okay diner, and a bit small, unfortunately, they really need to work on their service.
They had gotten a few things on some orders wrong and after we finally got their attention (by having to get up from the table and approach a server), those errors were corrected. also, they need to remember that if a dinner order comes with a salad, you -don't- bring the salad at the same time as the meal, which resulted in a cold steak. Their response when this was brought to their attention when the food had arrived was rather dismissive.
The food was okay, unfortunately, their green beans tasted and had the texture of the canned variety and someone else's order felt as if the food was sitting under a warmer for a bit.
So, 
Food: 3 stars
Service: -1 stars
author: D R.

description:
God bless the stereotypical gays+. Not only are they immaculately tidy+ and ever so sweet+, but they like to party party party+. Which means they need a place to come (down) after an all-nighter. So it wasn't a shock that when looking up a 24-hour breakfast joint after a marathon comedy gig downtown, the search led us to the Castro.


 The four in our party made our way to Orphan Andy's and grabbed a booth, tucked in tight+ like a can of Vienna sausages+ or cocktail wieners+. Obviously, these booths are made for people who work out and stay thin+! No matter - once seated, you get to take in the kitschy+, fabulous+ hodgepodge of interior decor+ like Tiffany lamps+ and butterfly+ kites+ that would seem out of place at a greasy spoon diner in any other neighborhood. Furthering the comfort is a deeply packed+ jukebox featuring loads+ of positive, upbeat dance+ tracks that can give anyone a bit of a morning pick-me-up.


 Swaying+ to a bit of Prince we chowed down on our diner breakfasts. Admittedly, the food is nothing to write your dear, beloved, field-hockey-playing+ Aunt Francine about, but for around $7-8 a head, it's nothing to get in a huff and call in the Navy+ over, either. The eggs are cooked to order, the sausage links are large and juicy+ and the bacon's just fine. Their maple syrup, on the other hand, is on the thin and runny side - not rich, sweet and thick+ like one would normally like.


 All joking and innuendo aside, Orphan Andy's is a solid place to pick up some greasy American food at decent prices at any time of the day, with the added bonus of getting your groove on to a snazzy jukebox. And really, is there anything more one could ask from an all-night diner? Orphan Andy, you'll always have a home in my insomniac heart.


 +This review is based on positive stereotypes of the LGBT community. And really, are positive stereotypes so bad? I'm half Asian and I love that I can be hired on the basis of my innate math skills. And being half Middle Eastern, it's awesome that people can look to me to defuse a bomb. So before you go on reporting me, just think of all the great things pre-conceived notions have done for you!
author: Omid T.

description:
I haven't had any problems with this place...

The selection is not to great but the food is decent at 2:30am!

The servers always seem helpful at 2:30am!

All in all not bad!
author: Jorge D.

description:
It's great to have a late night food option in the Castro that isn't pizza.  Orphan Andy's has some pretty good pluses:  It's clean, It's bathroom is clean, the food is ok, its not too loud (great for when you have a hangover), and the service staff is friendly(ish).
There are some negatives too.  Catch your waitstaff on a bad day and you'll be treated like garbage.  There can be long lines after closing time or on the weekend.  The food while ok isn't stellar, it's just food.  Mind you at 3am ok diner food tastes delicious!
author: Michael D.

description: absolutely my FAVE allnight diner in SF area now. Food good. Onion rings like no others & thats a good thing. Make sure you ask questions about menu so you know what your getting. Monte Christo was a complete miss. As you may have guessed all was saved by the much needed upgrade in service.  After yrs of poor snooty service they finally get it. SF is a city that has to deliver great service and with a smile. We can proudly boast Orphan Andys has David the burningman Bostonian transplant that gets it. Yeah David..thx You.
author: Bryan G. W.

description:
I went there the other day for brunch and got a spinach and feta cheese omelette as well as fresh OJ and coffee. It was ok, except for the potatoes, which weren't very good at all. Pretty much what you'd expect from a 24 hour diner. The staff seemed to have a good rapport with some of the others sitting at the counter.

For this kind of greasy American diner food, there are a few better places (such as Home and Sparky's) just a few blocks away.
author: John C.

description:
John Umipeg:  Mathew at Orphan Andy's thinks that he can get away with mistaken my "over easy eggs" with "scrambled" just because he is so dam cute and I have a huge crush on him>HE IS TOTALLY RIGHT!!!
Food: 
Breakfast is really good if you are hungry, real good portions, but kind of greasy, 
Service: depends who serves you from totally attentive to sarcastic to really bad but for the most part its Good!
author: john u.

description: The go-to place for the Club-goers of the Castro area to go to and satisfy their late night cravings! Good food! Service could be nicer...
author: Lorénz B.

description:
Falls short of five stars because the prices (including charging for all of the little extras) are all a bit more than what a diner should charge. But then again, Orphan Andy's serves up excellent diner grub, and the service is nothing short of fantastic.

Get one of the two window seats if you can and scope out all of the coming-and-going on Market & Castro.
author: Derek R.

description:
I was super excited about this place.....really. I'm originally from Maine and get a little fed-up with the San Francisco snobbery sometimes. I hunger for a greasy spoon that won't cost me $15 for some eggs and bacon.

ANYWAY....Orphan Andy's has a nice ambiance. It's clean, but not pretentious....aside from the guy at the counter with a....possibly affected British accent? BUT my home fries were luke-warm at best, the bacon mostly fat (though done to the right degree of chewiness) and my eggs RUNNY. I'm not normally squeamish, but I might contract salmonella. 

In all fairness, my boyfriend loved his Denver omelet...albeit being greasy and there was fresh squeezed OJ, but it's pretty damn difficult to eff up a bacon and egg breakfast, isn't it?

I might go back drunk at 2am (because it's open 24hrs), but only if I'm drunk....or desperate.
author: Eli B.

description:
This place is open 24 hours, in a town that goes to bed at 11pm.
Food is just okay.
author: K W.

description:
Another Castro's institution, oh my eyes got all misty just thinking about these places, lol.
I like Orphan Andy's there is something special about this place, not the food tho.  Still go from time to time, the food is not bad, standard American breakfast fare.
If you are new to Castro, visit Orphan Andy's, that way you can say that you've been there.
author: John L.

description:
You'll never find another place quite like this.  My husband and I go together, it's perfect for two, booth seating.  Incredible pancakes, dependable egg dishes.  Interesting twists on some old school plates.

Best part is the waitstaff, so welcoming, so friendly, they make you feel like you're eating at their house.

Window seating let's you watch the dog tied outside, too.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I went here this passed weekend after craving some breakfast food in the afternoon. My friend referred this place so we went. The place is small but it hits the spot for sure!

The two guys in the front were funny and interesting to talk with. They were nice and friendly. 

I ordered the omelet with bell peppers, grilled onions, and ham with a side of pancakes. The pancakes were oh-so delicious! The omelet didn't come with cheese since I forgot that is extra which shouldn't be.

The food was real good and the environment was awesome.

Two thumbs up!
author: Jay C.

description:
This is a teeny little restaurant. I got the veggie burger and fries and it was really really good!

My boyfriend liked his food, too!
author: Stacy M.

description: Went after club hopping in the "STRO".  I've never noticed this place before but maybe because I really don't hang in the castro. The food was great and we got seated really quickly even at 2am when it was packed. Ordered the pancakes & bacon and it was REALLY good or I was just that drunk.  I will most def eat there again.
author: Marc F.

description: Best chocolate-chip banana pancakes I've ever had!
author: Albert Paris W.

description: AWESOME shakes, great diner food, witty/funny/cute servers... OPEN 24HRS!!
author: Ray C.

description: Very nice staff. Very blah food. I had the chilli and asked for extra sour cream, which I got. It was OK, but this is probably the spot at 2am and not really at any other time.
author: Josh F.

description:
Could there be better employees? you got to know how to approach a place like this first, to fully understand the factors which reside inside. For me, i enjoy picking up food from this place, cause when I'm wasted & want to sit down it's more near Its Top's or Grubsteak. Service will always be on a temperamental scale in a place like this unless you go there around 5pm, or something. Go at like 10 & up and don't be sober, you won't like it...

I go with the same thing, fries & a veggie burger w/ cheddar & grilled onions. Something happened and I ended up with some slices of bacon on it. Rather displeased, I made a quick call & Bill was graciously understanding & replaced it. I thank, I forget who, but he remembered my exact order & he said he reads this but, I call it the vbcgo.
author: og c.

description: Wonderful staff. Nothing like pancakes with a chocolate malt on the side. Couldn't stand up right for the rest of the night, but was totally worth it!
author: Shawna Q.

description:
This is one of my son's favorite restaurants.  He loves to sit at the counter and the wait staff is always nice to him.  For a while we were going so often they pretty much knew us (which probably says something bad about me as a parent, but hey, we had just moved here and things were hectic. Don't judge!). 

Their burgers are delicious, and when they have fried chicken on the menu, it's yummy!  Their chicken soup is really good as well.  We've also had their shakes and chocolate cake.  Basically this is your friendly, Castro-neighborhood diner with food to match.

I do have to take one star away for the absolutely abhorrent state of their bathroom. YECH.  Gross, cramped, and reminds me of a gas-station toilet I vaguely remember being taken into when I was a wee tot.  Even at that age, I was too finicky to go in there. I'm not asking for the Bloomie's bathroom, but just...clean it up or something.

Basically everything they have on the menu is spot-on, delicious diner fare.  We've never been disappointed, and when you're out late, you can't go wrong stopping in here.  Unless you're a girl who has to pee.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Well, they're open, right?  The service staff always look ten degrees of either miserable or pissed off, but who can blame them, considering the guests at 3 in the morning?

In all fairness the food isn't bad and after a night of partying, it's nice to take in an artery clogging amount of American comfort food.
author: Susan C.

description:
I always get the chicken fried steak, here it comes smothered with a white gravy and a biscuit with your choice of side and soup or salad for $10.50. 
It will fill you up thats for sure!! I asked for crispy fries but they were a bit soggy. This place will hit the spot after an afternoon of boozing it up on Castro. Very clean, good service.
author: Bill B.

description:
I've been coming here off and on for years.  It's always a mixed bag.   There have been times when the service is terrific, and there are other times when it's execrably bad.  I stopped coming in for a couple of years once because my companion and I were ignored for twenty minutes while the staff schmoozed among themselves.

One star's for being open twenty-four hours.  The other star is for the times when the service works and the food is edible.

I had an early morning recently and came in about 5:30.  It wasn't terribly busy.  My server was quite attentive until I had placed my order.  I waited for quite a while.  I watched an employee make his own breakfast and sit down next to me and begin to eat.  I looked over and saw the kitchen empty and my food sitting on the serving ledge.  I called attention to it before getting it myself, and it was brought over with no apology or acknowledgment.  The eggs, ordered over easy, were raw inside.  I'm not talking runny.  I can deal with runny.  I don't know how the cook managed to get the outsides cooked enough to stay together and have the insides remain raw.  The potatoes, obviously boiled in advance, were burned one side and cold on the other.  The link sausages and toast were fine.

Now, granted, this place doesn't pretend to be more than a greasy spoon, but I left that morning wondering if I'd have done better to go hungry.
author: Earline A.

description:
This is the gayest diner I've ever been to, with the exception of Universal grill in NYC.

It's fun, the food quality is spotty, you'll hit your head on the way to the John, it's kinda pricey (but rent in this spot is probably crazy high), wait service ranges from testy to overly attentive (nudge-nudge wink-wink). 

I wouldn't change a thing.   I love Andy's. Pure San Francisco.
author: stephan k.

description:
Stumbling to my car after a night of clubbing. I tripped across this hole in the wall diner at 2am!

- Menu= typical
- Quality = eh not too far from Denny's w/ a funny old man cooking in the back.
- Staff= gorgeous and gay
- Ambiance= quaint

VEggie Friendly: Somewhat
author: ashley l.

description: I am so ashamed of myself. After cuttin' some less than flattering shapes at local Q Bar, some foody fiends convinced me that 2.30am was the perfect time to consume a double cheesburger! I NEVER do this (let's omit uni days here). Why does fast food always taste better post-club? Very cute diner, attentive staff who were keen to tell us on multiple occasions: 'This is California, no booze after 2'. Boo sucks.
author: inspirationjunkie

description:
Although it has been so long since I have had a full meal here, I am giving this place 5 stars based on their MILKSHAKES!!!  They are THE BEST.  They are al natural.....Also, order a side of fries with ranch dressing....you'll be one happy (and a few pounds heavier) camper!

Yum!
author: Jackie M.

description: I went to Andy's to get a cup of coffee to go today, paid and then looked around for the tip jar. I didn't see one so the employee who poured my coffee said "Oh you can just give it to me." So, I handed him a "dime" and he said "Oh look it's a dime!" I was so embarrassed and mad. I put the milk and sugar in my coffee and felt I needed to say something to this rude employee. I called him over and told him how (extremely) rude he was to comment on the tip I handed him. Then, with no apology he said "you know I have to take the street car."  With comments and behavior like that he will never get enough $ for the street car!
author: Leslie B.

description: great little place, love the opening hours, have always had friendly service whether I'm drunk at 2 am or during day, prices reasonable, greasy food, i love the mushroom burger.  ill be back. not many places open 24 hours .
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Orphan Andy's is GREAT. My husband and I (YES!) are (gay) tourists from Europe, and we ended up going to Andy's every day during our stay in San Francisco - either for breakfast, lunch or dinner. 

The food is very good, though a bit more greasy than we are used to, but the staff is absolutely terrific. There are not many diners where the waiters hug the guests and give them a farewell kiss on the cheeck on the final day of their visit, but that's what happened to us. 

If you cannot take a bit of gay bitching you should not come here. I you can you will have a great time. 

We can't wait to come back to San Francisco, and Orphan Andy's will be one of the first places we re-visit. Thanks for the memories, guys,
author: Peter A.

description: Incredibly consistent and tasty breakfast and greasy spoon fare. Have been eating here since the mid80s and it nor the VERY colorful waitstaff ever manage to dissapoint.
author: Rick N.

description: There is not to much to say about this place. Although eclectic and unique, the food is bad and the service is worse. Not to mention the location of the restroom on the back of the kitchen! That seems unhealthy.
author: Viktor G.

description: Okay.....this is very very gay in here......Open 24/7. Breakfast all day long- my favorite meal of the day - has an awesome variety of choices with generous portions of food. My favorite was the bacon omelette - huge pieces of bacon with home fries, choice of toast with butter, decent coffee and a comparable price to what in the neighborhood. The servers are very friendly and  make the place full of entertainment. Its never a dull moment in here!
author: Pierce B.

description: they were really nice, and that still didn't help me eat the food.  they were so cool that when i didn't like my soup they offered me the other for free instead... i just wasn't into it.  kites on the ceiling are super cool and maybe the other food is better.
author: Jo A.

description: Awsome!!! At 2:00 in the morning on a Sat you gotta expect it to be kinda crowded. But other than that.....we got our food in less than 15min (there were 3 of us), two orders of wings, a ceasar salad, some home fries and two over easy eggs later.....I'm home after one of the most satisfying, after bar, meals ever!! ONE OF MY FAVORITES!
author: Ike H.

description:
decent enough food - standard diner fare - but the service is laughably bad.  The two guys who work the morning shift (kilt guy with fugly piercings and bitter 50'ish ammiano soundalike) are just awful but they've been there forever so I guess the management doesn't care.
They just seem teribly aloof, talk loudly about how useless the kitchen staff are, and just generally don't do their jobs.  Shame.
Guess it's minimum wage + middle-age = bitter ol' queen.
author: David P.

description: In the Castro late night diner triple play show down, I can't back Orphan Andy's.  In comparison to it's Baghdad and Sparky's competition, I think it comes in at the bottom.  This place is a greasy spoon sans the spoon (like you really might not get silverware).  It's better than a Denny's, but that extra star is awarded only for character.
author: Luke M.

description: Came here after a drunk night in the Castro many years ago. Seems like a cliche based on other reviews, but it's the truth! I was really hammered so I don't know how trustworthy my review is but these were some of the best pancakes I have ever had. Interesting characters there for people watching as well.
author: Sandy S.

description: I've been going here for many years, and I love this place.  It's bright and very clean, and they serve up good, old fashioned, American food, very fast, and at a great price.  The waiter Michael is the best.
author: Eddie W.

description: I had the chocolate chip pancakes, two eggs, with bacon and sausage combo. Yeah, talk about a heart attack :). The bacon's life was destroyed after they left these sad pieces in the pan until they carbonized. I'd be embarrassed to serve bacon like this if I made it at home. The chocolate chip pancakes were like specialty's cookies on a larger scale. I was into them, but the butter on top was enough to make my heart skip a beat. Waitress was nice and friendly. I just didn't feel the meal and won't be back anytime soon :/.
author: Michael S.

description: Nom nom nom! While writing this review... A good spot to try and sober up after a crazy of night of drinking. The stuffed french toast was a slab of cream cheese placed between two pieces of  toast. It was pretty mediocre. My friend had the chicken tenders which she enjoyed. My other friend had the mushroom omelet yumm-o!
author: Dorothy M.

description: Open late.  The desserts here are great.  Had the peacan pie with a huge scoop of vanilla ice cream.  The peacan pie was not as heavy as I thought it would be.  The Strawberry shake was also awesome!
author: Barry Y.

description: This place is a joke. The servers are rude and unapologetic. (not you mention they have a problem with women) I could go into the whole reason I walked out of this place last night (even b4 my food arrived) but all anyone really needs to know is the service is awful and certainly not worth your money.
