description: i went for a daytime brunch with friends, so i can't comment on the late-night atmosphere, but for brunch i thought it was great - the food was delicious, our server (who i like to think was orphan andy) was hilarious, and the decor and crowd were just what i wanted to be surrounded by that early on a saturday morning.  we decided that when i move back to san fran, orphan andy's will be where we meet for a celebratory milkshake :).
author: ali l.

description: i must have been here at least 4 times, all at strangest hours (either very early in the morning, or very late in the evening).  nothing much to say about the food, but i'd like to say they've got very good service!!!  last time, i voiced out why the staff was grumpy-looking, & he explained that they're about to change shifts.  he quickly apologized, and then went out of his way to make the whole experience well worth the return trip.
author: Jerome Espinosa B.

description: oh orphan andy's, there is a place in my heart for you.  you were my first.  you were the first for me in san francisco.   i was so young and so naive, and we bumped into each other somewhat mysteriously.  you cradle me when i drink too much.  you hold my hair back when i get sick the next morning.  you host me and my out of town guests.  you are there when i am alone and can't think of any place i would rather spend the night.  i will always love you, no matter how many places i've been since the first time we met.
author: regina k.

description: They're one of the few places in SF where I can buy a French Dip.  And they do a great job!  I've been to the restaurant on several occasions over the last 13 years and have always had a pleasant experience.  Great service and always a good vibe in the resto.
author: Scott S.

description: The food is really good diner food, especially the pancakes.  I've never heard anything but praise for them.  The service does suck often, but sometimes they are friendly.
author: IMHeAsURHe B.

description: Any place that will serve delicious breakfast food at 2:00am is a god-send in my book.  The fact that is open and alive 24/7 (or at least whenever I'm in the mood to go there) already makes this diner more appealing than most food places in the Bay Area.  The great food and friendly, entertaining staff just add to the appeal of this classic nighttime venue.  I have never actually gotten anything that wasn't a breakfast item from Orphan Andy's, but I guarantee that the french toast and pancakes are to die for.
author: Patrick S.

description: my friend was hysterical with hunger. i was pretty starving too. i hate eating late, its bad for you, but i had barely eaten anything all weekend... its hard to find time. so at after midnite on a sunday night, there wasnt a lot open. greasy pizza ew. we went to orphan andys and people come here all the time but this was the first time i actually ate. i was bullied into eating. i got a turkey burger and it was good. i think that it was $8 or so dollars and you get fries too. my friend was so hungry he got steak and eggs and homefries and toast. the steak was fatty he didnt like his food too well it was bland but he ate it all he was hungry. i said well its a diner what can you expect. which is why you should get a burger. the waiter was very patient and not superfriendly but gave good service. the other time i've been in there and didnt eat they had good service too. they asked us a few times if theres anything we needed. some girls wrote that they got less service cuz they were girls i didnt find that at all. its a restaurant, why should they care. i would go back if i want more diner food or late at nite food. :)
author: Merredith L.

description: this place doesn't not get a 5-star rating for its food, which is basically right out of the back of a sysco services delivery truck, but it is comfort food when and where you need it.  they also have delightful characters working there, including a beautiful boy who washed dishes - i recommend sitting at the counter for the best view of him - and i have never been there when i wasn't comfortable striking up a conversation with other customers.  in other words, if you have to dine alone, this place is great.  i just love the juxtaposition of mom food (chicken fried steak - yum!) and drag queens, or whoever else might be there.  a little corner of normalcy in the castro, but with all the neighborhood flair.  i've never been there during "after bar", but i can imagine ...
author: christopher b.
